story:
?

TRICHOCEREUS: THE SAN PEDRO GROUP

Hi Guys, this is Patrick from Trichocereus.net and the Trichocereus Facebook Group! If you are involved in the Trichocereus Community, you probably heard that I was working on a book about Trichocereus pachanoi and other related species from the San Pedro Group for a couple years now. Well, time flies and I am happy to announce that this book is finally getting close to a release date. 

I been a cactus grower & enthusiast for at least 20 years. I spent most of my adult life studying the Genus Trichocereus and this book is the result of my (still ongoing) work in this particular field. The book is called TRICHOCEREUS: THE SAN PEDRO GROUP and contains hundreds of photos as well as information about the botany of the San Pedro Group. The book will published in May or June 2016 and consists of more than 300 pages filled up with cool stuff and photos taken by me, friends or well known faces in the Trichocereus Growers community!
Our Facebook Group with almost 3000 members helped to support this project like a wall and I am extremely proud that I was given the chance to write and publish it now! 

When I announced that there will be a printed edition of my book, I was overwhelmed with messages and mails from people who wanted to pre-order it that very day. But since this book will have a lot of all-color pages, the printing costs exceeded my funds by far.  
And that´s where this crowdfunding campaign comes into play.
With this campaign, I want to raise enough money to print enough copies for all the people who been looking forward to this project for months. The more money I will raise, the more books I will print. 
 With that said; there will only be a very limited number of books available and I expect them to sell out fast. There will be 250 books available for everyone who supports this project with an amount of at least 58 Euro. There also are other perks for people who just want to support this project without buying a book as well as a high quality Hardcover Connoisseur Edition that is a little bit more expensive. 

Here are some specifics about the book:

TRICHOCEREUS: THE SAN PEDRO GROUP contains over 300 all-color pages and hundreds of photos showing plants, flowers and fruits.
This book is all about the botany and taxonomy of the San Pedro cactus and its relatives. It includes classic descriptions as well as new information about Trichocereus pachanoi & its related species like Trichocereus bridgesii, Trichocereus scopulicola, Trichocereus peruvianus or some of the rather unofficial names like Trichocereus huanucoensis or the commercial variety Tom Juuls Giant. And this is just the tip of the iceberg. There are Latin descriptions that I dug out from 100 year old books, macro photos showing flowers and fruits and a practical chapter about the care of this great group of plants! In addition I share some in-depth information about raising Trichocereus plants from seeds and how to germinate them right!

                              


This book is extra large (A4) and will be printed on high quality color paper. In my opinion, it´s extremely important that the cactus pics look great. And that´s why I am going for a more expensive printing method. I could release this book as a black & white book for a very low price and make a lot more money, but I am a perfectionist and willing to pay a higher price for high quality color paper to make sure everything looks perfect. This is better than a coffee-table book about coffee-tables. 

Though I am the author, a lot of my friends were involved in this project and donated some really rare photos for this book! There literally are hundreds of pics showing the San Pedro Cacti in the habitats, including breathtaking shots of ancient Peruvian landscapes and Herbarium specimens. I collected all kinds of photos from Peru (Chavin, Cusco, Matucana etc), Bolivia, Chile and other South American countries. There even are photos of San Pedros from countries like Chile and Brasil, where this species is not as common as it is in Peru. Last but not least I included a chapter about mutants and cristates that will blow you away. 

Some of those photos are exclusively available in this book and will NOT be published anywhere else. THE SAN PEDRO GROUP offers a complete overview about the species and includes photos from habitats, botanic gardens and collections worldwide!

And that´s why you will totally love this book, so please support this campaign to claim your copy now! I will make sure that TRICHOCEREUS: THE SAN PEDRO GROUP will be one of the most beautiful coffee-table books you have in your shelf! Simple as that. You can support this project by making a safe Paypal payment and I will send you the book as soon as I get it from the book printing company. 


This is what I´ll do with the money:

All the money raised by this campaign will go directly into funding the printing of my book. The books you buy through this campaign will be numbered and signed.
The printing costs will be somewhere between 10.000 - 12.000 Euro and there is not a doubt in my mind that we will get this book funded. The only question is if there are enough books for everyone who wants one. This project already has a long list of supporters in our Trichocereus Facebook Group and if you want to claim your copy now, this crowdfunding campaign is the safest way. If this campaign exceeds the goal, I will put the money into printing more books. 

What you will get by supporting this project:

By supporting my campaign with at least 58 Euro, you will get a copy of the 1st Crowdfunding Edition of this book for a reduced price of 58 Euro per book (plus the shipping costs). The regular price will be 68 Euro (plus the shipping costs). There will only be 250 books available here, so do not wait too long to order.
There will also be a Hardcover Deluxe Edition for everyone who loves to own a high quality book and is willing to pay a little bit more for it. You can read more about the different versions in the chapter about the Perks. 
    ?
  • Everyone that supports this campaign by paying 58 Euro will get a copy of the softcover edition. This book is printed in color and on high quality paper. As soon as I have the printed books at home, I  will get in touch with the supporters and arrange for the shipping. The shipping costs are probably 12 Euro, but it also depends on where the buyer is located. In case the shipping costs exceed what I calculated, I´ll get in touch with the buyer to arrange for the shipping. 
    • ?
  • If this campaign won´t reach its goal, the number of printed books will go down and there won´t be any more books left for anyone outside of this campaign. I will try to print as many books as I can to make sure that all the supporters will get a copy. But this campaign is the only way to make sure that you´ll definitely get this book.
    I will try to get the books printed for a cheaper price if the campaign does not succeed, but I would have to use mediocre quality paper and colors, which really is a worst-case scenario.


?

The Perks

?

1. Physical book: The Crowdfunding Edition (Softcover) - 58 Euro

This is the most economic way to own this nice book. Not only will you get a printed copy of this limited book, but you´ll also get it for a reduced price of 58,00 Euro (plus shipping costs). The standard price of this book would be 68 Euro, but thanks to this campaign you can get it for a reduced price directly from the author. 

There will only be 250 books available and I am not sure whether or not there will be any more outside the crowdfunding campaign. All the books are sold on a first come, first served basis and when they are gone they are gone.

2. Physical book: The Crowdfunding Connoisseur Edition (Hardcover)- 88 Euro

This package contains a hardcover copy of the book for 88,00 Euro (plus shipping costs). Unlike the Softcover edition, the books from the CONNOISSEUR EDITION will be made using the thread stitching technique and all the pages will be printed on special paper to increase the brilliance of the photos. Believe me when I say that this will be a wonderful book that you will not want to give away again! The Hardcover Edition is not as affordable as the Softcover edition, but it´s definitely worth the price. It would be a lot cheaper to just print some more softcover books, but I felt like there should be a hardcover edition for the collectors who take pride in owning beautiful books.
There will only be 30 hardcover books produced and every book is numbered, labeled and signed as a way to thank you for your support! 

3. Join the Trichocereus Movement - 10 Euro

This perk is for everyone who does not want to buy the book, but wants to support this project somehow! We appreciate every donation this project gets, because it will bring us close to our goal to make this book available.

4. Become a supporter - 30 Euro

Become part of the Trichocereus Movement and support our book project with 30 Euro. The money goes directly into the production of TRICHOCEREUS: THE SAN PEDRO GROUP and you will be listed as an official supporter in the publishing information of the book! Without the help of supporters, this project would not be possible and I am happy for everyone that I can add to this list! 

5. Group Buy Pack (5 copies)
285 Euro

If you want to make a group buy, this pack with five copies of TRICHOCEREUS: THE SAN PEDRO GROUP (Softcover edition) is the best way to go. You get those books for a massively reduced price and are among the first people who have this beautiful book in their hands!

6. Reseller Package (10 copies) 550 Euro

If you want to sell the book in your shop, you´ll get ten books of TRICHOCEREUS: THE SAN PEDRO GROUP (Softcover edition) for a reduced price. Or share the books with your family & friends. I will also sign the copies as a way to say thank you for your support and include some of my SAN PEDRO GROUP stickers.

Risks and potential problems:

The biggest risk is that the campaign does not reach its goal. With that said, this campaign uses a fexible option that allows me to get the collected money even if it does not reach the goal. But that would mean that that I had to dramatically reduce the quality of the printing and the colors, which I really don´t want to do. Apart from that, have no doubt that we will get this project funded.
If you want to get this book in the best possible quality, now is the time to buy it! Indiegogo is a very reliable crowd funding company and you can securely pay with Paypal. 
Another problem that authors sometimes face is that they get a printed product that does not meet the expectations. But due to the fact that I will print this book in Germany, I can make use of my legal warranties if I am not entirely happy with the quality of the printing. That´s actually the reason why I do not want to go for a cheaper printing company in China and will instead produce this book in Germany. That gives me some legal options that guarantee that I will get the high quality that I pay for. And on top of that, I will also get an advance copy in order to prevent a lot of tears later on. 
Apart from that, there is the risk that I am hit by a meteorite or a school bus. You know, life is full of risks and you never know what happens tomorrow.
But even though that would be extremely bad news for me, I still made arrangements to get my book printed in case of a worst case scenario.
Please expect the shipping phase to last at least 4-8 weeks because I am sure there will be a lot of books that need to be shipped out in a relatively short time. If you have any questions, feel free to contact me at any time. 
??

Some more ways to support this project:

If it should not be possible for you to buy a copy due to whatever reasons, you can still help this project by talking about this project or sharing the link. There were many times when I was WAY too broke to afford all the cool cactus books that I wanted and I definitely know how that feels,
So if there are things that keep you from buying, you are wholeheartedly invited to let your friends know about it! I appreciate every share that this page will get as long as you don´t spam! You can also use the INDIEGOGO sharing tool in order to tell others about this project. You can find my other projects on trichocereus.net/trichocereus-bookstore
If you want to get in touch with me, you can send me a message to EG@trichocereus or join me in our Trichocereus Facebook Group!

story:
Chris & Jessie Apple, owners of Little Rockers LLC 

With Jessie’s Broadway background and Chris’ extensive musical experience recording and touring in rock bands, we combined our talents to create the greatest music program for children and families, Little Rockers - cool kids music classes. 

We're based in Monmouth County, NJ but we have plans to expand and continuously grow throughout New Jersey and beyond.


WHAT'S UP?

7 years ago, we created Little Rockers - cool kids music classes.

Since then, we've grown our unique interactive music program starting with about 30 families in early 2009 to several hundred families who take our classes each week.


Now, we're having some real growing pains

We have a high demand for more classes, programs and lessons, expanded days and hours for working parents and older children (ages 5 to 12) and a dedicated place for birthday parties and events.


Up until now, our business model has been to sublease space from existing businesses that are closed during the day (like dance studios) which has been great for taking on less risk but is extremely limited in allowing us to expand.

Right now, we have no where to offer these additional programs during peak hours like afternoons, evenings and weekends.

So, we're asking for your participation to take our business to the next level!!!


WHAT ARE WE GOING TO DO?

Create a performing arts destination for our community with lots of ways for kids to play and learn through music. There are plenty of mini-gyms out there for kids to run around in but nowhere like our space that will challenge kids and parents with music, movement & acting.

In our experience, there are limited options for parents to meet up with friends and let the kids play and interact with each other while actually learning.

AppleJams - Music & Arts Play Center will be a first of its kind facility!!

 

WHAT DO WE NEED?

  

WHAT DO YOU GET FOR PARTICIPATING?

We're turning to our strongest supporters to ask for contributions, but this ain't no straight up donation where all you get is that warm fuzzy feeling from doing a good deed. NO! You get real value for helping us make this dream a reality!

YOU GET:

* MORE classes for older kids

 * Classes for Mom and Dad too!  

* A place to HANG OUT before & after classes where the kids can play supervised 

* A place to educate and bond with your child through the arts

* A place to drop off the kids and have a date night

* The newest, coolest birthday party and play space

Oh, and you also get a lot of cool perks from us like...

*Classes, Lessons, Concerts and Party perks will be available for booking when the space opens Summer 2016. Parties and classes for other locations will be available for booking after the campaign ends.


THE IMPACT

Every parent wants a safe and trusted place for their kids to grow and learn in a fun and engaging atmosphere.  Our staff is passionate about the arts and education as well as experienced working with young people.

We’ve built a following of families who’ve been with us since their kids were infants and we want to continue to provide valuable services as the kids are growing up.

It’s been a dream of ours for some time to create a new kind of facility that is:

     A. Focussed on music and the creative arts 

     B. Geared to kids and families so that everyone can participate and bond through music making

     C. A cool environment for parents to meet up and entertain their kids that encourages creative expression and learning through music

     D. Able to offer classes, workshops and assemblies to local schools, special needs and other community groups


RISKS & CHALLENGES

Our business makes enough to support itself and our few employees but we don’t have a lot of working capital to expand to the next level.

Instead of taking on a lot of debt, we feel we can keep the risk low by offering real value to our families in the form of membership in our space, various classes and lessons for them and their kids, as well as fun perks. 

We've proven that we can successfully run our business and manage the team, the schedules, website and office admin as well as the curriculum and creative aspects. We've composed and recorded 7 classroom CDs and several music videos ourselves. Before we transitioned to Little Rockers full time in 2011, we co-managed a music school with 100 students and were responsible for the day to day operations as well as producing several shows each year with the kids. We're scrappy and have a lot of experience making things happen and we're super excited for this new project.

This is a flexible funding campaign. What if we don't reach our goal?

With flexible funding, we are able to keep all donations and put them toward the project even if the full amount is not reached. AppleJams will open whether we reach the goal or not but we may have to adjust how the funds are allocated to each portion of the budget. Either way, all perks will be honored. 

___________________

Even if you don’t live in our area, or can benefit directly from our space, your contribution will be instrumental in creating something meaningful and cool. Consider donating a class, lessons or party to a friend or family member in the area.

Don't forget we will also be producing music, music videos, online concerts and educational content at the space that children and families can enjoy from anywhere!!


OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELP

Even if you can't contribute dollars, you can help in other ways!! 

Please spread the word about our campaign to your friends and family! Get them excited about AppleJams - Music & Arts Play Center. 

Also, you can use the Indiegogo share tools to spread the word through Facebook, Twitter and Instagram


AND REMEMBER!

Your contribution will help us build the coolest performing arts center and play space in Monmouth County and continue to bring something unique and important to families in NJ: A truly great place to learn and play. 

Thanks and ROCK ON!!

Chris & Jessie
story_txt:
Chris & Jessie Apple, owners of Little Rockers LLC With Jessie’s Broadway background and Chris’ extensive musical experience recording and touring in rock bands, we combined our talents to create the greatest music program for children and families, Little Rockers - cool kids music classes. We're based in Monmouth County, NJ but we have plans to expand and continuously grow throughout New Jersey and beyond.WHAT'S UP?7 years ago, we created Little Rockers - cool kids music classes.Since then, we've grown our unique interactive music program starting with about 30 families in early 2009 to several hundred families who take our classes each week.Now, we're having some real growing painsWe have a high demand for more classes, programs and lessons, expanded days and hours for working parents and older children (ages 5 to 12) and a dedicated place for birthday parties and events.Up until now, our business model has been to sublease space from existing businesses that are closed during the day (like dance studios) which has been great for taking on less risk but is extremely limited in allowing us to expand.Right now, we have no where to offer these additional programs during peak hours like afternoons, evenings and weekends.So, we're asking for your participation to take our business to the next level!!!WHAT ARE WE GOING TO DO?Create a performing arts destination for our community with lots of ways for kids to play and learn through music. There are plenty of mini-gyms out there for kids to run around in but nowhere like our space that will challenge kids and parents with music, movement & acting.In our experience, there are limited options for parents to meet up with friends and let the kids play and interact with each other while actually learning.AppleJams - Music & Arts Play Center will be a first of its kind facility!! 
WHAT DO WE NEED?


  WHAT DO YOU GET FOR PARTICIPATING?

story:
In April 2016 Mesihovic, artistic director of CIRCUITDEBRIS will be returning to Pretoria, South Africa as a Guest Lecturer/Artist in Residency at Tshwane University of Technology. The Residency will include Mesihovic teaching her unique movement method EMBODIMENT and setting company work VOID on  students in the dance program, developing new work with CIRCUITDEBRIS  company dancers &  will culminate in a student performance of CIRCUITDEBRIS work VOID and an in Progress Showing of the company's new work. 

Help CIRCUITDEBRIS company dancers Ariane Bernier, Yuki Fukui, and Monica Mordaunt travel to South Africa and participate and teach alongside artistic director Mersiha Mesihovic.



What We Need & What You Get

In order to get 3 of the company dancers to South Africa, we need $3000. The rest of the money, $1500,  will go to paying the dancers per diem (food & daily travel costs) and for their teaching and artistic contribution. The budget breakdown:
Travel fees: $3000
Dancer fees: $1500

To thank you for your support, we have created great rewards ranging from personal shout-outs on Facebook and video link of  performance, showings in South Africa, to invitations to a studio showing of our new work  in NYC, credit in the final student performance, signed photograph from South Africa, pass to our company class in New York and a public thank you from Mersiha Mesihovic on-stage following the final student performance in South Africa.



Ariane Bernier & Yuki Fukui in company rep soNowWHAT. Photography by David MacCollough.


The Impact

This opportunity is a huge deal for the company. The possibility to engage in trans continental cultural exchange and the impact it will have on CIRCUITDEBRIS and the dance communities in Pretoria and New York is incredible.


Risks & Challenges

This is the first time that the company is raising funds for a touring opportunity abroad. It is extremely exciting, scary & humbling asking for support publicly. This opportunity is un-missable. And we know we can do it together with YOUR help!

Other Ways You Can Help

Spread the word far and loud! Share our campaign link on Facebook & Social Media sites! Talk about the project with your family and friends. If you believe in us and get excited about us, there's a good chance other people will, too. 

We are Thankful for Your Support!

story:
Hey gang! I’m Daniel Cape and I LOVE drawing caricatures, traveling the world, and making a positive impact in the lives of kids; and right now my goal is to accomplish all three at the same time, but I need YOUR support! Go grab yourself a cool glass of ice tea and a handful of M&M’s, put on some upbeat music, find yourself a comfy chair, and sit back and let me tell you about my dream.

First, let’s start at the beginning…When I was around 12 years old, my dad got me a book on how to draw caricatures because I liked drawing cartoons. It was a dumb idea, I mean horrible, what was he thinking? Anyway, about 10 years after that I started drawing caricatures of people I worked with, and have LOVED it ever since. *You got me there dad. 


Since then, I’ve worked at Universal Studios in Hollywood, the Stratosphere in Las Vegas, fairs, parties, and now run my own booth at Silverwood Theme Park in Athol, Idaho. One of my dreams has been to travel the world and draw caricatures of people. I’ve already done it to some extent, drawing people in Belize, Guatemala, Ukraine, and Japan, just for fun. But what if I could do it with a cause? Guess what, I AM!!

My goal is to start a non-profit that would allow me, and other artists, to travel the US and the WORLD drawing caricatures, inspiring creativity, and teaching future generations how to draw the world through the art of caricatures. I’ve already started right here in my area by drawing siblings of cancer patients, kids at a local school, and have plans to draw and teach at several other locations in the next few weeks. This is only the beginning. My target population is children who could use a little extra support in life, and man is there a ready supply of them around the world, sadly enough.

Okay, so how can you help, you ask….well, my dad gave me a book on how to draw caricatures, not a million dollar loan. Right now I’m a student, working on my PhD in Psychology with a focus in Creativity Studies. Needless to say, I could use some financial assistance in making this dream come true. This is just to get it started. Here’s a list of supplies I’ll need and what they cost, so that you know where your money is going…
*All donations are tax deductible!

Camera (GoPro Hero4 Silver) - $399.99 

Paper  -  2 Reams of paper at $48.47 = $96.94 

Markers - Set of 12 = $35.25

Fractured Atlas Fees - $10 per month for one year = $120

Plane Ticket - $465 (I'll cover half) = $230

Additional Fees - Gas, website, instructional materials for students, etc.

Total (rounded up) - $1,000

These supplies will go to programs in the Coeur d'Alene area and for the program in Costa Rica.

About my work in CDA and Costa Rica...
I will not only be drawing caricatures of the kids, I'll be teaching them how to draw caricatures. Empirical evidence proves that these experiences promote creative thinking, increase cognitive functioning, and have therapeutic values. 

In Costa Rica, I will be honoring the UN Convention on the Rights of the Child, using a Rights Based Approach to providing charitable services, and practicing Fair Trade Learning. Basically, the child's rights come first. This is achieved through community partnership and I will be exchanging my services in return for cultural knowledge, learning from locals, and opportunities to improve my Spanish. For a more detailed explanation, please e-mail me at dcape08@yahoo.com, and I will send you an explanation of the design of the program (basically a 15 page paper I wrote about my hopes for this). 

"What about your goals?"...you ask, well, I've got 4...

Goal One: Make children smile, laugh, and experience positive emotions.
Have you ever had a caricature done of yourself, or seen one of someone you know? Then you have most likely experienced the positive effects of the exaggerated image in front of you...That means it made you smile, laugh, and/or you experienced a sense of joy and wonder. 

Goal Two: Provide novel experiences that will fuel imagination and foster creative thinking.
Empirical evidence proves that merely having a new and unusual experience enhances one’s cognitive flexibility, which increases creative potential! Imagine if a photograph is the “norm”. A caricature challenges the mind to accept new possibilities and reevaluate the world.

Goal Three: Provide art instruction for all and extra support for children who show interest in caricatures.
Give a kid a caricature, and he or she will laugh for a day. Teach a kid how to draw caricatures, and he or she will provide others with laughter, learn some new skills, increase his/her creativity, and potentially earn a little extra income in the future; that is what I always say. Not really, but it makes sense! Art education has been proven to have positive results on cognitive skills, therapeutic value, and other valuable outcomes, like improved creativity.

Goal Four: Create an international community online and through newsletters.
Creating an international community would contribute to sustainable programming, provide a form of cultural exchange, and provide continued mentoring and inspiration for the children with whom we work. Additionally, kids could potentially share their artwork with other programs around the world.

"But wait, what the heck does a High Dive have to do with all this?" 

Right, well, let me give you the “High Dive” metaphor. 

Embarking on a new journey can be like jumping from a high dive for the first time....

Imagine the first time you went off the high dive at the pool, or picture a young kid about to take his or her first leap. It’s a big event! It’s scary, unpredictable, and new, and the whole pool is watching (or at least that’s how it feels).

Still, you push on. You make the decision to get in line with the giants who have gone before you. They tower over your trembling body like the oak trees stealing the sunlight of a single flower on the forest floor. But that flower doesn’t give up, and neither do you.

It’s your turn. You step up to the ladder that leads to the clouds. You grip the cold wet steel bars as you take the first step up to your destiny. Right there, STOP RIGHT THERE! That’s where I WAS a few months ago in my current venture! I feel like I took the first step, and it was AMAZING!! 

             

Now picture this. You slowly climb the ladder, step by step. You hear the laughter of others and splashing around the pool below you, and feel the ever vigilant eyes of the life guard watching… judging you. Now you see the top. There it is, the board that your life will hang on for the next 30 seconds. As you crest the fabricated horizon, like Sir Edmund Hillary crested the top of Mt Everest, you feel a sense of accomplishment. But really, it's only just begun. You are now committed. And much like Hillary, you now face the life threatening task of coming down. PAUSE your vision right there. That is where I’m at RIGHT NOW. I’ve climbed the ladder and made it to the top. I’ve bought a plane ticket to Costa Rica for the end of May. I’ve made contact with a local organization to work with. But now comes the hard part. I need to run, or walk to the end. In May, I will jump off the high dive and leave my fate to the preparation and passions that have taken me there. 

Like the kid jumping off the high dive for the first time, I don’t know what it will be like to land. It may hurt a little…or I could make a big splash! Others will be watching, but this is a personal journey for me. When I get out of the water, I hope to celebrate my accomplishments. I’ll run back to the diving board and do it again. Hopefully I can bring others with me on future journeys so they too can experience the exhilaration of making the same leap. I’ll eventually learn how to dive, do back flips, and keep trying to make a huge splash in the lives of children!

                                          

Will I succeed? I have no doubt, and I will bring new opportunities to hundreds, thousands of kids. Remember the 1988 Olympics when Greg Louganis hit his head on the diving board? Well, he was one of the best in the world. With your support in this venture, you will be helping to protect my head from the diving board while supporting children on their first step up the ladder. Let's try to make a big splash in this new effort!


Thank you for reading this far! Please consider donating to the start of something amazing, and sharing this journey with others. 



Now A Word From Our (Fiscal) Sponsors...
The Global Community of Caricatures for Youth is a sponsored project of Fractured Atlas, a non-profit arts service organization. Contributions for the charitable purposes of  The Global Community of Caricatures for Youth must be payable to Fractured Atlas only, and are tax-deductible to the extent permitted by law.

story:
Creating the Pedagogical and Interactive Museum of Sexuality( Sex&), was an inevitability. Once a dream, Sex& is now a global challenge, born from its mentor’s concern and desire to evolve the paradigm of sexuality, harnessing its universal constructive energy to bring people together, promote health and psychological well-being, and framing it as one of the pillars of the GNH (Gross National Happiness) index.



Criar o Museu Pedagógico e Interactivo da Sexualidade (Sex&) tornou-se uma inevitabilidade. Mais do que um sonho, mais do que um desafio mundial, o Sex& nasce da inquietação e vontade da mentora de querer mudar o paradigma da sexualidade, pois considera-a como uma fonte de energia universal que aproxima as pessoas, que promove a saúde e o bem-estar psicológico e por isso deve ser considerada como um dos pilares para o índice de Felicidade Interna Bruta.


We have created an object that is a daily tribute to all women! A teapot, based on the real anatomy of a clitoris, designed by the artist Maria Teresa Crawford Cabral and is a piece exclusive to our Museum.

Criamos um objecto que é um tributo diário a todas as Mulheres! Um bule, inspirado na anatomia real do clitóris, desenhado pela artista Maria Teresa Crawford Cabral e é uma peça exclusiva do museu.

Perk: Clitoral Teapot. In production. Braz Gil Studio, Porcelain (www.brazgil.pt)

Descrição do objecto em português. AQUI

We all deserve to be sexually happy and be guaranteed universal sexual and reproductive freedom, a fundamental part of human rights, to live unfettered by prejudice, discrimination, disease, guilt and violence.

Especially for all women

Todos merecemos ser felizes sexualmente e para isso é necessário garantir os direitos sexuais e reprodutivos universais, uma componente fundamental dos direitos humanos,  e  devemos viver livres de preconceitos, discriminação, doenças, culpa ou violência.

Principalmente, para todas as mulheres


The future museum promotes knowledge and understanding of human sexuality, focused on education through artistic expression and novel, pedagogical interactive contents. 

Através do futuro Museu pretende-se promover o conhecimento e a reflexão sobre a sexualidade humana, numa perspectiva educativa, através de expressões artísticas e de conteúdos inovadores e interativos.

The artist Ana Maria Paixão painted the goddess and the result was extraordinary. Don't you think?

A artista Ana Maria Paixão, pintou a Deusa, e o resultado ficou extraordinário, não achas?

 
 Perk: Foreplay Map (Mapa de Preliminares)

Have you noticed that this is the first time you see the back side of the goddess?

Já reparaste que é a primeira vez que vês a Deusa por trás?

Perk: Foreplay Map
Descrição do objecto em português. AQUI

 
 

Perk: Duct Tape

Descrição do objecto em português. AQUI

Perk: SexEnigma Art Collection Posters (1 and set of 4)

Descrição dos objectos em português AQUI

MESSAGES: 1- THESE ARE NOT TWO SCISSORS / 2- MUCH MORE THAN... / 3- MORE THAN A GLOVE / 4- HANDY / 5- WAY DEEPER (image: iceberg)

Note: send us a message with your choice in case you have a specific preference to info@mosexuality.com.

Nota: envia-nos uma mensagem para info@mosexuality.com com a tua escolha, caso tenhas uma preferencia.

 

The Pedagogical and Interactive Museum of Sexuality will change mentalities and attitudes towards sexuality, contributing to a happier, more aesthetically and emotionally evolved society.

O Museu Pedagógico e Interactivo da Sexualidade tem como objetivo promover a mudança de mentalidades e de atitudes perante a sexualidade, contribuindo para uma sociedade estética e emocionalmente mais evoluída e, como tal, mais feliz.


 

Perk: 

Workshop 1 -Sexual Concerns of a Teenager /Descrição em português: AQUI

Workshop 2 - After the birth/ Como sobreviver sexualmente ao nascimento do seu rebento? Descrição em português : AQUI


Marta Crawford has gathered a multidisciplinary team which believes in this project and knows that art, education, pedagogy, science and technology are crucial for the creation of the first PEDAGOGICAL AND INTERACTIVE MUSEUM of SEXUALITY in the world.

Marta Crawford reuniu uma equipa multidisciplinar que acredita no projeto e sabe que a arte, a educação, a pedagogia, a ciência e a tecnologia são essenciais na criação do primeiro MUSEU PEDAGÓGICO E INTERATIVO no mundo.

 

Perk: T-Shirts "I always say" (1 and set of 3)

Descrição em português. AQUI

Messages: 1- MAN'S BEST FRIEND...IS THE CONDOM / 2- NO MEANS NO! / 3- SEX IS NOT PENETRATION / 4- SEX DOES NOT HAVE AN EXPIRATION DATE / 5- THE CLITORIS IS NOT A BUTTON / 6- ALL LETTERS MATTER...LGBTQ / 7- SKILL IS WHAT MATTERS MOST, NOT AN ERECTION / 8- IT ONLY TAKES 2 TO HAVE GOOD SEX / 9- THE G-SPOT IS C / 10- WHAT MATTERS MOST IS THE MAN BEHIND THE PENIS / 11- ENJOY EACH DISH, DON'T HURRY TO GET TO THE END

Note: send us a message with your choice in case you have a specific preference to info@mosexuality.com

Nota: envia-nos uma mensagem com a tua escolha, caso tenhas preferência para info@mosexuality.com 

 

Perk: Valentine Handkerchief - Handicraft Collection (digital image) 

Descrição do objecto em português AQUI

Note: send us a message with your choice in case you have a specific preference to info@mosexuality.com

Nota: envia-nos uma mensagem com a tua escolha, caso tenhas preferência para info@mosexuality.com 

 

Sex& is an online platform which will offer interactive exhibitions, where visitors will have the freedom to personalise their experience and learn sex in an innovative way, as well as products, contents and counselling tools, which are already being created by a multidisciplinary team of researchers, engineers and web designers from Seegno (Braga).

O SEX& é uma plataforma online que disponibilizará bens, conteúdos e ferramentas de comunicação, que estão a ser criadas por uma equipa multidisplinar e desenvolvidos  por especialistas em web development e web designer da Seegno . Através da tecnologia de ponta o visitante pode entrar nas exposições, e dar-lhe liberdade para personalizar a sua experiência de forma inovadora.


 


Perk: T-Shirt SexEnigma Art Collection (1 and set of 2 and set of 4)

Descrição  em português. AQUI

MESSAGES: 1- HANDY / 2- WAY DEEPER / 3- MORE THAN A GLOVE / 4- MUCH MORE THAN...

Note: send us a message with your choice in case you have a specific preference to info@mosexuality.com

Nota: envia-nos uma mensagem com a tua escolha, caso tenhas preferência para info@mosexuality.com


 

Perk: Pack to Share Sex& (#1)

Descrição destes objetos em português. AQUI

  

We need your help to make Sex& the best it can be, guaranteeing this technologically demanding and content rigorous project is brought to its fullest polished potential. We want to surprise you with our platform, designed with you in mind, and we can assure you that we’re going to address the topics of sexuality in a thorough manner, with rigour, professionalism and aesthetic care.

Para criar o SEX&  precisamos da  contribuição de todos para nos ajudar a financiar um projecto tecnologicamente exigente e rigoroso nos seus conteúdos.
Queremos que te surpreendas com a programação que estamos a criar, a pensar em ti, com a certeza que vamos abordar as temáticas da sexualidade de forma abrangente, com rigor, profissionalismo e sentido estético.


Perk: T-Shirts "I always say" (1 and set of 3)

Note: send us a message with your choice in case you have a specific preference to info@mosexuality.com

Nota: envia-nos uma mensagem com a tua escolha, caso tenhas preferência para info@mosexuality.com 

 

The items and activities listed among our perks are but a sneak preview of the values and principles which Sex& will stand up for, challenging everyone to rethink sexuality. You will find items which are unexpected, both in their originality and in what they can lead you to discover, and there is something for all ages, kids included.

Os objetos e workshops, que apresentamos na nossa lista de contrapartidas, são já a expressão de alguns valores e princípios que serão defendidos no Sex& desafiando-te a pensares na sexualidade sob um novo ponto de vista.Encontrarás também objetos inesperados, pela sua originalidade e pelo que te podem levar a descobrir. Objetos variados e para todas as idades e, por isso, não esquecemos também os mais pequenos.

 

Perk: Pack to Share Sex& (#2)
Descrição em português.AQUI

 

 

Workshops 3 - Sexuality has no expiration date. Descrição em português:AQUI

Workshop 4 - Love, no desire / Amo-te muito mas não te desejo (Como voltar a sentir borboletas na barriga). Descrição em português : AQUI


Marta Crawford

Marta Crawford is a renowned Portuguese psychologist, sexologist and family therapist who in 2005 surged in notoriety when she addressed sexuality in a direct, simple and positive manner in the TV show ABSEXO. Taking the country by surprise, she revolutionized how the Portuguese talked about and understood sexuality. Since then she has been invited to do lectures, workshops and conferences in schools, associations, universities, companies and even religious groups. She has presented additional TV shows such as Aqui há sexo and 100 tabus. She has written books about sexuality and continues to be an opinion maker through articles and chronicles she writes for newspapers and magazines.

Marta Crawford transformou-se numa marca no seu pais ao abordar a
sexualidade de forma direta, simples e positiva no programa ABSEXO, que em 20O5 revolucionou a forma como os portugueses passaram a falar e a entender a sexualidade. Desde então tem sido convidada para fazer palestras, workshops e conferências em escolas, associações, universidades, empresas e até associações religiosas. A sua experiência como psicóloga, sexóloga e terapeuta
familiar tem sido reconhecida através da sua pratica clínica. Apresentou novos programas na tv como Aqui há sexo e  100 tabus. Escreveu livros sobre sexualidade e tornou-se leader de opinião através de artigos e cronicas que escreve tanto em revistas como jornais.


We want you to fall in love with this project. Help us put a capital S on Sexuality. 

Queremos que te apaixones por este projeto e nos ajudes a fundar o Museu que vai tratar a sexualidade com S grande.

                        PORQUE TOD@S MERECEMOS SER SEXUALMENTE FELIZES
ESPECIALMENTE TU!

 
You can also help by sharing the link of our campaign through Facebook, Twitter, Google plus or a blog.
Podes  também ajudar partilhando o link da campanha através do Fecebook, Twitter, Google Plus ou num Blogue.

story_txt:
Creating the Pedagogical and Interactive Museum of Sexuality( Sex&), was an inevitability. Once a dream, Sex& is now a global challenge, born from its mentor’s concern and desire to evolve the paradigm of sexuality, harnessing its universal constructive energy to bring people together, promote health and psychological well-being, and framing it as one of the pillars of the GNH (Gross National Happiness) index.



Criar o Museu Pedagógico e Interactivo da Sexualidade (Sex&) tornou-se uma inevitabilidade. Mais do que um sonho, mais do que um
desafio mundial, o Sex& nasce da inquietação e vontade da mentora de
querer mudar o paradigma da sexualidade, pois considera-a como uma fonte
de energia universal que aproxima as pessoas, que promove a saúde e o bem-estar
psicológico e por isso deve ser considerada como um dos pilares para o
índice de Felicidade Interna Bruta.

We have created an object that is a daily tribute to all women! A teapot, based on the real anatomy of a clitoris, designed by the artist Maria Teresa Crawford Cabral and is a piece exclusive to our Museum.

Criamos um objecto que é um tributo diário a todas as Mulheres! Um bule, inspirado na anatomia real do clitóris, desenhado pela artista Maria Teresa Crawford Cabral e é uma peça exclusiva do museu.

direitos humanos,  e  devemos viver livres de preconceitos,
discriminação, doenças, culpa ou violência.
Principalmente, para todas as mulheres

The future museum promotes knowledge and understanding of human sexuality, focused on education through artistic expression and novel, pedagogical interactive contents.

story:
We're on Amazon now: 

http://goo.gl/mvU02j

The Paper Trax Family

We're a U.S. Coast Guard family, and I've been active duty for the past 17 years, flying Coast Guard rescue helicopters and now I'm in international port security. My wife is an amazing stay at home mom and is from Vienna, Austria. We have two kids, Bailey, 5 and Wolfi, 3, and now, we all live in the San Francisco Bay Area.

We figured we would try out our idea for making a paper race track and see what happens.  Paper Trax is an idea that has been brewing for the past two years.  We finally have the product ready for the kids, and it's a great toy that brings families together for exciting and fun play.  Paper Trax is a toy that makes kids put their mobile devices down and play, it's as much fun for Dads and Moms as it is for the kids! 
The biggest challenge is to get noticed amongst the thousands of toys introduced every year.  Hopefully with our community of backers and friends we'll make a sizable dent in the toy industry!  


Paper Trax

Paper Trax is a toy that supports learning through play. Kids develop spatial skills, develop team building skills and work on problem solving while having fun! It's a great toy for both boys and girls, and the first design of Paper Trax is our Dinosaur Edition with lots of dinosaurs and the famed T-Rex. A toy that meets nearly every learning element through play: Science - Technology - Engineering - Arts - and Math (STEAM).  

Paper Trax is a completely recyclable, all paper race track created to convert your walls into a matchbox speedway! The Trax are attached with 3M Command strips to protect your walls. Each Trax is designed by a local artist with your kid's imagination taken to heart, and truly meets Einstein's famous quote, "Play is the highest form of research."

One of the best features - you never have to pick the Trax up, they look great on your walls, and they're always ready for play.  


Here's the video we made on how to put the Paper Trax together. 


Paper Strength 

The Paper Trax are quite strong and hold up well under matchbox racing conditions.


Partnership with Berkeley's Habitot Children's Museum

Saturday, December 5th, we will be sponsoring a Maker Saturday at Berkeley's Habitot Children's Museum. www.Habitot.org.

For the first 20 backers who live in the Bay Area, and would like to attend the event, we will give you one free pass to attend the Maker Saturday. If you ordered the Christmas Super Pack, we will have your Super Pack at the Habitot Museum to pick up as well!  


The Idea

Wolfi, my son, was only 18 months when our neighbor’s kid grew out of matchbox cars and brought over a pile of toy cars to add to our playroom. At the time, we didn’t have any tracks to play with, and Wolfi quickly figured out, you can’t do much with toy cars on the floor. So, I looked around the playroom for ideas to make the cars go, and thought of making my own tracks out of cardboard. I grabbed my cereal box, folded a little, cut a little and figured out how we could stick them to the wall to create some cool Trax!

We kept experimenting with the idea and developed Paper Trax. Being a Coast Guard family who moves around quite a bit, it was nice to have an exciting family project. My daughter Bailey, she’s 5, and she has the Trax really figured out. Bailey builds the Trax and sets them up on the wall and is able to see her creations come to life. Wolfi, at 3 years, he loves the Trax as well, and his favorite part is seeing the collision when several Trax cross! Wolfi says, “Kabamers!”

Thankfully, Paper Trax ended up being a wonderful toy for my kids and two years later my kids still play with the Trax just about every day.

We can’t wait to see your creations and what your family invents for Paper Trax! Paper Trax are fun for all ages, and even at the office. We would love to see some cubicles, waiting rooms and executive board rooms Trax'd out!

Thank you for supporting Paper Trax!

Brent, Julia, Bailey and "Wolfi"

The Paper Trax Family
story_txt:
We're on Amazon now: http://goo.gl/mvU02jThe Paper Trax Family
We're a U.S. Coast Guard family, and I've been active duty for the past 17 years, flying Coast Guard rescue helicopters and now I'm in international port security. My wife is an amazing stay at home mom and is from Vienna, Austria. We have two kids, Bailey, 5 and Wolfi, 3, and now, we all live in the San Francisco Bay Area.We figured we would try out our idea for making a paper race track and see what happens.  Paper Trax is an idea that has been brewing for the past two years.  We finally have the product ready for the kids, and it's a great toy that brings families together for exciting and fun play.  Paper Trax is a toy that makes kids put their mobile devices down and play, it's as much fun for Dads and Moms as it is for the kids! The biggest challenge is to get noticed amongst the thousands of toys introduced every year.  Hopefully with our community of backers and friends we'll make a sizable dent in the toy industry!  


Paper TraxPaper Trax is a toy that supports learning through play. Kids develop spatial skills, develop team building skills and work on problem solving while having fun! It's a great toy for both boys and girls, and the first design of Paper Trax is our Dinosaur Edition with lots of dinosaurs and the famed T-Rex. A toy that meets nearly every learning element through play: Science - Technology - Engineering - Arts - and Math (STEAM).  Paper Trax is a completely recyclable, all paper race track created to convert your walls into a matchbox speedway! The Trax are attached with 3M Command strips to protect your walls. Each Trax is designed by a local artist with your kid's imagination taken to heart, and truly meets Einstein's famous quote, "Play is the highest form of research."One of the best features - you never have to pick the Trax up, they look great on your walls, and they're always ready for play.  Here's the video we made on how to put the Paper Trax together. Paper Strength 
The Paper Trax are quite strong and hold up well under matchbox racing conditions.

Partnership with Berkeley's Habitot Children's Museum
Saturday, December 5th, we will be sponsoring a Maker Saturday at Berkeley's Habitot Children's Museum. www.Habitot.org.
For the first 20 backers who live in the Bay Area, and would like to attend the event, we will give you one free pass to attend the Maker Saturday. If you ordered the Christmas Super Pack, we will have your Super Pack at the Habitot Museum to pick up as well!  


The Idea

Thank you for supporting Paper Trax!
Brent, Julia, Bailey and "Wolfi"
The Paper Trax Family

story:
**Update**

Thanks to our amazing supporters, we have raised enough funds to build a well for Busoga Jr. Primary School. The next step is to build a well for the surrounding village. Villagers currently have to make the same journey as the school to get drinking water and if we build one at the school but not in the village, we have to decide whether or not to make the school borehole open to the public. If open to the public, we could be putting the safety of our students at risk. In order to protect our students, we would like to raise an additional $5,000 to build the second well. Please consider supporting our campaign, the students at Busoga Jr. Primary School, and the villagers in Kiwungo.

_____________________________________________________________________________

What would you do if you had no water from your tap in your kitchen, bathroom, washroom? No water available for drinking, bathing, cleaning, cooking and so on? Can you imagine before you do anything in your day you must first bike 45 minutes to a neighboring well transporting 6 “Jerry cans” (10 gallon jugs) balanced on your bike, and then make the return trip.

And because you work for a Primary school and the only one with a bike, you have to do this a minimum for 5 times so the cook can have enough water to prepare the 2 meals for the students. When you just can't go to the well for water, the functioning of the school is impacted directly because the cook can't cook and the students can't eat and in this domino effect school stops.

This is real every day since our well broke and then dried up. We have very limited amounts of water to use for drinking or washing because it is just so difficult to get the water to our school to begin with. Children and staff (200 students and 8 teachers) can't wash after using the latrines or have a glass of water because they are thirsty. The water collected is primarily for the cook and the resident students and teachers to use and is limited even at that.

As the Director of Busoga Jr. Primary School I am asking for your help in building a well (called a Bore Hole) at my school and another one in the surrounding village. The one for my school is self-explanatory but here is the reason for the one in the surrounding village.

If we had a functioning Bore Hole at our school the persons residing near us would want the use of our well because they must make this same journey every day for water. And as their needs are very much like our needs for water, we would have to decide if we should make our well a public well, and allow anyone on campus at any time. In the interest of safety and protection of the children and the well, I decided to ask to have another well built 1⁄2 between our school and the distance of the other well.

I have established contact with a reliable contractor that installs Bore Holes for Africa for a living. He has provided me all the information I need to build these wells at $5000.00 and each taking 1 month to complete.

Everyone deserves water. It should not be a luxury to have a clean glass of water to drink because you are thirsty or wash your hands. Will you please help us? We are thirsty....

Thank you for helping us have clean water

Students and Teachers of Busoga Jr. Primary School

Kiwungo, Uganda

story:
Who is Natalie?

Hello everyone! I'm Natalie and I am an aspiring developer! Such passion was discovered after:

  • "failing", risking financial security
  • soul searching, learning more about myself and asking friends lots of questions
  • giving myself the opportunity to BELIEVE in myself

See my path towards a career in tech was not always in mind. In fact, I was scared of such thing. While in college I steered away from it as much as possible. I didn't feel represented in such industry as a:

  • Lesbian
  • Woman of color
I didn't think I fit in the picture. What stopped me from starting my journey earlier was not that I could not do it, it was the fact that I THOUGHT I could not. Now, that I know better, I am striving to be an empowering leader in the tech industry. So what better way than to attend the Lesbians Who Tech NYC Summit this September. This opportunity would be the semicolon to my statements, and I would learn so much from this experience.

My Goal

My fundraising goal is $600. That will cover the costs of:

  • Flight ticket
  • Summit ticket
  • Transportation
  • Anything related to my attendance of the summit
Anything that is raised above that will be donated to the Lesbians Who Tech Scholarship Fund.

How Important Is This?

My background in team sports taught me the importance of community. I know that my path towards being a developer will not be easy, but I know that I can do it, especially with a support system. And that is exactly the vibe that I get when I watch a video from a previous summit. These Lesbians have already empowered me to do better, to be better, imagine what it would be like to actually meet them, to learn from them. 
In short, by attending this summit I will:
  • Gain an understanding of the hurdles, the challenges and the opportunities of being a lesbian in tech
  • Network and learn from amazing leaders and scholars
  • Know how to prepare myself towards a successful journey in tech 

Sharing is Caring 

A great way to contribute is by sharing. Please spread the word!

story:
Little Wound School, of the Pine Ridge Indian Reservation, Needs Your Help

Little Wound School is a 501(c)3 non-profit school located on the Pine Ridge Indian Reservation in South Dakota. We have approximately 800 students. Over the last three years our budget has been cut by approximately 3 million dollars. Students need our services, but we can't provide them because we lack the funding. This is why we're turning to you for help.

STUDENTS NEED YOUR HELP NOW!

Our Little Wound School wrestling team has not had a home wrestling match since 2004 because of an unsafe wrestling mat. The mat has cracks, folds, and tears. It can cause severe injury or death due to compressed spots and head trauma.

Wrestling is an important sport to many students. "Not everyone can play basketball and football" says Chris Janis, wrestling coach for Little Wound School. 

Students use athletics, and in this case, wrestling to motivate themselves to keep their grades up and stay fit. Obesity and diabetes is a pandemic on many Indian reservations in the United States. Native Americans are 2.2 times higher— Likelihood of American Indians and Alaska Natives to have diabetes compared with non-Hispanic whites. There was a 68% increase of diabetes from 1994 to 2004 among Native Americans (diabetes.org). Pine Ridge Indian Reservation is no exception. Often the rates are higher on Pine Ridge Indian Reservation than other places. An hour of exercise a day can also replace all psychiatric medications says some doctors. This is an important fact because Indian reservations face suicide rates of 3x higher than other comparable locations. 

Exercise is a must and wherever a student finds happiness and the motivation to perform that exercise should be rewarded with what they deserve. In this case they deserve a new wrestling mat and the ability to care and store it. 

Will you help us?

What We Need

  • South Dakota High School Activities Association sanctioned wrestling mat
  • Storage rack
  • Mat Straps
  • Mat Cover


The Difference You Will Make

Little Wound School has students that want to wrestle in a safe environment and stay fit, but cannot. A new wrestling mat will give student athletes of Pine Ridge Indian Reservation and Little Wound School the opportunity to gain confidence, exercise, compete at home in high school wrestling matches and relieve stress in areas where violence and suicide rates are highest of anywhere in the United States. "The number of Native Americans taking their own lives is more than three times the national average, and up to 10 times higher on some reservations" (www.afsp.org).

By sharing this campaign or donating to this campaign you will help us spread the word in one small step towards a larger goal, creating healthy, well-rounded student-athletes at Little Wound School. 

Risks & Challenges

One major challenge is our practice location. It is in the elementary auditorium. The area is in use daily for meetings or school activities. The mat has to be rolled up everyday which can wear on it and create cracks and folds. What we need is our own practice building/room, but that's not going to happen soon. Little Wound might get a new school before that happens. We will just have to make sure that a wrestling practice room is built into it, but for now we will work with the storage rack, proper storage and care.

It takes approximately 3-5 months for the mat to be manufactured once purchased, so our goal is that our first wrestling meet home at Little Wound School be in 2015. Please help us achieve this goal. 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't help then we are asking that you share this campaign and help us spread the word in this fundraiser. Our students need your help. Here's what you can do to help us:

  • Like the campaign posts on Facebook 
  • Share the links on Facebook from our page
  • Tweet about it on Twitter
  • Retweet our posts from our account
  • Post about it on Tumblr or your blog
  • Share screen shots of it on Pinterest and Instagram, and so on. 
  • Like and share our Instagram posts
  • +1 and Share our posts on Google Plus

WE NEED YOUR HELP!

We have 30 days to accomplish our goal. 

Please donate today. 

-The Little Wound School Wrestling Team

story:
DRW College Prep passionately believes in giving our students the foremost education in the Nation. The staff of DRW believes in high level experiential learning. This form of teaching is one of the most effective ways to encourage, inspire, impact, and teach students. With this expectation  DRW staff, specifically first year Spanish teacher and founder of the DRW Spanish curriculum, Loren Andrade, proposed a gigantic goal of getting DRW College Prep students to France and Spain in the Spring of 2016.

This is where you come in: we have the students, the staff, the potential, but we need your help with funding to get our kids to Europe in the Spring of 2016.

The Impact : We need your help to support in the funding to get the DRW students abroad for their Spring Break of 2016. This is an incredible goal for not only our staff and students but for you to be able to help in the making of a dream come true. By supporting this campaign, you will have the opportunity to give a DWR student the experience of a lifetime to learn about the language, history, people, literature, and art of the Spanish and French cultures.

Our students have so much potential, they just need to believe in themselves. Beyond the incredible opportunity to experience the countries that they are visiting first hand, you are giving them the sentiment that you care about their future and you believe in their potential.

This is a huge ask especially because most of DWR students are considered low income.  A trip at this scale is never imagined even in their wildest dreams and that's why it would be so spectacular to be able to give this gift.

About DRW Prep: DRW Trading College Prep is a public 4-year charter high school located in Homan Square in Chicago, Illinois. It is a part of the Noble Network of Charter Schools. The student body is comprised of mainly of African American students (88%) and Hispanic students (12%). Among our students, 15% are special education and the majority of families qualify as low-income.

The students at DRW are held at the highest standards and are very deserving of your support. For more information please visit the DRW student expectation page.

story:
Our story

This is our story, we are three girls who have graduated recently, we tried to get a job, but we can’t find one. We had a chance to improve ourselves by undertaking the professional diploma in entrepreneurship and business application. While studying in this diplomas to learn about entrepreneurship, and to create our own work opportunity, we have crystallized our vision about entrepreneurship concept, and how we can build our ideas to become actual businesses. We then came up with an idea to give Gaza’s kids chance to think in creatively create innovative ideas, discover their hidden abilities and talents at an early age. We believe from our hearts that Gazan kids can do amazing things, despite the difficult lives they experience.





Our project

Our project offers young Gazan girls and boys aged 10-13 the opportunity to learn the principles of entrepreneurship and self-employment skills and through a range of interactive activities, formed as a mini-training course with training materials, to teach them how to generate entrepreneurial ideas and the basics to start their own business, building a plan and marketing it.

Gaza kidpreneurs camp gives kids the opportunity to get creative by teaching kids to start thinking creatively, planning to their life, and own their own business in future from an early age. We aim to spark the spirit of entrepreneurship for kids to set goals, work hard, and achieve their dreams.


What make Gaza kidpreneurs camp valuable REALLY?

·  The camp is a simple way to give kids entrepreneurial roots and encourage them to become kidpreneurs.

·  The camp encourages kids to think creatively and create innovative ideas.

·  The camp helps kids feel in control and plan lives.

·  The camp offers kids a chance to feel happy, and that they can do useful things.

·  The camp’s environments involves coaching, interactive activities, teamwork, leadership and competition sessions.  


https://www.facebook.com/pages/Gaza-kidpreneur/484531748364623


Why we need your help?

You’re not just taking care of the kids for a couple of hours, but you’re sharing much more with them.

We need your help, in order to help cover camp cost as well as to offer financial assistance to those kids participants who would otherwise not be able to attend.

We have a variety of fun and training activities planned for the kids. These activities, and the supplies we need, are broken down as follows:

·  Games,

·  Stationery,

·  T-shirts,

·  Food

·  Other activities.

With your donation, you can help us be the first and the best camp for Gaza kids (who livean unstable childhood life). We can become so that our kids are motivated to gain more advanced skills and learn about entrepreneurship and help kids to plan their life better. We need your generosity!


Impact

By donating to this campaign, you can help us achieve our dreams by putting kids on the first step on a success life. Our team is full of youth energy &working to accomplish our idea. We need a partner like you.


Other Ways You Can Help

Each contribution will help. However, while we know some people just can’t contribute, that doesn’t mean they can’t help.

Please help us make some noise about our campaign by sharing our story  on your Facebook page or Twitter feed, or by sharing it with people that you know can help, you are doing us a wonderful service. We appreciate that kind of support as well! Thank you!  


Contact us

Don't hesitate to reach out to us with any questions about our campaign. We are always happy to give us any suggestions or comments :) 

You can contact us at:

gaza.kidpreneur@gmail.com


Help Gaza kids make the most extraordinary experience of their life, by contributing to their brighter future.

sessions.  https://www.facebook.com/pages/Gaza-kidpreneur/484531748364623

Why we need your help?

You’re not just taking care of the kids for a couple of hours,
but you’re sharing much more with them.
We need your help, in order to help cover camp cost as well
as to offer financial assistance to those kids participants who would otherwise
not be able to attend. 
We have a variety of fun and training activities planned for
the kids. These activities, and the supplies we need, are broken down as
follows: 
· 
Games, 
· 
Stationery, 
· 
T-shirts, 
· 
Food
· 
Other activities.
With your
donation, you can help us be the first and the best camp for Gaza kids (who
livean unstable childhood life). We can become so that our kids
are motivated to gain more advanced skills and learn about entrepreneurship and help kids to plan their life better. We need your
generosity! 
Impact

By donating to this campaign, you can help us achieve our
dreams by putting kids on the first step on a success life. Our team is full of youth energy
&working to accomplish our idea. We need a partner like you.

Other Ways You Can Help

Each
contribution will help. However, while we know some people just can’t
contribute, that doesn’t mean they can’t help. 
Please
help us make some noise about our campaign by sharing our story  on your Facebook page or Twitter feed, or by
sharing it with people that you know can help, you are doing us a wonderful
service. We
appreciate that kind of support as well! Thank you!  Contact
us
Don't hesitate to reach out to us with any
questions about our campaign. We are always happy to give us any suggestions or comments :) 
You can contact us at:
gaza.kidpreneur@gmail.com

Help Gaza kids make the most extraordinary experience of
their life, by contributing to their brighter future.

story:
This fundraising page is organised by the Hamilton South branch SNP for the 2015 General Election in the Lanark and Hamilton East Constituency.

In 2010, Jimmy Hood managed 50% of the vote, with a majority of 13,478. Based on recent opinion polling, this would require a 13.9% swing towards the SNP.

With your support we can turn this constituency YELLOW!

Our task is achievable - but be under no illusion, it will not be easy.

This is only achievable with hard work, determination and a well-funded campaign. We will get the very best value out of any money we spend, but the more the better.

  • Well-designed, informative leaflets  are fundamental to help the electorate to make an informed choice
  • High-impact methods (billboard advertisements, lamppost posters etc.)  are important to allow our candidate to benefit from an increased profile within the area
  • Letters to past voters of the SNP to motivate them to vote for the party again, to get them involved and to ask them to help persuade a friend or family member, for instance, to help us in our Hood-eradication efforts
  • Plus many more innovative and effective campaigning methods!

We are an experienced campaign team and will put to use any amount of money we can spend, getting the best value and the best for the people of Lanark and Hamilton East and, therefore, better for the people of Scotland.

We understand that not everybody supports the SNP; that's democracy. In this area, we are the only option to get the representation at Westminster that Scotland badly needs.

Hood has significantly underperformed and the people of Lanark and Hamilton East are badly let down as a result. The House of Commons is rarely graced with his presence and few questions are ever raised on behalf of the people he represents.

Furthermore, when a question is asked, it will likely be regarding coal. Hood received a £7500 salary from Scottish Coal for nothing in particular (hence the symbolic target for this campaign).

Any amount is gratefully received. If you are unable to contribute, we understand - but would be grateful if you shared this campaign on social media and also by contacting your local SNP branch (if you are Hamilton, get in touch directly) to help out - there are tasks for all abilities and any great or small contribution will be welcome.

story:
The cause

Candle Light Foundation (CLF) and Alnæmisbörn, its long-time partner in Iceland, aim to build the capacity and skills of young vulnerable girls in Uganda to be able to support themselves, increase their security and their opportunity to find employment.

CLF has operated a vocational school in a leased space in the capital Kampala since 2001. The school offers vulnerable girls training in for example hairdressing, tailoring, baking, decoration, candle-making and computer skills and has been recognized and sponsored by the Ministry of Education and Sports in Uganda.


The objectives

Due to high rent in Kampala Candle Light Foundation will not be able to continue its important work for vulnerable girls without its own school building. Therefore, CLF and Alnæmisbörn, applied for and received funding from the Ministry of Foreign Affairs in Iceland to build a school for CLF in the vicinity of Kampala. The building is expected to be ready by March 2015.

Funding is still needed to furnish the school and therefore we are requesting your assistance to purchase what is needed to operationalize the school. This includes materials for the following subjects:

1.  Hair dressing – 2500 USD

2.  Fashion and design – 2000 USD

3.  Bakery  and catering – 2700 USD

4.  Computers – 2200 USD

5.  Decoration, flower arrangement, crafts and weaving – 1000 USD

6.  English – 600 USD

As all of our administrative costs are already covered by existing donors EVERY dollar you donate will be used only to equip and operationalize the vocational school. 


The impact

Women and men have not enjoyed equal opportunities in Ugandan society, especially when it comes to education. Women in Uganda often leave school at a young age due to factors such as poverty, loss of parents, childbirth and unsatisfactory conditions in schools for girls. The knowledge these girls and young women will gain at the school will increase their employment opportunities and have a positive effect on their lives.

The new school will ensure the continuing operation of the school in a sustainable manner as income that today goes towards paying rent can be used solely for training vulnerable girls. When completed and fully furnished, the CLF vocational school will provide vocational training for at least 230 vulnerable girls each year. 

With your assistance, CLF and Alnæmisbörn, can continue their important work to empower vulnerable girls through education!



Questions

You can find the homepage of CLF here: http://candlelightfoundation-ug.org/

For those who speak Icelandic here is Alnæmisbörn's homepage: www.hiv-born.is 

If you have any questions or need more information please contact us on alnaemisborn@gmail.com and we will get back to you as soon as possible.

story:
Here in the Yorkshire & Humber region we would like to give every voter the opportunity to vote for a Green Party MP. In order for us to stand candidates we need to raise a deposit1 of £500 for each one. As you can imagine, with 54 parliamentary seats in our region alone, this is quite a substantial sum for our party to raise.

You may be aware that the larger parties often take large donations from big business interests, but the Green Party are not funded in that way. Our campaigns are powered by party members and supporters like you.

Please help us support your local parliamentary candidate by giving what you can. With donations starting at just £1 we hope everyone can get involved. Please note: if you decide to donate more than £50 we will need to take some additional details2 from you before we can accept your kind offer of support.

Should we fail to raise the required £500 deposit for this constituency we would try to transfer funds from better funded areas. This will be a reciprocal arrangement so if this campaign is over funded our team will try to support as may other local candidates as possible. After funding deposits across the region, any remaining funds will be returned to the originating constituency, to support their campaigning efforts.

If you feel you are not able to contribute financially, you can still help by telling your friends and family, sharing our page (www.yorkshiregreen2015.com) on social media and following the campaign on Facebook and Twitter (links below) to stay up to date with progress. You can also volunteer to help the Green Party campaign by signing up here http://greenparty.org.uk/getinvolved/

Finally, of course, don’t forget that your vote counts on May 7th!

Many thanks for your helping in turning Yorkshire and Humber Green in 2015.

1Candidate deposits have been required since the 1985 general election

2For donations over £50 we are legally obligated to take a record of the donor's name and address and to also confirm the donor is on the UK electoral register.

Promoted by Bluebell Eikonoklastes on behalf of the Yorkshire and the Humber Region Green Party Parliamentary election candidate list both at Flat B, 77 Grange Avenue, Chapeltown, LEEDS, LS7 4EN.

story:
As part of my Global Experience for the Master's program in Social Entrepreneurship and Change at Pepperdine University, I'm gratefully challenged to volunteer my time in a developing country with the intention of understanding the culture and supporting the program initiatives that cater to the population in need of the services. As a result, I chose KENYA! 

Located in Nairobi, Kenya, Made in the Streets rescues children from the streets of Nairobi, Kenya, meeting their physical, emotional & spiritual needs, loving them fully, equipping them to earn a living and sending them out to a new life. 

My mission is to create innovative yet fun workshops that aids the orphan youth in discovering and developing personal attributes needed to become a successful entrepreneur or intrapreneur. This is a once in a lifetime experience for me. Throughout the mistakes and obstacles that I faced before deciding to earn my Master's degree, I would have never thought that I would not only travel to Kenya but support an outstanding organization with helping those who want to learn and what to change the community around them. WOW! How blessed am I?

Help me support the impact that Made in the Streets has already established. I'm seeking $2,000 to cover my airfare, lodging and meals, and vaccinations. I can't wait to share my experience with all of you!!!
