story:
UPDATES...

  • 73% tickets have been sold. Note: "Number Available" in perks section is decreasing as we sell tickets off-site. Tickets will not be sold at the door.
  • $1,000 contributed by Gustavson Faculty to date to the "Pay-it-Forward" MBA Endowment Fund. Thank you!

Summary

  • Friday, June 6.  Beginning at 7:30 pm, 476 Bay Street, Victoria...
  • DRESS: Smart Casual; Cocktail Party; Dressed Up
  • BRING: CASH and COIN for Bars - both Candy and Drinks
  • THINK: Arrange for a safe way home
  • PREPARE: To socialize, dance, drink and eat really delicious appies

It's a party for Gustavson School of Business MBA program community. We're celebrating  our accomplishments because as recent or soon-to-be graduates of the MBA program, we've been through a lot - travelled, laughed, cried, danced and banged our heads against the wall as we worked in teams, completed challenging projects and studied for exams. 


  • You get a truly fun evening of socializing, eating, drinking and dancing. An opportunity to hear or make a short speech and win some cohort chosen awards. Just $25/person.  Tickets will not be sold at the door. 
  • Our goal is not only to have a wonderful evening, but to pay our success forward by creating one or more financial awards for a Gustavson MBA student from the funds raised after all MBABash expenses have been paid. 
  •  It's not all about the students.  Family and friends who've endured our shenanigans and absences from home over the past years are to be celebrated too. 
  • Gustavson faculty, staff and mentors have been an integral part of our MBA journey and we'd like to celebrate their successes too. Phew! That's a lot of students to contend with.
  • We're hoping to have 10 MBA cohorts connect - from 2009-2013.  This event will strengthen our network - introduce us to MBA's we haven't had an opportunity to meet yet and reconnect with those we haven't seen in a while.

Sponsors

Spirits Sponsor AND "Name the Night's Cocktail": Shelter Point Distillery - http://www.shelterpointdistillery.com/

" While our single malt whiskey is quietly ageing in barrels, we are pleased to announce the arrival of our Still Master Vodka, triple distilled and infused with flavours you'll grow to love.

Blessed with a near perfect mix of fertile soil, sunshine, abundant fresh water and mild weather, the ingredients are here to produce true 'Field to Flask' spirits. Shelter Point Distillery is located on Vancouver Island, British Columbia, Canada. Its tranquil location is surrounded by the ever changing ocean, snow capped mountains, and a sparkling clear river. Like a postcard, only better."

Gourmet Sponsor #1: Servall Biometrics, Alberio Bathory-Frota (Gustavson MBA Grad Class of 2012) 

http://www.servallbiometrics.com/

 "Servall Biometrics produces innovative software for bars, nightclubs, and restaurants! Our industry's best products include ID scanners for bars and nightclubs, VIP (customer loyalty), Admissions (print your own admission tickets and entrance point of sale), Automated Guestlist, Automated Coat Check, Notifications via text messaging and patron frequency/demographic reports. Each one of our modules can be run individually or as a multi-module solution."

Gourmet Sponsor #2: Finest at Sea, Paul Chaddock (Gustavson MBA Grad Class of 2007) 

"We are the leading provider of the finest quality seafood on the West Coast. All our products are 100% wild and are caught by our own fishermen through sustainable fishing practices. "

Prize Sponsor #1: WindStars Music Academy, Anabel Wind (MBA by association - married to Ori Granot, Grad Class of 2014)

"WindStars Music Academy is happy to contribute a gift valued at $60 to the MBABash party. This includes 2 separate 30 minute music or voice lessons at the student's home, taught by WindStars faculty."

http://windstars.ca/


Prize Sponsor #2: Oregano's Pizza & Bistro, Jason Venkaya (MBA by association - brother to Amanda Venkaya, Grad Class of 2014)

"Oregano's Pizza and Bistro - Feeding addictions one slice at a time! Our vision at Oregano's is a simple one. We strive to provide Victoria with the best, most delicious pizzas in town! We have over 20 signature pizzas to choose from, but we welcome our customers to get creative and build their own with our long list offresh ingredients!" Shelbourne Plaza. 250.590.8884

http://www.oreganos.ca/

Prize Sponsor #3: Everything Wine, Langford. Community Sponsor.

http://www.everythingwine.ca/


What We Need & What You Get

  • Most important perk: your ticket @$25 to gain entrance to the MBABash. Order your ticket online on this site or send an INTERAC eTransfer directly to Dora Jessen. 

"Pay-it-Forward" Fundraising

  • Profits will go toward a "Pay-it-Forward" MBA endowment fund for future Gustavson MBA students.
  • Chris Graham has challenged the Gustavson MBA Faculty to match his $100 donation to this fund.  So far Angela Downey, Pat Elemans, Saul Klein, Wade Danis, Mia Maki, Elango, Monika Winn, Ian Robertson and Vivien Corwin have taken up the challenge and matched.  Note: To get a tax receipt please donate through the "Innovation Fund" Designation and note "Pay it Forward" in the comments section.  Gustavson Donation Page
  • This is an opportunity for you and your business to shine whether you're an entrepreneur, part of a multinational company, or a proud family member - your name and brand can stand out with a variety of the perks listed.
  • We expect to cover all our expenses by raising $2,500.  This includes the hall rental, licenses, bartender and DJ expenses as well as catering.  
  • We want to have a blast, so extras such as swag and crazy-good door prizes and a grand prize would be bonuses we could live with. Please check out the perks to see how you can add to the experience or contact us directly.

The Impact

  • Superb evening with the intensity that is Gustavson.
  • We'd like to pay the good times we've had forward by contributing to a financial award for future Gustavson MBA students.

Other Ways You Can Help - CO-CREATION!

  • Ask the people you know to donate to the cause and to share with businesses they deal with. Who knows what amazing things can come of sharing.
  • Co-create. You absolutely, positively must know this term in order to get your MBA. Let me know what would add to the fun of the MBABash and we'll see if we can make it happen.  Suggestions and feedback are welcome.

story:
The Saturday School Program for Positive Education is an educational and cultural enrichment program for Black youth in 5th-8th grades.  We strive to provide quality education centered around the history, culture and experiences of Black people. Our reading, writing and math curriculum  is designed to help build and foster identity, character development, self esteem, community and collective work and responsibility.   We have recently relaunched the program at a new site in the Austin community on Chicago' s west side.


Here's an email from a parent that enrolled her 9 and 12 year old daughters in the program in May 2014...."I just want to thank you for your program. My daughters enjoyed themselves so much and have not stopped talking about their experience on yesterday."

Funds raised will be used to pay rent for space used, supplies and materials, including healthy snacks, advertisements, etc.
story_txt:
The Saturday School Program for Positive Education is an educational and cultural enrichment program for Black youth in 5th-8th grades.  We strive to provide quality education centered around the history, culture and experiences of Black people. Our reading, writing and math curriculum  is designed to help build and foster identity, character development, self esteem, community and collective work and responsibility.   We have recently relaunched the program at a new site in the Austin community on Chicago' s west side.Here's an email from a parent that enrolled her 9 and 12 year old daughters in the program in May 2014...."I just want to thank you for your 
program. My daughters enjoyed themselves so much and have not stopped 
talking about their experience on yesterday."Funds raised will be used to pay rent for space used, supplies and materials, including healthy snacks, advertisements, etc.

story:
1) What does the help consist of?

     I want to go to Germany to get the education of a film director. At this very moment my German is not very good, so may be I’ll have to join university or school language courses. In order to get a national(student) visa I must render a bank statement of the locked bank account that must contain 8040€ (11000$ visa + 1000$ Fees = 12 000$). National(student) visa can be given if you are enrolled to university or if you go to attend language courses with the purpose of future studying at higher education institution of Germany.

2) My prehistory.

Everything started when I was 13 years old...

     I watched the films like an "Alien", "Alien vs Predator", "Star Wars, "Exorcism" and many others for the first time. I talked to myself: “God, that’s wonderful, I can make films like these and even not worse”. These films impressed me greatly and it was the beginning, the genesis of my big dream...

     I lived without parents for some time, so nobody could buy instruments and camera for me. When I was 14 y.o. I worked at building area, earned money for my life, instruments and video equipment. If there was some free time we gathered with friends, we shot short films, music clips, held rehearsals, gave concerts. And now it’s time to move on to my big dream...

3) Why Germany and not any other country?

  • For the first, that’s the financial side of the question. For example in the USA, Canada or UK the tuition for one year is approximately 25000-50000$. In Russia the tuition for 1 year is 15000-25000$. And in Germany the education is either free or conventionally free, it means that a student must pay only for student fee the amount if which is 200-600€. That’s a big advantage.
  • For the second, during my studying at higher education institution I’m allowed to work, so in such a way I’ll be able to defray the expenses completely or partially.
  • For the third I consider that German cinematography school is of the best and the strongest ones. In Germany I’ll be able to be under tutelage of the best world masters.

4) Why films and not something else?

     You may ask me this question and I’ll answer with pleasure. If it were not for the magic of the films, I don’t know what I would do now. Cinematography takes a great place in my life. Being a creative person I consider that all kinds of art are connected with one another, but cinematography consists of everything from music till literature, therefore cinematography is the kind of art with the help of which I can and I want to express myself all round.

5) What's the locked account and why 8040€?

     Locked bank account is an account for all foreign students who want to study in Germany. Opening of locked bank account is required by German embassies. Money put at this bank account is used for living in Germany for one year, the amount is 8040€(11000$) and when the student is in Germany he/she can draw maximum 670€(917$) from an account per 1 month.

6) Why is the project created in USD currency?

     Everything is very easy, I opened a bank account in USA currency as its account is served easier and cheaper at the bank I use in Russia. The currency of your contribution doesn’t matter as the currency conversion will be done automatically. 

7) Should I be trusted? RISKS & CHALLENGES.

     I think - yes. I do believe in my own success. This is the deal of all my life and I’m not going to deceive you and  thereby myself.

     I judged this project with minimal risks as I have everything in order to get a visa and to go to study to Germany. I have everything except funding resources for one year of my living in Germany. Maybe I’ll have to join additional language courses in order to pass language exam successfully. My life is public so you can control(monitor) all the changes, news and current of events by links:

  •  To Go To Study To Germany (VK)
  •  To Go To Study To Germany (Facebook)
  •  Evgeny Balalaev (Twitter)
  •  Evgeny Balalaev (Facebook)

8) What if won’t manage to get a necessary amount of money?

     If it happens in such a way and the aim won’t be reached, I plan to start the second part of a project. In this way much more people will know about my dream, intentions and will have a desire to help me.

     Also I look for additional sources of income intensely.

     I believe that we’ll succeed!

  "I’m too far to turn back."


I know that the sum is quite big but - “many a little makes a mickle”.


9) How else  can you help me?

  • Please, tell everybody you can about this project.
  • Please, distribute this link in all social networks and mass media.
Please, help me to make my dream come true, and I won’t leave a favour unanswered.

Thanks a lot!!!

story:
Lori’s Hands is a grassroots, community health service learning organization founded at the University of Delaware in 2009. Founder Sarah LaFave named the organization in memory of her mother, Lori, who died in 2003 from breast cancer. Lori’s Hands connects college student volunteers with people in their communities who have chronic illnesses. Students provide in-home assistance (grocery shopping, yard work, light cleaning) and, in turn, these community members teach the students about the human experience of chronic illness. Lori’s Hands provides relief to patients during difficult times, and helps future professionals become more aware of the every day challenges that come with illness.

The Lori's Hands volunteer experience is now part of a service learning course at the University of Delaware. In the classroom, students learn about chronic illness from a wide range of interdisciplinary perspectives. Topics include public policy, the economic burden of healthcare in America, Caregiver Role Strain, and a patient's own sense of identity. In addition, students are required to make a weekly volunteer visit to a client with an illness such as cancer, Parkinson's, COPD, ALS, or MS. The course offers a unique opportunity for students to fill a gap in the community and provide a much needed service for patients, while also gaining knowledge and experiences that will better prepare them for future careers in human services, healthcare, or public policy. 

Lori's Hands is ready to grow beyond the UD campus! The $50,000 raised through this campaign will allow us to hire our first paid staff person who will support students and faculty at other campuses who want to start chapters. We have received dozens of calls and emails from people who want help founding Lori's Hands at their schools. We want to offer our streamlined processes and years of experience to these eager individuals so that their chapters can be successful. One full-time staff person could support fifteen or more chapters, enabling Lori's Hands to reach hundreds of patients who need support, instead of dozens, and to impact thousands of students instead of hundreds.

story:
THANK YOU! 

The campaign is now finished and whilst we did not reach our desired funding goal, we are very pleased that so many of you got involved to help Awra Amba build their high school. 

The high school was inaugurated in September 2012 and now services over 500 students from a radius of 20km from Awra Amba. Only 38 of the students are from the Awra Amba Community. 

If you'd like to follow the community's next steps, and stay involved, please take a look at our new project - The Awra Amba Experience - an interactive documentary produced in collaboration with the Awra Amba community - allowing their voices and important views on social change gain a global platform. 

Support HERE. 

Thank you!

Paulina and the Awra Amba Team 


The Awra Amba Story

Awra Amba is a small community located in the North West of Ethiopia – a rural, undeveloped area where most people rely on subsistence farming. The brainchild of an Ethiopian farmer called Zumra Nuru, Awra Amba was founded in the 1970s with the goal of solving socio-economic problems through helping one another in an environment of egalitarianism. Zumra himself had not had access to education and his ideas were based on lived experiences and a strong desire to create a more just society that respects all human beings. Today, almost 40 years later, the community is universally lauded as a model to alleviate poverty and promote gender equality in a country where women are generally subservient to men. Awra Amba is an extraordinary initiative within a traditional and conservative community because of its gender equality, its work ethic, its social security system and its strong belief in education.

 

We are a group of filmmakers and friends of Awra Amba, who have known them for years and are very enthusiastic about their progressive self-help philosophy. We want to support them with their self-initiated school project. The nearest high school currently is a 14 km walk from Awra Amba and there is a real need for a high school in the area. With their own resources, the community has already started building the foundations for the school and constructing one classroom. They still need to build more classrooms, a library and a science lab in order to meet Government standards to run the school.

 

Awra Amba’s goal is to build a society with good values and a strong work ethic. They believe that education is key to this. They want to educate young people to be creative and entrepreneurial citizens. The school will educate both children from Awra Amba and the surrounding communities within a 20 km radius. Although they have come a long way in making their dream a reality, the project is now facing financial challenges where it needs our little help.

 

Why should I support them? 

Your contribution will give hundreds of children an opportunity for the kind of education that opens doors to a better life. The high school will make a huge difference to the lives of children both in Awra Amba and in the wider community, and ultimately produce intelligent, confident and entrepreneurial young people who can develop their own communities without relying on foreign aid, leading to a more sustainable lifestyle. 

We know that our funding goal is ambitious, but so are the goals of the Awra Amba Community. Even if we do not reach the full amount, whatever amount is raised will help the community immensely in completing their project. 

 

How will the money be used?

Our support will help the community complete a second classroom, a library and a science lab. These are the minimum requirements for Government approval of the school. Any amount we can raise will go directly to the community, who are actively working on the construction of the school. We will be posting regular updates on the school’s progress on this page. 


A quote from Zumra Nuru, Awra Amba community: 

"We are not asking for aid; we are asking you to help us build our society and the future of our children which will help us fight poverty and to be a good model for citizens across Ethiopia."


Spread the word.  Spread the word online on your preferred social networks, tell your friends, family, work colleagues, neighbours, local cafe-keepers, pub landlords, hairdressers and anyone who you regularly chat to. Ask them to match your donation.  


Organise a fundraising lunch – why not get your whole workplace or community involved with fundraising? We will provide you with presentation materials, including a set of slides from the village, and posters to print and put up in the office. Then just get your colleagues together at lunchtime for 30 minutes and fundraise together! By donating a bigger amount to the school, you are also eligible for bigger, better perks! 


Organise a fundraising screening – for the ambitious ones amongst you, we recommend you organise a fundraising screening of the film Awra Amba – Utopia in Ethiopia. Find a room with a projector or go to your local church or community centre, ask if you can use their premises for a good cause. Contact us to purchase or rent a screening copy of the film and advertise for the screening in your community with our posters. On special request one of us will also do our best to connect to your screening via skype.

story:
Short Summary

My name is Bryn, and I am the captain of a high school Ultimate Frisbee team in New York City.  Our team has been around for years, but we have never receieved funding from our school.  Last year, we ran out of discs for practice and games, and we have no money to buy more.  We are looking for a way to raise money to order discs for our team, and we need your help!  Please donate what you can!

What We Need 

We need as much money as we can get; the more you donate, the more discs we can order and the cheaper they will be.  All money will go towards ordering discs, which will then be sold to create a perpetual fund for discs, ameliorating our need for funding.  No matter how much we raise, it will all go towards ordering discs, so please donate!

The Impact

Our team has never recieved funding, so any donations you can make will go a long way towards helping us buy equipment, and towards making us financially independent.  Our team is one of a few in the New York City Ultimate league, and any money you can donate will help both our team, the BardBarians Ultimate team, and the league grow.  It will also help those on our team who cannot afford discs get equipment so that they can practice and play on their own, and show their support for team at the same time. Lastly, you will be helping the awesome sport of Ultimate grow, not only in my school, but in New York City and the nation.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you cannot donate money to our campaign, please like this campaign page, and tell your friends and family about our campaign.  We need people to donate, so any way you can help us would be much appreciated.

story:
Short Summary

Hi, my name is Bria and I am a 10th grade student from Brooklyn. I was nominated to take part in the People to People Student Ambassador Program. However, the only way I can take part in this life-changing opportunity is to raise the money by myself. I am excited for the challenge but need your help.

  • My campaign is to become a Student Ambassador for The People to People Ambassador program. This will allow me to utilize my summer to earn high school and college credit, volunteer in local communities and explore the unique cultures of Australia. This will also greatly increase my chances of getting into my first-choice college.
  • This experience is important to me because it enables me to explore the world and different cultures. It will allow me to become a global citizen and gain a new respect for different places and their cultures that otherwise I wouldn't be able to do by myself.
  • This experience is only possible through your generous contributions. Even if my project is not fully funded through this site, my advisor, and school community will not stop until my project is fully funded...but it won't be possible without your help. 

Why is the People to People Amassador Program Important?

Here is a link to the program site:

http://peopletopeople.com/

Words from the Program itself:

More than 80% of Ambassador alumni report acceptance into their first-choice college. Not only can students earn college credit but they can also build the maturity and character that top colleges are looking for.

The international programs encourage responsibility, teach young travelers to thrive outside of their home environments, and are often a source of personal inspiration for years to come.

Student Ambassadors get out into the world and hear foreign languages, taste new foods, and see other cultures firsthand through immersive homestays, language lessons, and enriching cultural activities.

People to People's cross-cultural interactions improve cultural intelligence in ways that other trips simply can't.  A global perspective is a must-have for students who want to impact their world. A few week's travel as a Student Ambassador has been shown to be as powerful as a full semester's study abroad!

What We Need & What You Get

  • The full cost of the People to People Student Ambassador Program is $7,000. This covers the entire program cost, which includes: college and high school courses, community service, travel, airfaire, flight insurance and the program security deposit.

The Impact

  • The People to People program benefits not only myself but also the communities and people I will serve during the program in Australia.
  • All donations, no matter how small, are invaluable to me as I am responsible for fundraising 100% of the program cost.
  • Even if my project is not fully funded through this site, my advisor, teachers and I are determined to fully fund the project. My advisor and I are doing our own fundraising projects as well to take every possible step to raise money. We will not stop until my project is fully funded.

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you can’t contribute, you can help equally as much by getting the word out to those who can!

  • Get the word out amongst family, friends and coworkers who are passionate about urban education!
  • Spread the word via email, Facebook and Indiegogo share tools!

Even if my project is not fully funded through this site, my advisor, teachers and I are determined to fully fund the project. My advisor and I are doing our own fundraising projects as well to take every possible step to raise money. We will not stop until my project is fully funded.
Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you can’t contribute, you can help equally as much by getting the word out to those who can!

Get the word out amongst family, friends and coworkers who are passionate about urban education!
Spread the word via email, Facebook and Indiegogo share tools!

story:
(Version française plus basse)

For 1 million babies every year, their day of birth is also their day of death. More than a third of neonatal deaths take place on the day of birth and close to 2 million newborns die in the first week of life. High-impact interventions focused on the 24 hours around the time of birth, hold the greatest potential for reducing neonatal mortality (1).

Too many newborns miss out on key interventions that can save their lives.

Every year 10 million babies require help to breathe immediately after birth. Simple means to stimulate breathing, including drying and rubbing, and ventilation with bag-valve-mask, could save the majority of these babies. Such lifesaving care is currently only available for less than one out of four newborns(2).

Neonatal mortality statistics can give a certain view of a population's health. However, often unaccounted for is the Mayan population of the Western highlands where neonatal mortality rates possibly double that which represent the general Guatemalan population(3).

The majority of Mayan woman of San Juan la Laguna Guatemala give birth at home assisted by local birth attendants.

I am a nurse clinician, specializing in neonatal and infant care. I have been teaching resuscitation skills for over 10 years in affiliation with the Heart and Stroke Foundation of Canada. I have also completed the Helping Babies Breathe Master Trainer's program. In Spring 2014 I participated in a Global Health research project where I had the opprtunity to visit Dr. Aldo Casteneda, pediatric cardiologist, UNICAR Guatemala where I learned about the disparities in health care between the local Mayan population and the population at large.

This March 2015, I will be returning to San Juan Laguna Guatemala, where I have been asked by local leaders to teach a new cohort of 18 local Mayan women and practicing birth attendants. I will be conducting the first week long Helping Babies Breathe (HBB) training session, integrating HBB into a pre-existing midwife training program. A request for my presence came via the program director and local midwife community leader, in affiliation with the Organization for the Development of the Indigenous Maya ODIM.

Need:

$4,125  to cover costs for:

- 20 Re-usable neonatal bag-valve-masks for training and later use

- 10 Neonatal training manikins

- Various training material 

- Home Birth kit items  

  • 2-4 sterile gauze pads
  • 2 alcohol pads
  • 3 pairs of gloves (do not have to be sterile)
  • 1 small bar bath soap
  • Small bottle of hand sanitizer
  • disposable clamps (some midwives us clamps others don't)
  • 1 soft cotton hat for the baby
  • 1 soft blanket to wrap the baby


(1) Credited to: Save the Children Birth Day Risk Index

(2) Credited to: helpingbabiesbreathe.org

(3) Credited to: Journal of Global Health Perspectives. Journal of Global Health Perspec, Health care issues facing the Mayan People of the Guatemalan Highlands.(2012)

--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------Pour 1 million de bébés chaque année, le jour de leur naissance correspond aussi au jour de leur décès. Plus du tiers des décès néonatals se produisent le jour de la naissance et près de 2 millions de nouveau-nés meurent dans la première semaine de vie. Les interventions déterminantes, ciblées autour des 24 premières heures de vie, s’avèrent les plus efficaces pour réduire le taux de mortalité néonatale. (1).

Un trop grand nombre de nouveau-nés sont privés d'interventions essentielles qui pourraient leur sauver la vie. 

Chaque année, 10 millions de bébés ont besoin d'aide pour respirer à la naissance. Des moyens simples pour stimuler la respiration, y compris le séchage et le frottement ainsi que la ventilation avec un ballon-masque, pourraient sauver la majorité de ces bébés. Présentement, moins d’un nouveau-né sur quatre bénéficie d’un accès à ces techniques de premiers secours(2).

Les statistiques de mortalité néonatale présentent un certain portrait de la santé d'une population. Cependant, on sous-estime souvent les taux de mortalité néonatale chez la population maya des hautes terres de l'ouest, qui représenteraient le double du taux de la population générale du Guatemala(3).La majorité de femmes mayas de San Juan la Laguna au Guatemala donne naissance à la maison, assistée par des accoucheuses locales.

Je suis une infirmière clinicienne, spécialisée dans les soins néonatals et de la petite enfance. J'enseigne des techniques de réanimation depuis plus de 10 ans, en affiliation avec la Fondation des maladies du cœur du Canada. J'ai égalementsuivi la formation de « Master trainer » Helping Babies Breathe (Aider les bébés à respirer). En mars 2015, je pars pour San Juan la Laguna , où les dirigeants locaux m’ont demandéde former une nouvelle cohorte de 18 femmes mayas locales, accompagnantes à la naissance. Je présenterai la première semaine de formation « Helping Babies Breathe », intégrée dans un programme de formation sage-femme préexistant. Cette demande de formation provient du directeur de programme et chef de la communauté locale de sages-femmes, en collaboration avec l'Organisation pour le développement des indigènes maya (ODIM). 
Besoins : 
— Ballons-masques néonatals réutilisables (20) 
— Mannequins de formation néonatale (10) 
— Matériaux d'enseignement 
— Matériel pour l’accouchement à la maison (home birth kits )

story:
Short Summary

Testclues is your chance to help students, job seekers & working professionals to Learn, Certify & Land into their Dream Jobs.

I am Pawan Sharma and working as an IT professional for almost 12 years now. Every year me, my friends and colleagues spend thousands of dollars in fees for career certifications and almost similar amount is spent in buying resources to help us pass those exams. 

With TestClues, We wish to provide online exam simulators, mock tests and practice exams with full featured grading & scoring along with a site wide Ranking System. 

What We Need & What You Get

We had already launched the platform by funding it from our savings. Platform is already live at - 

http://www.testclues.com

We need more money to be able to add more exams to the platform and move it a better hosting platform in order to support more user traffic. 

Any funding received from this campaign would be invested in accomplishing the following task - 

  • Exam Request Tool - A Small tool to help candidates request for any exam which is not available on the portal. Within a stipulated timeline practice exam for the same would be published. 
  • Social Training Platform - An integrated platform where users will be able to post training events and provide trainings to other candidates voluntarily.
  • Add More Exams - We would expand our team to add more and more exams to the portal so as maximum users can benefit out of it. 
  • Notes Sharing - Candidates would be able to share their notes and learnings from their attempts and preparations
  • Job Recommendation - Get automatic job recommendations based on the practice exams cleared. 
This Might Help - 


The Impact

This would help and save thousands of hard earned dollars for everybody who wish to pursue any career certification. This portal would help test your readiness for the exam and let you know if you are about to waste your exam fee. You would be able to check your answers and improve on the mistakes in the next practice test attempt. 

Testclues is already live and helping IT professionals and students in passing their exams. We need your help and contribution to take it next level.


Help us spread the word about TestClues by email and social media. Earn a Free Exam Voucher (For Pearson Vue) for every US$ 250 raised from your referral .

The fine print: Once the Indiegogo campaign is over we will apply all your earned credits for referrals to your account for issuing the exam vouchers (All necessary details like exam code & test country etc. would be requested later). Contributors cannot refer themselves. Only the contributor named by a referred person at the time of the referred person’s purchase will receive credit. To receive credit, you must first be an TestClues Indiegogo contributor.

Risks & Challenges

Updating these exams would need continuous efforts and manpower. We plan to offer advertisements and onsite donations to keep it free for everybody and forever.  

Other Ways You Can Help

Its not always the money which would mark your contribution in a campaign. Would request you to please share and spread the campaign to maximise the reach. 

Please indiegogo share tool to promote this campaign.

story:
Right now, I'm a student in Melbourne, from a country in Asia. I was trying to finish my undergraduate arts studies, and I did not care about my grades as I should have done. I am here on a scholarship from the Bruneian government, and I have breached the terms of my bond by failing in subjects. Now, I have to finish at least another year's worth of subjects in order to complete my Bachelor of Arts. I should not have failed, since breaching the contract will cost me about half a million to pay back, since that was how much my government has sponsored me so far. I hold myself responsible for my actions, which I am ashamed of now. So, I want to make up for everything. I want to keep studying so I can support my family. You can help me change my future, and my family's, and aid my turnaround.

I took the scholarship in the hope of gaining employment from the Bruneian government. I have failed them, so it’s only fair they withdraw me from their Ministry of Education based scholarship. Since I am an international student in Australia, there are not many scholarships available to us, and especially myself, since I do not meet many requirements. But if I can pay for another year, and do well, then more opportunities will open up to me. Neither my parents are employed, since both of them cannot work anymore. My mother has contracted a cyst and this has affected her ability to support her family, and my father is on pension. Furthermore, I have three younger brothers who aren’t yet in uni. By failing my obligations, I have put them in trouble. I don’t want to make them work themselves because of mistakes I have made.

Let me illustrate: a civil servant in the Bruneian government may earn as little as about 800/month. Wages where I am from aren’t as high as OECD countries, so it will take my parents ages to work my debt off.

This campaign is important to me now, because, it will help me and my family out of poverty, and build a better future for ourselves. And for me personally, a lesson hard learnt. I have done wrong, and I want to be able to move forward from my past, and be someone who is responsible and can take care of himself and others. I hope this opportunity, right after my failure, will allow me to serve and be part of the global community.

By contributing to this campaign, you will have lifted a family out of poverty and put their children through university, so that we may gain employment, and a tomorrow. We do not have a highly developed welfare system back where I am from, and there are limited opportunities for the poor to get help (and if there is, there isn't much in it for them). though I have wasted this opportunity, it is also a chance for me to grow.

The $531,200 can be broken down as follows:

AUD500, 000 is for paying back the bond

AUD31, 200 goes towards paying for my tuition fees (to finish my bachelors degree). This covers the cost of 10 subjects, which cost AUD3, 120 each for international students.

When I graduate from my Bachelor of Arts at the University of Melbourne, I will send all my contributors some photos of my graduation.

As I do not have much at the moment, I can only manage thanks and prayers, as well as continual correspondence at present. But I hope that in the future, we can arrange to meet, perhaps skype, so that I can thank you in person once I am able to (which I hope will be sooner rather  than later). I will also send you thank you gifts, and would welcome your continued encouragement in my academic growth.

To overcome my challenges ahead, I will do whatever it takes to do well in my studies. I will manage reading for my essays better, and work more ambitiously. If I can manage another year in my Bachelors, that will be because you helped.

It would be great, if you all could spread this campaign around! If I do not reach my goal, I will use whatever is there to pay for my last year of uni and pay off the debt. Thank you.

Oh, and here is my email, say hello so I can send you a thanks for your contribution:

Danny1992dz@gmail.com

story:
We are a group of six high school students currently attending Peak to Peak Charter School in Lafayette, CO who have recently been presented with an unheard of opportunity to travel to Cuba. While there, we will be able to further our bilingual education, witness Cuba's unique, centrally-planned economic system in action and volunteer at both a Havana school and an organic farm. We are all extremely excited to be going there given the life-changing nature of the trip. It will take place over 12 days from December 26 to January 6 and will be led by both Jeff Phillippe and Andrew Matthews.

Jeff Phillippe, a former Peak to Peak teacher now living in Cuba, has recently secured a permit from the US State Department to take a group of high school students there. Andrew Matthews is the current upper-level spanish teacher at Peak to Peak High School and has also helped organized the trip. 

Since this opportunity arose so quickly and we must travel over winter break, we have had an extremely limited time to fundraise in traditional ways. That's where Indie GoGo comes in :)

*No one is profiting off this trip since the trip is not through a travel agency, but rather organized by Jeff Phillippe and Andrew Matthews*

story:
(English version see below)
Mein Name ist Kristina Stary, ich leite Chöre und bringe am liebsten andere Menschen zum Singen.  Außerdem bin ich Pianistin, was mein Hauptfach im Musikstudium in Stuttgart war.  Um mehr über mich zu erfahren, besuche meine Webseite www.starypiano.de

Nun möchte ich bei den besten Lehrern in moderner, groovebetonter Musik studieren  - und zwar in Dänemark, am Royal conservatory in Aalborg. Das macht mich zu einer besseren Chorleiterin, und ich möchte die Idee eines "Intelligenten Chores" auch in Deutschland verbreiten.  Wir singen viel ohne Noten, improvisieren spielerisch und lernen alles was mit Rhythmus und Styles zu tun hat.  Die Chöre der Zukunft werden experimentierfreudiger und selbstständiger. Aus Dänemark kommen einige der weltbesten Jazz- und Popchöre!

Dort zu studieren bedeutet für mich dreimal pro Semester nach Aalborg zu reisen. Auch wenn es anstrengend ist, komme ich jedesmal voller Begeisterung und Inspiration zurück. Nur die Studiengebühren sind für mich alleine eine zu große Hürde. Mit Euch allen kann ich es schaffen, jeder noch so kleine Betrag ist wichtig!


Ich steige mit dem "Inspiration course in Rhythmic choir conducting" ein. Dieser dauert  zwei Semester, und falls ich in den Masterstudiengang wechseln würde, wären es insgesamt vier Semester.  Jedes Semester kostet mit Fahrtkosten 1700 EUR. 

Ganz einfach: Ich kann das Studium so lange machen, wie ich finanziell unterstützt werde. Mein Wunsch ist es nun, erst einmal zwei Semester "Inspiration course" zu finanzieren.  Falls nur der Betrag für ein Semester zusammenkommt, bin ich auch dafür dankbar und kann mit dem Studium beginnen.

Als selbstständige Musikerin in der Aufbauphase kann ich zur Zeit gerade so meinen Lebensunterhalt bestreiten. Es bleibt jedoch nichts übrig um etwas beiseite zu legen.  Trotzdem ist es mir ein Herzenswunsch, mich weiterzubilden und noch mehr Menschen Freude an der Musik und am Singen zu vermitteln.  Herzlichen Dank für Deine Mithilfe!!!

Wenn Du gerade gar nichts geben kannst oder möchtest, kannst Du meine Kampagne trotzdem unterstützen, indem Du sie an möglichst viele Menschen weiterleitest. Bei meinen großzügigsten Unterstützern komme ich gerne für ein Hauskonzert oder ein Coaching vorbei. Falls die Aktion ein solcher Erfolg wird, dass mehr zusammenkommt, als ich für mein Studium brauche, gehen die Überschüsse zur Hälfte an HOPE e.V. (Hospital Organisation of Pedagogues in Europe)  und der Stiftung "Singende Krankenhäuser".


________________________________________________________________________

Hello! My name is Kristina Stary. I am a choir conductor and I love to inspire people sing more in their lives. I am also an accomplished pianist: piano was the focus of my musical studies at the Musikhochschule Stuttgart. During that time, I discovered my abilities as a choir conductor.


To further my knowledge of music, I want to study with the best teachers in modern, groove-orientated choral music - and the teachers I seek happen to be in Denmark at the Royal Conservatory in Aalborg. Denmark is the home of some of Europe's best Jazz- and Pop-choirs! It follows that the best teachers would also be found in Denmark as well.
My studies will make me being a better choral conductor and help me spread the idea of the "Intelligent Choir" across Germany. To expand the well-known, traditional path of choral directing, in our courses we sing a lot without sheet music, which allows us to improvise in playful ways and focus intently on rhythm and musical styles. and focus intently on rhythm and musical styles. The choirs of the future, which I hope to direct, will be more self-reliant and eager to try out new things.

For my studies, I would be traveling three times per semester to Aalborg (16 hours per train). Although it is demanding, the knowledge, inspiration, and excitement I would gain every time is worth it. The tuition fees, however, prove at this time to be a large obstacle for me alone.


Starting January 2015, I will start with the "Inspiration Course in Rhythmic Choir Conducting". The programs run for two semesters; if I pursue the masters course during my studies, it would take an additional two semesters. The tuition cost per semester is 1700 EUR (including traveling expenses).

So long as I am supported financially, I am able to pursue my dream and continue my studies. At a minimum, it is my wish to finance the two semesters of the "Inspiration” course. If I collect the amount for one semester only, I will be deeply grateful for this also, and can begin my studies in earnest.

As a self-employed musician just starting out, I am able to cover my living costs paycheck-to-paycheck. My savings account is a bit wanting. Despite all this, it is my dearest wish to upgrade my education and impart the joy of music and the power of singing to more and more people. And with your generous support, I can do that!!!

Of this campaign, my goal is to solely finance my studies. Any donations that exceed my tuition needs will be charitably donated to the HOPE e.V. (Hospital Organisation of Pedagogues in Europe) and the "Singende Krankenhäuser" (Singing Hospitals) foundation, which provides open singing groups in hospitals to support healing work.

Together with all of you I can succeed; any and every amount, large and small, will be important!

For more information about me, please take a look at my website www.starypiano.de            English version via Google Translator (just in case you don't speak German).
story_txt:
(English version see below)Mein Name ist Kristina Stary, ich leite Chöre und bringe am liebsten andere Menschen zum Singen.  Außerdem bin ich Pianistin, was mein Hauptfach im Musikstudium in Stuttgart war.  Um mehr über mich zu erfahren, besuche meine Webseite www.starypiano.de
Nun möchte ich bei den besten Lehrern in moderner, groovebetonter Musik studieren  - und zwar in Dänemark, am Royal conservatory in Aalborg. Das macht mich zu einer besseren Chorleiterin, und ich möchte die Idee eines "Intelligenten Chores" auch in Deutschland verbreiten.  Wir singen viel ohne Noten, improvisieren spielerisch und lernen alles was mit Rhythmus und Styles zu tun hat.  Die Chöre der Zukunft werden experimentierfreudiger und selbstständiger. Aus Dänemark kommen einige der weltbesten Jazz- und Popchöre!
Dort zu studieren bedeutet für mich dreimal pro Semester nach Aalborg zu reisen. Auch wenn es anstrengend ist, komme ich jedesmal voller Begeisterung und Inspiration zurück. Nur die Studiengebühren sind für mich alleine eine zu große Hürde. Mit Euch allen kann ich es schaffen, jeder noch so kleine Betrag ist wichtig!



Ich steige mit dem "Inspiration course in Rhythmic choir conducting" ein. Dieser dauert  zwei Semester, und falls ich in den Masterstudiengang wechseln würde, wären es insgesamt vier Semester.  Jedes Semester kostet mit Fahrtkosten 1700 EUR.  
Ganz einfach: Ich kann das Studium so lange machen, wie ich finanziell unterstützt werde. Mein Wunsch ist es nun, erst einmal zwei Semester "Inspiration course" zu finanzieren.  Falls nur der Betrag für ein Semester zusammenkommt, bin ich auch dafür dankbar und kann mit dem Studium beginnen. 
 Als selbstständige Musikerin in der Aufbauphase kann ich zur Zeit gerade so meinen Lebensunterhalt bestreiten. Es bleibt jedoch nichts übrig um etwas beiseite zu legen.  Trotzdem ist es mir ein Herzenswunsch, mich weiterzubilden und noch mehr Menschen Freude an der Musik und am Singen zu vermitteln.  Herzlichen Dank für Deine Mithilfe!!!

Wenn Du gerade gar nichts geben kannst oder möchtest, kannst Du meine Kampagne trotzdem unterstützen, indem Du sie an möglichst viele Menschen weiterleitest. Bei meinen großzügigsten Unterstützern komme ich gerne für ein Hauskonzert oder ein Coaching vorbei. Falls die Aktion ein solcher Erfolg wird, dass mehr zusammenkommt, als ich für mein Studium brauche, gehen die Überschüsse zur Hälfte an HOPE e.V. (Hospital Organisation of Pedagogues in Europe)  und der Stiftung "Singende Krankenhäuser".

story:
Our Story

 

Thanda After- School was started three years ago in Kwa-Zulu Natal, South Africa by Angela Larkan, one of a few leading forces who has studied the wide-reaching, negative effects of the AIDS pandemic and rural poverty, and who has come up with workable, holistic solutions. She was first moved to design a support system for orphans after learning about the enormous scale of the problem and realizing that her home country, South Africa, could not support so many orphans. Today, there are 33 million people living with HIV/AIDS in Africa and there are already 12 million orphans; one fifth of South African children are orphans.

 

Through education, mentoring and community-driven initiatives, Thanda After-School is inspiring and teaching South Africa’s most vulnerable children to be future leaders. Thanda After-School knows that by giving the next generation the tools they need to cope with the daily traumas they face and overcome the underlying problems that HIV/AIDS is leaving in its wake, local communities can discover opportunities and find the means to triumph over hardships like poverty, disease, and lack of education.

Thanda After-School’s approach is based on the traditional Zulu culture whereby the community assists members in need. Thanda After-School's unique approach uses already-existing local resources – such as classrooms and sports fields – to provide support to vulnerable children after school every day, enabling them to stay in their community while learning education and life skills.

 

Thanda currently operates in three low –performing government schools, where resources are extremely limited and pass rates are very low. Thanda After-School enrolls 325 orphans of AIDS and other vulnerable children aged between 5 and 22 years, in eleven different after school programs each day, such as computers, art, soccer, basketball, dancing, agriculture and construction.

 

Thanda employs young role models from within the community to be mentors for these students, filling the developmental and emotional gaps left by missing parents and overwhelmed caregivers. 

Thanda uses activities such as agriculture to teach kids about team work, respect, and leadership. Thanda also focuses on HIV prevention, skills development, and guidance as part of the mentorship provided every day. Every aspect of Thanda After-School was designed alongside the local community members to ensure its sustainability and effectiveness.

 

The long term benefits of Thanda After-School are of most consequence. The students have the same teacher for a full school year, which allows the young staff members to identify with their kids on a personal and experiential level, putting them in a prime position to instil in these vulnerable children the skills and values they need to become self-reliant and responsible leaders in Africa.

 

 

The Impact

 

Thanda's agriculture program teaches practical skills to orphans and vulnerable children and the local community with the goal of creating fresh and sustainable local food supplies, decreasing malnutrition, and promoting self-reliance in the community .

Our courses combine classroom theory with functional training using Thanda's own vegetable garden.

We focus on new, exciting areas of agriculture, like permaculture and organic farming, while making sure participants are familiar with gardening basics, like which seasons are best to grow certain foods and when prime harvesting times take place.

 

We believe that a hands-on approach to agriculture is the best way to get students to acquire knowledge of this demanding vocation and share it with their families, friends, and fellow community members.

 

The children in the Agriculture program are given a nutritious meal each day (for some, this is the first meal for the day) and the children receive help with their school homework as well as lifeskills development.

 

Thanda After-School is successful because it is a prototype that works and is easily adaptable to any community and their needs.  Thanda After -School uses resources that are available and works with the community for the community.


What We Need & What You Get

 

The Agriculture Budget for January 2011 to December 2011

 

Supplies (seedlings, stationary, tools) : $100

Food (1 meal per day for 25 children) : $1400

Team building trip : $108

Full time Programme Agriculture teacher: $3772  (this includes developing lesson plans, teaching after-school, overseeing all High School Programmes, community development projects and training staff in 3 affiliate programmes with vegetable gardens).

 

If we do not reach our entire goal, we will use the contributions towards the program regardless. Every donation is appreciated.

 

For a donation of $50 or more, I will send you a beaded sunflower pin badge handmade by women in an income generation project in South Africa, a photo of the kids in the agriculture program and of course, a personally hand written Thank you card from Twin (Mbongeleni Doyisa) who is the agriculture teacher. You will also recieve updates on how the programme is progressing (if you would like).

Other Ways You Can Help

(Unleash the DIWO! -- 'Do It With Others' : folks please help to get the word out and make some noise about our campaign to raise funds for the Thanda After-School Agriculture Program. Don't forget to use the share tools!) Spread the work on Social Media!! Our blog has loads of updates from the ground..

Help this great cause!!

story:
Short Summary

We are the 'Bac Party Reunion Committee', a small group of people who passed their Baccalaureate at the European School of Luxembourg in 2005. We heard of previous years organising small, low-key reunions and wanted to go BIGGER with ours. Not only for our year, but for all the years (immediately) above and below ours too. It's important to us to regroup as MANY people as possible from school to make this milestone of our life one to remember. So, since all of us members of the 'Bac Party Reunion Committee' live and work in Luxembourg, we decided to use our connections and knowledge of the city to organise it. However, since the school isn't helping in any way, we need your support in order to ensure our ideal party.

What We Need & What You Get

What we need from you is to buy a ticket for the party BEFORE the party! Original, right? The way things work is that the more tickets we sell, the MORE you GET. We are not personally making ANY money at all on this. ALL the benefit will be re-invested directly into extra bits and bobs to make the party that much better. But once again, the earlier you get your ticket, the easier it will be for us to organise all these extra things. Which include (in this order):

  1. The whole of MARX bar booked for us from 4pm until midnight! For those who know the place, we're sure you'll be picturing yourself sipping a drink in their sunny garden during the afternoon and chatting to that-guy-you-sat-next-to-in-English-class about your five overweight cats, your newborn kid, your newly-built house, your dirty flatmate, your job successes or how many times you managed to get fired in 10 years. But if you live in Berlin and are used to start dancing at 4pm, that's OK too. There is an inside bar with DJs throughout the day and night. So go rave on until other regular people join you at a more respectable time to dance. YES we could ONLY get the place exclusively booked for us until midnight. BUT did we mention that the Bac Party ticket also allows you to stay in Marx after midnight to hear MARKUS KAVKA spin some decks? If you have NO idea who the guy is: remember when you were 16 and switched the TV channel to MTV Germany? Yeah, THAT's him.
  2. A freaking Photo Booth! You haven't seen each other in 10 years, what better way to gloat about who has aged best? Also, it doubles up as fairly good souvenir snaps.
  3. Free DRINKS! ALL the money that comes in excess will go into free beer, wine and soft drinks (MARX will already be doing special prices on drinks overall and a really special price on a summery beverage).
  4. FOOD will be available for purchase either way. Details to be released soon.

Do You Need To Be From BAC 2005 Too? 

NO. We encourage people from the years immediately above and below to join too. After all, we all had friends who were in those years. We trust you not to push it though. If you are STILL in school, you'll probably get told at the door to go do your physics homework. Significant others are also welcome but will be required to purchase a ticket too. Toddlers however get free entrance. 

 PS: Teachers, we all know you have now learned how to 'surf the web' and are reading this too. You are of course more than welcome to join the festivities.

What If We Don't Reach Our Minimum Budget?

You will be automatically refunded! Which means NO RISKS for you. In fact, the money is only charged once that goal has been reached. If we fall flat on our faces, we'll try to figure something out. BUT let's not reach that point and PUT THE WORD OUT. Since not all of us are all Facebook friends, it's important for us all to SHARE and spread the word.

LET'S MAKE THIS HAPPEN!

Much love, 
Your Bac Part Committee

story:
The Bloomsburg YMCA Youth Development Center is in need of another egress for its second floor in order to have the safest facility possible for its members. The senior level public relations class taught by Dr. Richard Ganahl at Bloomsburg University has partnered with the Bloomsburg YMCA in order to raise $1500 for its cause.

The Bloomsburg Youth Development center currently has 52 children who are members and needs the second floor exit to make it a safer environment. The Youth Development Center helps to educate and care for children ages 3-5 years old.  It  prepares them for success in kindergarten through activities that focus on cognitive and physical development.

story:
UPDATE: Year-one fundraising achieved!

Let's try and raise the $82,325 funding for year two. 

 

Dr. Peterson wanted to continue his work (1) analyzing and measuring personality scientifically, (2) examining the relationship between personality and political belief (liberal, conservative and, for the first time, politically correct) and (3) assessing the impact on productivity and quality of life of self-directed writing exercises (creating and evaluating the utility of high-school student versions of the programs at www.selfauthoring.com, which have helped thousands of university students get better grades and stay in school -- as outlined in this NPR article. 

Here are some examples of his research:

Between Facets and Domains: 10 Aspects of the Big Five.

Compassionate Liberals and Polite Conservatives: Associations of Agreeableness with Political Ideology and Moral Values.

A Scalable Goal-Setting Intervention Closes both the Gender and Ethnic Minority Achievement Gap.

Dr. Peterson obtains no direct financial benefit from the research grant. It's used to pay the salaries, tuition fees and travel costs of his four graduate students and to compensate research subjects. 

Here is a copy of the full funding application Prof. Peterson submitted to the government, that was nixed.

story:
Here's some info on what your $5 can make happen:


About Us

Traditional classrooms function by standardizing curricula and grouping students by “skill levels”—which more often than not have to do less with passion and hard work than they do itemized prerequisites.

My experience teaching writing—working within academic community as well as using the workshop structure in community outreach settings—has reinforced my understanding of the organic, interdisciplinary, and unpredictable nature of truly creative writing. Rockaway Writers’ Workshop will embrace a wide range of experience and goals, using diversity to enrich the group as a whole, furthering both personal and professional pursuits.

All paid workshops will be inclusive and tailored to the needs of each session’s participants. Once the Workshop has gained momentum, I will also offer donation-based programs geared toward using writing to address lifestyle issues.

The Workshop is located in Rockaway Park, NY, and will be partnering with local business and community organizations...once we get started.


I hope to establish the Workshop structure as a combination of:

§  regularly-scheduled six-week enrolled classes that meet throughout the year with brief breaks between programs;

§  drop-in sessions that meet weekly or bi-monthly;

§  intermittent focused, single-sessions master classes targeting tools of craft and/or more specific themes (e.g. writing inspired by texts of a single author;

§  exquisite corpse: a community outreach program offering single-session by-donation workshops that use writing to help participants to cope with personal, emotional, and practical issues.


If you are already planning on registering for a workshop, please don’t donate here… I'm passing this on in hopes that  you'll pass it on to help this group you've already supported with your participation.

Also, if you're a starving artist (or just really broke), use your $5 to buy a hamburger (or veggie burger, or gluten-free quinoa burger—whatever does it for you) and spend your enthusiasm on encouraging others to donate. Thanks!


For more information or to enroll in workshops, please visit us at rockawaywritersworkshop.org.

workshops that use writing to help participants to cope with personal,
emotional, and practical issues.
If you are already planning on
registering for a workshop, please don’t donate here… I'm passing this on in
hopes that  you'll pass it on to help this group you've already
supported with your participation.
Also, if you're a starving artist (or just really broke), use your $5 to buy a hamburger (or
veggie burger, or gluten-free quinoa burger—whatever does it for you) and spend your enthusiasm on encouraging others to donate. Thanks!For more information or to enroll in workshops, please visit us at rockawaywritersworkshop.org.

story:
Our Story

Hello my name is Zoe Bullard and I'm 12 years old. As far back as I can remember I've always loved dolphins, whales, and sea life. As growing up it never changed for me. I now know that I want to work with sea life when I grow up and become a marine biologist. That is why I want to attend Sea Trek. Sea Trek is a marine biology, diving, sailing summer camp/school. I wrote an essay on why I want to attend Sea Trek and they gave me a scholarship! The camp is located in the British Virgin Islands. I can earn up to 6 diving certifications, tag and monitor sea turtles, Island Excursions, watersports, go on explorations with real marine biologist, sailing training including hands-on navigation and piloting on a 45 foot Catamaran. Our science lab is also on a catamaran!

How awesome is that!  
                                                                                                                                                                                My departure is July 30 and return August 19, 2011 if I am able to raise the funds for this adventure.



The Impact    

By attending Sea Trek I will be able to see if this truly is what I desire. I can start to get my certifications and science credits for school. I now attend a music and dance school, but I will switch schools to a science and math High School. My mom supports my brother and I and can not afford to send me to Sea Trek on her own. That is why I am asking for your help to start my dream come true.

                                                                                                                    


What We Need & What You Get

Ok, here is what we financially need:

 *Camp cost:  $3,800                (that is the cost with the scholarship included)
 *Air fare:       $1,200                (unaccompanied minor)

  ** I received funds to cover these expenses from friends**
 *Scuba gear $100
 *Travel/medical insurance $350
 *Diving insurance $40

  If you would like hear about my journey when I return home send me your e-mail address at: swim_with_dolphins@att.net
 
                                           


Other Ways You Can Help...

While we greatly appreciate financial donations, one way to really boost the presence of this campaign is to repost our IndieGoGo page on your Facebook Page (and ask your friends to repost too) and/or email your group of friends and family with a link to our IndieGoGo Page.

story:
What is Rock The School Bells?

Rock The School Bells (RTSB) is a hip-hop educational youth conference based in the San Francisco Bay Area. It includes a comprehensive blend of workshops and performances that enhance students' ability to:
  • think critically about current issues in their communities as well as in the world
  • read and write about topics related to their life's experiences
  • display effective oral and written communication through readings, spoken word and poetry
  • understand the historical and cultural aspects of hip-hop and its effect on society, education and personal development

These workshops integrate the four key elements of hip-hop: b-boying (breakdancing), graffiti art, DJing (turntablism) and emceeing.

Some of RTSB's past workshops have covered topics such as:
  • Hip-Hop Entrepreneurship
  • DJ Fundamentals
  • Hip-Hop and Social Justice
  • B-Girl It's Your World
  • Weapons of Mass Promotions

Why fund Rock The School Bells?

With many arts, music, and sports programs being discontinued due to ongoing educational budget cuts, Rock The School Bells provides the youth and students a space where they can engage in hip-hop workshops that promote critical thinking, creativity, and social activism. It is also a venue where students can interact and network with hip-hop artists, scholars, community leaders, peers, mentors and a variety of local hip-hop educational programs.  As a result it builds a bridge between the classroom and the community.

Our aim is to empower and educate our youth about the importance of higher education, increase personal development through hip hop, and promote social change within their communities. We serve over 500 youth and students at our yearly event and reach out to thousands through our various social networks.

Support Arts and Culture Education.

RTSB is looking to raise $15,000 to support the production of both the conference and concert.  Items included in production costs will include:
  • Stipends for workshop facilitators and performers
  • Educational workbooks for students to use in conjunction with the workshops
  • Printed materials such as flyers, posters, concert programs, name badges
  • Assessment services such as surveys and application forms
  • Office supplies
  • Rental equipment

This annual conference, held every Spring, had recently been funded by innovation grants and sponsorships, and is now in need of funding sources to continue. The proceeds received from RTSB ticket sales and merchandise sales will go towards educational scholarships to both high school and college students pursuing degrees in art, music, film, dance and other creative arts and culture programs.
 
In the chance that our funding goal is not met, RTSB will run on a limited budget. Sponsorships are still being sought out, and contributors to our funding purpose will receive commemorative RTSB5 items listed in our incentives list.  With some of the incentives listed, your donation will be able to sponsor our youth and students to participate at the RTSB Conference for free.

For more information on some of the listed perks, check out:
www.goodwoodnyc.com
www.mandybobandy.com
www.leodocuyanan.com
www.beatrockmusic.com

With your help and support, we are seeking to transform this one-day event into an established hip hop educational program at our educational institution.
 

Each One, Teach One, Reach One

Rock The School Bells is a hip-hop conference born from the ideas of students who wanted to educate and empower the youth, students, and the community about the history and culture of hip-hop and how it was used as the "voice of the people" back in the 1970s.  We need your time, energy, resources, and talents in helping create an educational and empowering event for our youth and students. Below are three things you can do even if you are unable to donate:

  1. Like Us and Show Some Love On Facebook:  Stay up to date with developments regarding Rock The School Bells workshops, guest speakers, performers, and hip-hop educational videos and links.  Help us spread the word by "Liking" us on Facebook.  (http://www.facebook.com/rocktheschoolbells)
  2. Email 5 Friends:  Back to the basics!   We'd love to have you as an RTSB advocate.  If you can't donate, but feel like RTSB is a cause worth letting the world know about, please spread the word to all of your friends, families, advocates, youth service providers, educators, and hip-hop supporters.
  3. Donate Your Time:  We're always looking for individuals in the Bay Area to help us with event planning and promotions or volunteer your time during the day of the event.  We'd love to have you as a volunteer, where you can see first-hand the impact this conference has on our youth and students.   For more information please email us at: info@rocktheschoolbells.com.

story:
Buy One and We Will Donate One!

We Raised $10,000 in Our 1st Indiegogo Campaign! HUGE THANK YOU to all who participated in our success. We are encouraged and confident that we will be able to raise the additional $10,000 needed to reach our goal! BUY ONE AND WE WILL DONATE ONE to all public high schools, libraries and community colleges throughout Berkeley, Oakland, Marin & San Francisco.

Why This Book? Why Now?

The book's purpose is to educate today’s LGBTQ youth on their female heroes. Game Changers pays tribute to lesbians who came out early in their lives and whose tremendous cultural and legal accomplishments helped define the current LGBTQ culture in the USA. The featured women made specific long-term contributions towards raising LGBTQ awareness, eliminating discrimination and changing laws. Whatever freedom today's young LGBTQ members enjoy is based on these women's courage, hard work and sacrifices. I think its safe to assume that when The FAIR Act is implemented there will be a poster of Harvey Milk in most California classrooms. With all due respect to history, while Milk helped make real changes to the civil rights laws, there are also trailblazing women who need to be celebrated! Together, we can make this happen.

The Impact of This Book:

This book will not only educate about the influence lesbians had on LGBTQ culture, but it is intended to INSPIRE young people to stand up for what they believe in.

An excerpt from the introduction: “Every single woman featured here changed the world in some way. Each worked hard and believed in herself, never backing down from a prevailing culture filled with discrimination and bigotry. They all stepped up, followed their hearts and ultimately helped pave the way for acceptance of the LGBTQ youth of today.

These women are American heroes and they are a part of all our histories. Whether you are gay, bisexual, straight, trans, gender non-conforming or anything in between, I hope you will find inspiration in these pages. You can stand up for what you believe in and make a difference, too!”

What Exactly is Game Changers?

Created as a richly-designed interactive package, this large format book will dedicate six pages to each woman and feature pull-out Game Cards for each of them highlighting ‘fun facts’. This deck of cards is a playful way to encourage people to learn about the featured women. Additionally there will be Resource Guide section as well as photos and bios of ‘Other Notable Lesbians’. 

Who is the Author?​

My name is  Robin Lowey, and I’m the Founder, Publisher, Curator and Editor-in-Chief of the popular online magazine Epochalips: Smart Lesbian Commentary.  Since 2010, I’ve published close to 1,000 articles, interviews and op-ed pieces, each from a variety of well-known LGBTQ contributors and guest writers.  I’m also an established Creative Director with over 20 years experience in writing, publication design and printing. I’m a proud, pioneering lesbian mom of two adult sons. As a member of the LGBT Speakers Bureau (an organization that goes into local high schools to help debunk stereotypes about LGBTQ people) I know this book is urgently needed!  

Thank you for your interest and support of this important project! Even if you can’t donate, please share with those in your network who can! Use the Indiegogo sharing tools, send personal emails, and please share on all your social media channels.

story:
We are Brian and Jeannette. We are dancers with a background in latin dances and funk-styles hip-hop. Individually, we have been dancing since childhood for talent shows, plays, and high school functions, but it wasn't until we became dance partners in San Diego circa 2005 that we learned we can inspire others through our passion. Our love for dance has taken us to many different countries, including Puerto Vallarta, Mexico where we resided as restaurant owners by day, and dance instructors by night. Now back in the Bay Area where we both grew up, we are honored to be dancers with the DS Players, a funk-styles hip hop family with the same passion for dance. Throughout our travels, we have been reaching out to the youth to share and empower children with creative arts, such as dance. We have taught workshops at foster care centers, schools, and have been involved with a non-profit organization called Soulciety, who has a mission statement to enrich and empower at-risk and underprivileged youth. This year, we were given the opportunity to travel to the Philippines with Soulciety and their Bridge Program on their next trip in 2014.  Along with co-ordinating school supply and personal hygiene donation drives to take to villages in the Philippines, we will be teaching dance workshops throughout our stay.

The Bridge Program

     The Bridge is an overseas educational mission and cultural immersion program that gives youth and young adults from the Bay Area and other parts of the U.S. an opportunity to provide resources and education to impoverished youth in different parts of the world. The program focuses on providing services and aid to the youth in the Philippines as they are in dire need of support.

     Issues in the Philippines include:

  • The Philippines is an international hotspot for human trafficking, ranking among the top five countries in the world where most human trafficking victims come from. An estimated 100,000 children are trafficked in the Philippines, most of which are forced to become sex slaves in China, Japan, Europe, the Middle East, and the U.S.
  • 40% of the Philippines' population (27.6 million people) lives under the poverty line. 1.4 million are street children.
  • 11% of children (2.2 million in 2001) are forced into labor.
  • 6 million children are malnourished

 

Our Goal

    With this program, our goal is to reach 8000 youth throughout the provinces of the Philippines by providing support and supplies to further their education and improve their health.

     Other program objectives include:

  • Providing 100 computers in order to build a minimum of 3 Computer Learning centers at schools and develop a computer literacy curriculum that will be taught to teachers to help youth reach their educational goals and prepare them for the work force
  • Promote Performing Arts education through music, dance, and poetry
  • Providing another 1000 pairs of shoes and promote proper footwear awareness
  • Provide another 5000 hygiene supplies such as toothbrushes, toothpaste, floss, shampoo, and soap and promote proper hygiene awareness
  • Provide another 5000 school materials such as backpacks, binders, and writing utensils to promote educational advancement

 

What exactly does the money go to?

     Our main purpose for being involved is to help with the services and education that is being provided by the program. There will be about a total of 12-16 of us that will be travelling to the Philippines to educate and provide for the impoverish communities. Each individual is responsible for fundraising $3000 which will cover:

  • Flight: $1200
  • Lodging: $700
  • Transportation: $100
  • Food: $300
  • Daily Expenses: $400
  • Special Projects: $300

     In case our $3000 goal each is not reached ($6000 together), we will not be able to travel to the Philippines to take part in the 2014 Bridge Program, but all funds raised will go towards coordinating the program.

 

The Bridge Program Over the Years

     Since 2009, The Bridge Program has reached over 20,000 youth in provinces throughout the Philippines including Batangas, Pampanga, Iloilo, Cebu, Boracay, Mindoro, Negros, and Behol. Soulciety has donated the following equipment and supplies directly to schools: 110 fully-functioning Pentium III+ computers, 8000 school materials, 13,000 hygiene supplies, 14,000 books, 1500 pairs of shoes, and boxes of medicine, clothes, sports equipment, and other materials.

 

Other Ways You Can Get Involved

Adopt-A-Computer Lab

     Soulciety will be donating another 100 computers to schools in the Philippines and will be teaching the teachers about the computer literacy so that they can, in turn, teach their students. You and/or your organization can adopt this project by raising or donating $5,000 to build a computer lab at a participating school. An existing classroom will be renovated and these renovations include:

  • tiling the floors
  • installing secure windows and doors
  • installing an air-conditioning system
  • re-wiring electricity and installing lights
  • installing internet access for atleast 3 years
  • building computer tables and benches for the students
  • hiring a project manager to manage the project

You will be recognized as an Official Sponsor and a plaque will be placed at the computer lab that you sponsor in honor of your support.

Donate Supplies

You and/or your organization can coordinate a donation drive at your school campus or facility to collect one of the following supplies:

  • School materials (binders, paper, backpacks, pencils, etc)
  • hygiene supplies (soap, shampoo, toothbrushes, toothpaste, floss)
  • Medicine & Supplies (aspirin, gauges, crutches, first aid)

These supplies will be donated directly to the children and schools in the provinces in the Philippines. Supplies must be submitted by July 31, 2013.

http://www.soulciety.org
