School materials (binders, paper, backpacks, pencils, etc)
hygiene supplies (soap, shampoo, toothbrushes, toothpaste, floss)
Medicine & Supplies (aspirin, gauges, crutches, first aid)

These supplies will be donated directly to the children and schools in the provinces in the Philippines. Supplies must be submitted by July 31, 2013.http://www.soulciety.org

story:
Para leer la describción en español, haga un click aqui.

Short Summary

CENIT, El Centro de la Niña Trabajadora, or the Center for the Working Girl, as it is known in English, is a non-governmental, non-profit organization devoted to helping working children (especially girls) and their families overcome grinding poverty and improve their quality of lives through education and job training, nutrition programs, health and social services, psychological help and recreation.

Why are we asking for money now?

CENIT's work against poverty is in serious peril. In most countries, basic infrastructure, such as fire hydrants and pressurized water, are government-provided. Here in Ecuador, it is the opposite. CENIT must install a cistern, a high-powered pump and an access point for firefighting equipment. Rather than help to provide these things, the government is simply threatening to close CENIT if we cannot comply with their requirements by March 19. 

 

What We Need

Your donation will keep CENIT alive as you help to accomplish the following request by the government:

Enable firefighters to extinguish in case of fire: CENIT must repair its water cistern in order to provide sufficient water pressure for firefighters. 

- This alone costs $5,000.

Hire architects to work out a precise plan of CENIT’s building complex.

- This will take about $4,000.

Set up fire extinguishers: CENIT has to establish fire extinguishers on each floor of every building. With three school buildings with five floors, this adds up to 15 extingushers, plus three in CENIT's external areas, for a total of 18.   

- To install the extinguishers will require approximately $1,000.

 

CENIT relies on your help and does not have the means to meet these requirements with its current funds!

What You Get

  1. You keep CENIT alive and give educational opportunities to people in Quito.
  2. CENIT implements workshops in order to train students and families for future jobs as well as to increase its degree of self-sufficiency. As a gift, you can receive handcrafts produced by CENIT's students and families.

 

The Impact

With your contribution you will help to maintain all the programs shown in the video and many more that are implemented by a staff of 35 Ecuadorian workers and about 35 national (Ecuadorian) and international volunteers:

  • Primary and High School including Psychological Help and Health Services
    • 116 students receive education at CENIT as well as job training
  • Street Outreach programs for working children at two markets
    • 150 children in CENIT’s Street Outreach Program (Rescate de Calle)
  • Tutoring Center
    • 85 students attend CENIT’s Tutoring Center (CEA)
  • Clinic and the Street Clinic
    • 45 market sellers visited weekly during CENIT’s Street Clinic, as well as hepatitis vaccinations and free dental treatment by our dentist volunteer to all of CENIT’s students in need as well as CEA participants.
  • Family Support by our social workers
    • Family Support and Training is bi-monthly, provided to 424 families.

More: Low-cost, high-nutrition lunch for kids from the tutoring center and for students; soccer club for the schools; card-making workshop; the creative support project; student sponsoring and much more.  

 

All our programs are dedicated to people living in poverty in Quito who desperately need CENIT's support. 

Other Ways You Can Help

So you’re broke but you think we’re awesome?  Share our campaign with your friends on Facebook and read more about us and our other projects on our website:

http://www.cenitecuador.org/

https://www.facebook.com/pages/CENIT-Centro-de-la-Ni%C3%B1a-Trabajadora/161222197276957?ref=ts&fref=ts

And come volunteer with us!  Have a special skill? Great! Don´t have any? No problem!  The more volunteers we have, the more love and affection we can show these children.  One person is more value than the whole world!

story:
>>>for the english version, please scroll down>>>

Aufgrund massiver Probleme mit PayPal, hier das direkte Spendenkonto des gemeinnützigen Vereins: Positive Nett-Works e.V / Volksbank Hannover / BLZ: 251 900 01 / Kto: 329 628 800 / Betr.: "Multiversity + den Namen" (Bitte für Spendenquittungen auch Ihre mail-Adresse im Betreff vermerken) Vielen Dank.

Kurzdarstellung

In der autonomen Mikronation Sealand, einer besetzten Seefestung vor der englischen Küste ( www.sealandgov.org ), haben wir einen MakerSpace für globalen Wandel gegründet.

Die „Sealand Multiversity of the seven seas“ vereinigt Aktivisten, Wissenschaftler und Changemaker aller Bereiche, um gemeinsam Open-Source-Lösungen für unseren bedrohten Planeten zu entwickeln.

Wir sind eine wachsene cokreative Gruppe, die nicht darauf warten möchte, dass die Politik oder Konzerne die Welt retten. Humanistische Erfindungen und ihre Implementierung in großem Stil kann auch von der wachsenden „Open-Society“ durch Open-Source Lösungen und koordinierte Grassroots-Aktionen erreicht werden.

Die Sealand Multiversity besteht aus zwei Bereichen:

  • Offshore-Campus: Der Offshore-Campus auf Sealand dient als Medien-Symbol für eine nachhaltige, faire Gesellschaft sowie als Testplattform für konkrete nachhaltige Anwendungen und Innovationen.
  • Online-Campus: Hier sammeln, präsentieren und verbreiten wir geprüfte Beispielprojekte und implementieren sie weltweit durch kostenlose, internetgestützte „Do-it-yourself (DIY)workshops“. Darüberhinaus bieten wir virtuelle Vorlesungen, Konferenzen und Mitmachaktionen für persönlichen und gesellschaftlichen Wandel an. Bitte schauen Sie sich das detaillierte Campus-Konzept an (www.artlab4.de/multiversity) oder lassen Sie sich inspirieren von unserem langfristigen Projekt „asap-island“, bei dem wir aus Recyclingmaterialien schwimmende Rettungsinseln für Überschwemmungsgebiete bauen. http://www.asap-island.org 

Hört sich zu gut an, um wahr zu sein? Probieren wir´s einfach aus. Vielleicht sind wir genau diejenigen, auf die wir immer gewartet haben?

Was wir brauchen und wofür

Die konvertierte Militärplattform aus dem 2. Weltkrieg dient als einzigartiges Symbol für globalen Wandel. Unsere wachsende Gemeinschaft teilnehmender Netzwerke, kreativer Menschen aller Bereiche und ganz normale Leute auf der ganzen Welt ist bereit, die Zukunft in die eigenen Hände zu nehmen. Bitte helfen Sie, die Sealand Multiversity als außergewöhnlichen und interaktiven gemeinsamen Ort für konkrete nachhaltige Cokreationen zu starten.

Wir benötigen 6000,- € für einen Multiversity Kickoff-Trailer, die Online-Auftaktveranstaltung und eine virale, weltweite Kampagne. Bei Erreichen des Betrags wird dieser vorauss. von Google-Deutschland im Rahmen der „GründerGarage“ verdoppelt, er ermöglicht uns:

  • Die Produktion eines Multiversity-Trailers (weit bessere Qualität, als der obige Clip)
  • Den Start der interaktiven Online-Plattform
  • Die Realisierung verschiedener Vorab-Veranstaltungen, wie bspw. eine Online-Konferenz (3.10.), die Presentation beim Social Capital World Forum (1.12.), das Onlinefestival "Change(is)Happening" (22.9. - 21.12.)
  • Eine virale Kampagne, um Mitspieler/innen einzuladen, Sponsoren zu finden und Multiplikatoren zu begeistern.

Sie sind herzlichst eingeladen, den Start der Sealand Multiversity mit zu gestalten – durch Ihre Spende, indem Sie Freunden und Bekannten davon erzählen oder durch Ihre direkte Beteiligung an den Veranstatungen des Online-Campus.

Mit Ihrer Unterstützung nehmen Sie automatisch teil an diesem realen Mitmach-Abenteuer. Und wir haben auch einige „Dankeschöns“ für unsere Unterstützer, die Ihnen vielleicht gefallen (siehe unten)...

Die Wirkung

Es gibt mehr als genug Wissen, Kreativität, Empathie und Engagement auf der Welt, um der kritischen Situation unseres Planeten aktiv zu begegnen. Und die rasant wachsende open-source community ist als Global Player neu im Spiel dabei. Mal sehen, wie weit uns Schwarmintelligenz, CoCreation-Management und koordinierte Aktionen bringen können. Jedoch nicht aus Profitinteresse, sondern aus der einfachen Motivation heraus, unseren schönen Planeten fair und nachhaltig zu teilen und zu schützen.

  • Mit Ihrer Unterstützung werden wir astrten, das ungeheure kreative Potential der "open community" zu versammeln, um gezielt konkrete freie Problemlösungen zu entwickeln. Wir unterstützen machbare Beispielprojekte oder realisieren diese gemeinsam mit dezentralen Partnern in geeigneten Umgebungen und verbreiten das entstehende Wissen weitestmöglich.
  • Der initiierende gemeinnützige Verein Positive Nett-Works e.V. arbeitet seit mehr als 15 Jahren an derlei Projekten und könnte Bücher mit seinen Aktionen für direkten humanitären Nutzen füllen. (www.p-n-w.net)
  • Wir haben die beabsichtigten Formate “glokale DIY+CC-workshops”, “Lösungsorientierte cokreative Synergiesysteme” und “Virtuelle Mitmach-Happenings” bereits erfolgreich getestet und können es kaum abwarten, diese Werkzeuge für gesellschaftlichen Wandel nun in großem Stil einzusetzen.

Andere Wege, zu helfen

Sie haben keinen PayPal-Account? Schreiben Sie uns, wir helfen Ihnen, uns zu helfen :-) Kein Geld zu investieren? Kein Problem – es geht hier auch um „Soziales Kapital“: Natürlich brauchen wir Geldmittel, um die Sealand Multiversity zu realisieren. Ebenso wichtig ist aber z.B. auch, dass sich dieses Vorhaben weltweit herumspricht. Sie können gerne auch positive Inhalte beisteuern, sich an der cokreativen Entwicklung von Problemlösungen beteiligen und letztendlich die vielen guten Ideen direkt in Ihr spezifisches Wirkungsumfeld implementieren.

Bitte nutzen Sie die Indiegogo share tools, um die Idee der Sealand Multiversity zu verbreiten oder jedwelches Kommunikationsmedium, das Sie bevorzugen.

website: www.sealand-multiversity.org

fb-site: http://www.facebook.com/multiversity

fb-group: http://www.facebook.com/groups/362572537101892/

 

 

>>>ENGLISH VERSION>>>

We´ve got serious problems with PayPal, please fund directly onto the account of the organisation. Name: Positive Nett-Works e.V / Account-Nr.: 329 628 800 / bank: Volksbank Hannover / BLZ: 251 900 01 Bank-ID: DE115648359  / Text: "Multiversity + your name" (please also your mail-adress for us to get in contact with you) Sorry for inconvenience and thank you very much.

Short Summary

At the autonomous Micronation Sealand, an occupied sea fortress in the northern sea ( www.sealandgov.org ), we founded a global MakerSpace for positive change. The "Sealand Multiversity of the seven seas" bands together activists, scientists and changemakers of all kinds to cocreate open-source solutions for our endangered planet.

We are a growing cocreative crowd that doesn´t want to wait for politics or the big business to save the world. Humanistic inventions and the implementation in big scale can also be achieved by the emerging open society through open-source cocreation and joint grassroots action.

At the Sealand Multiversity, we create two Campuses:

  • Offshore Campus: The OffshoreCampus at Sealand serves as our symbol for a caring/sharing community. Further, it is a testground for concrete sustainable applications and innovations. 

  • Online Campus: Here, we collect, present and spread best practice projects. We implement them worldwide through free global online "Do-it-yourself (DIY)-workshops". We as well host virtual lectures, conferences and happenings on personal and global change. Please visit www.artlab4.de/multiversity for the detailed campus concept or get some inspiration by our long-term project "asap-island", where we build floating islands out of waste materials in flood affected aereas. http://www.asap-island.org )

Sounds too good to be true? Let´s give it a try. Maybe we´re just the ones, we were waiting for?

What We Need & What You Get

The converted military platform serves as a unique symbol for global change. The growing community of participating networks, cultural creatives of all fields and regular people all over the world are ready to re-occupy the future. Please help us to set up the Sealand Multiversity as a funky, hands-on MakerSpace for positive peoples cocreation.

We need 6000,- € for the Multiversity´s kickoff trailer, event and campaign. The amount (might be doubled by Google-Germany within this competition and) includes:

  • production of a Multiversity trailer (far better than the shown clip)
  • setup of an interactive online platform
  • pre-opening events as online-conference (3.10.), presentation at Social Capital World Forum (1.12.), Onlinefestival "Change(is)Happening" (from 22.9. - 21.12.)
  • a viral campaign to invite cocreators, find sponsors and attract multiplicators.

You are mostly welcome to join by crowdfunding the Sealand Multiversity kickoff, by spreading the word or directly interacting at the Multiversity´s OnlineCampus.

With your support, you immediately take part on this real-world adventure. And we also have some "perks" for the crowdfunders, that you might enjoy (see below). 

The Impact

There is far enough knowledge, creativity, empathy and goodwill to face the critical situation of mankind on earth. The emerging open-source community is the new player on the game. Let´s see how far swarm intelligence, cocreation management and joint actions can go. Not for profits or power, but for the noble cause of caring and sharing our beautiful planet in a fair, sustainable way.

  • With your help, we´ll assemble the enormous creative potential of the "open community" for targeted cocreation of concrete open solutions, we´ll support or realize them with decentral partners on suitable locations and will spread the knowledge widely.
  • The initiating NGO "Positive Nett-Works" is working on such projects for more than 15 years and could fill books with our achievements in direct benefit actions for humanity. (www.p-n-w.net)
  • We´ve already tested the envisioned formats like "glocal DIY+CC workshops", "synergy cocreation developement" or "crowdsourced online happenings" and are looking forward to see these tools work in big scale for positive change.

Other Ways You Can Help

No PayPal-account? Get in contact, we´ll help you to help us :-) No money to help, no problem - It´s mostly about Social Capital: Money of course is needed to realize Sealand Multiversity. It is just in much important to spread the word. Or you can contribute positive content, interact in developing solutions and finally implement the many good ideas directly within your specific environment.

To easily share the idea of Sealand Multiversity, please use the Indiegogo share tools and whichever communication channel you´re used to.

website: www.sealand-multiversity.org

fb-site: http://www.facebook.com/multiversity

fb-group: http://www.facebook.com/groups/362572537101892/

The initiating NGO "Positive Nett-Works" is working on such projects for more than 15 years and could fill books with our achievements in direct benefit actions for humanity. (www.p-n-w.net)
We´ve already tested the envisioned formats like "glocal DIY+CC workshops", "synergy cocreation developement" or "crowdsourced online happenings" and are looking forward to see these tools work in big scale for positive change.



Other Ways You Can Help
No PayPal-account? Get in contact, we´ll help you to help us :-) No money to help, no problem - It´s mostly about Social Capital: Money of course is needed to realize Sealand Multiversity. It is just in much important to spread the word. Or you can contribute positive content, interact in developing solutions and finally implement the many good ideas directly within your specific environment.
To easily share the idea of Sealand Multiversity, please use the Indiegogo share tools and whichever communication channel you´re used to.
website: www.sealand-multiversity.org
fb-site: http://www.facebook.com/multiversity
fb-group: http://www.facebook.com/groups/362572537101892/

story:
Joy's Hope Summer Academy

Joy’s Hope is a summer school program for children in the Wichita, Kansas.

The founder's mother, Joy, died from COPD in 2010. She wanted to honor her  mother in a way that would show how loving and caring she was. That summer many things were cut from the local school district due to budget cuts from the state – one of these things was summer school. That same summer, she had a student who no longer qualified for special education services – even though he still desperately needed the services. All of these things hit her at the same time. She decided to open a free tutoring service for students like hers that still needed the help but had no means to pay for it. That was the beginning of Joy’s Hope.

Her first student that summer was that former student, of course. Soon the word spread. Before long, she had twenty students from kindergarten to sixth grade – and two who were teen moms that needed help preparing for their GED’s. It was more than she had expected.

Although Joy’s Hope Tutoring receives some donations from those parents who can afford it, most of the money to run it comes from the founder's own pocket. The money for books and supplies and office rent and utilities adds up very fast. It is getting to the point that she will have to shut it down because she cannot afford to keep it running. It would break her heart for this to happen. There are too many students who need this service…

What We Need & What You Get

 We need $1500 to fund Summer Academy for summer 2013. For $1500, we can provide all necessary supplies for all students. Since these children have special needs, their parents often have many expenditures that are above and beyond the normal costs of raising a child. If we can provide this service and the needed supplies, that is one less worry for the parents.

The Impact

This program will help up to a dozen children with special needs. This will provide these children with the step up they need to be successful during the regular school year. This program will also prevent the loss of learning some children experience when they don't attend school during the summer.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can’t contribute, but that doesn’t mean they can’t help:

  • Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about your campaign.
  • Remind them to use the Indiegogo share tools!

And that’s all there is to it.

story:
My name is Lynn Marie Dwyer, and I am a clay artist who has worked with this medium for over 18 years teaching children, adults and adults and children with special needs.  

I have come to cherish my work with the handicapped and disabled population, and find there is an incredible lack of funding for these folks, as well as pulled art education from our state's public education system for the kids!  Since art impacted my life in such a big way, and after seeing how much joy people get for the simple act of creating, I want to continue to offer these services to Centers for the disabled, Organizations set up to provide services to handicapped and underprivledged Children, as well as children in the foster care and mental health systems.

My goal is to attach a wonderful, creative art filled trailer on the back of my colorful More Than Mudpies vehicle, and have a traveling art classroom, where I can reach organizations I have connections with in North Carolina, Tennessee, Georgia and Florida.  I have begun this process in Georgia, however my overall vision is to have more artists be able to jump on board and expand the More Than Mudpies mobile classrooms with student intern helpers on board as well.  These interns can come from Centers, as well as art schools, providing them hands on experience to work with these populations. 

The funding I need initially will help me purchase a trailer,  renovated for an art room experience, purchase art materials, and do the necessary printed marketing to reach the people, let more organizations know of the traveling fine art instruction now available for their populations of consumers. 

If I don't reach my goal, the money donated will go into a fund to fund the work I am currently doing in North Georgia/Atlanta area for the kids and handicapped, which I currently do not charge for.  It will buy materials, pay for marketing, transportation services and time. 

Your contribution will help put smiles on so many innocent faces, provide rewarding work for art students as well as other artists willing and longing to to work with these populations.  The self-esteem gained from their creations is touching and IMPORTANT!  They learn strategic building skills, problem solving, and more (read http://morethanmudpies.com/workshops-clay-classes/children-and-clay )

There are no grants, and I look weekly for money for the arts for my program.  I have learned, I need the people out there to hear this, feel something for it, and help make it happen. I am determined and driven to make this happen, and make it a SUCCESS! 

If you can't contribute money, then art supplies or uplifting fun materials that can be distributed to these populations would be great also.  ANYTHING you could do to help will be recognized. 

I ask that you SHARE my campaign, and help me reach the world with my idea.  I have the business background to make this work, and the passion to set the trail on fire with creative energy. (my resume : www.linkedin.com/pub/lynn-dwyer/56/115/63/ )

All contributors will receive a happy clay token made by one of the students, and will be mentioned in all my marketing websites and social media platforms and will receive a letter of thanks acknowledging the help from me, and the students.

http://morethanmudpies.com and http://facebook.com/IrishSculptress 

THANK YOU FOR ANY AND ALL HELP!!! These folks need you!

story:
Will Potter is an award-winning independent journalist based in Washington, D.C. and author of Green Is the New Red: An Insider’s Account of a Social Movement Under Siege.  Potter’s presentation focuses on how fear of “terrorism” is being exploited to push a political and corporate agenda, and how animal rights and environmental advocates are being branded “eco-terrorists” in what many are calling the Green Scare.

 

Top of the Terrorism List

“The No. 1 domestic terrorism threat,” says John Lewis, a top FBI official, “is the eco-terrorism, animal-rights movement.”

The animal rights and environmental movements, like every other social movement throughout history, have both legal and illegal elements. There are people who leaflet, write letters, and lobby. There are people who protest and engage in non-violent civil disobedience. And there are people, like the Animal Liberation Front and Earth Liberation Front, who go out at night with black masks and break windows, burn SUVs, and release animals from fur farms.

Animal rights and environmental advocates have not flown planes into buildings, taken hostages, or sent Anthrax through the mail. They have never even injured anyone. In fact, the only act of attempted murder in the history of the U.S. animal rights movement was coordinated by corporate provocateurs. Yet the FBI ranks these activists as the top domestic terrorism threat. And the Department of Homeland Security lists them on its roster of national security threats, while ignoring right-wing extremists who have bombed the Oklahoma City federal building, murdered doctors, and admittedly created weapons of mass destruction.

Defining the Green Scare

This disproportionate, heavy-handed government crackdown on the animal rights and environmental movements, and the reckless use of the word “terrorism,” is often called the Green Scare.

Much like the Red Scare and the communist witch hunts of the 40s and 50s, the Green Scare is using one word—this time, it’s “terrorist”—to push a political agenda, instill fear, and chill dissent. And much like the Red Scare, the Green Scare is operating on three levels: legal, legislative, and what we’ll call extra-legal, or scare-mongering.

Legal

The courts are being used to push conventional boundaries of what constitutes “terrorism” and to hit non-violent activists with disproportionate sentences.

SHAC 7 - A federal court convicted a group of animal advocates of “animal enterprise terrorism” for running a controversial website that supported both legal and illegal activity against a lab called Huntingdon Life Sciences. The site also listed addresses for corporations and corporate executives. The group, dubbed the SHAC 7, were never charged with breaking windows or releasing animals, but they vocally supported those types of activities. For that, they were convicted of “conspiring” to promote “terrorism.” Here’s a closer look at the SHAC 7.

Operation Backfire - That’s the name the FBI gave to the historic roundup of environmental and animal rights activists for a string of Earth Liberation Front and Animal Liberation Front actions, including arson in the name of protecting the environment. Before these defendants ever set foot in the courtroom, they were labeled in the press as “eco-terrorists.” The government successfully pushed for “terrorism enhancement” penalties in many of these cases. As a result, many of these activists are now in prison as “terrorists,” a label that drastically changes their prison life and will follow them long after release. Another result of the “terrorism enhancement” is that the FBI claims these cases as a victory in the “War on Terrorism.”

Government Informants and Infiltrators - Although some of the Operation Backfire defendants—Daniel McGowan, Jonathan Paul, Joyanna Zacher and Nathan Block—refused to become government informants, the others “snitched” in exchange for reduced sentences. In fact, the government has said these arrests wouldn’t have been possible if one of the defendants, Jacob Ferguson, hadn’t agreed to wear a wire and entrap his friends. We’ve seen the same thing take place in other “eco-terrorism” cases. And in the case of Eric McDavid, who was sentenced to 20 years in prison for conspiring to destroy cell phone towers and other property, the FBI actually paid a young woman, “Anna,” to pose as an activist: she provided the group with bomb-making recipes; at times financed their transportation, food and housing; strung along McDavid, who had the hopes of a romantic relationship; and poked and prodded the group into action.

Grand juries - In the name of investigating illegal activity, the government has been hauling lawful activists in front of grand juries where they must testify about their political beliefs and political associations, or face prison time. Activists like Jeff Hogg and independent journalist Josh Wolf have refused to cooperate with these witch hunts, and been punished for it. Elsewhere, noncooperation has derailed grand juries.

Legislative

Even with these sweeping, and successful, legal attacks on activists, corporations and the politicians who represent them want even more power.

Animal Enterprise Terrorism Act - With just six members of Congress in the room, just hours after lawmakers and celebrities were on hand to break ground for the new memorial honoring that terrorist Martin Luther King Jr., the House of Representatives passed the Animal Enterprise Terrorism Act, a law so vague and broad that the non-violent tactics of MLK and Gandhi are now “terrorism.” The bill expanded the Animal Enterprise Protection Act, the law used to convict the SHAC 7 of “animal enterprise terrorism” just months earlier. In true Orwellian doublespeak, proponents said the law couldn’t be used to convict so-called extremists, and must be expanded. Here is a closer look at the Animal Enterprise Terrorism Act.

State-level Legislation - Even after the federal law passed, corporations still want more. There’s been a push for state “eco-terrorism” legislation similar to the federal AETA, including the the California Animal Enterprise Protection Act.

Extra-Legal

Perhaps the most dangerous wing of this Green Scare is the relentless scare-mongering.

Ad Campaigns - The new McCarthyists have used their deep pocketbooks and PR savvy to place a terrorist in every shadow. They’ve taken out full-page anonymous ads in both The New York Times and The Washington Post labeling animal rights activists as “terrorists” for being a little too successful, and knocking a controversial animal testing laboratory from the New York Stock Exchange.

Public Relations Campaigns - Not even children’s movies are safe from the relentless green baiting and guilt by association. Industry groups labeled Hoot, a bestselling book and popular movie, “soft-core eco-terrorism” because the teenage protagonists try to save an endangered owl from developers. Apparently even E.B. White was an “eco-terrorist”: According to the Center for Consumer Freedom, the movie remake of Charlotte’s Web promotes animal rights extremism.

Surveillance, Harassment and Infiltration - The corporate and government scare-mongering has been used to create a political climate that justifies surveillance and harassment of political advocates. For instance, the FBI is looking for informants to infiltrate vegan potlucks, Joint Terrorism Task Forces are spying on HoneyBaked Ham protestors, and corporations are tracking who activists are dating.

Secretive Political Prisons — Communications Management Units

The label of “terrorist” is applied to activists before they even enter a courtroom and, for those convicted, it follows them into the prison system. The government has acknowledged using secretive prison facilities on U.S. soil, called Communications Management Units, to house inmates labeled “domestic terrorists.”

The CMUs radically restrict prisoner communications with the outside world to levels that rival, or exceed, the most restrictive facilities in the country, including the “Supermax,” ADX-Florence. [For more information on CMUs and who is housed there: "Secretive U.S. Prison Units Used to House Muslim, Animal Rights and Environmental Activists."]

Inmates and guards at the CMUs call them “Little Guantanamo.” They have also been described as prisons for “second-tier” terrorists.

According the Bureau of Prisons, these inmates “do not rise to the same degree of potential risk to national security” as other terrorism inmates. So who is imprisoned there?

The CMUs overwhelmingly include Muslim inmates, and have housed at least two animal rights and environmental activists: Andy Stepanian, who has been released, and Daniel McGowan, who is currently imprisoned at the CMU in Marion, Illinois.

Little information is available about the secretive facilities and the prisoners housed there. However, through interviews with attorneys, family members, and a current prisoner, it is clear that these units have been created not for violent and dangerous “terrorists,” but for political cases that the government would like to keep out of the public spotlight and out of the press.

So Why is This Happening?

The government and corporations haven’t tried to hide the fact that this is all meant to protect corporate profits. The Department of Homeland Security, in a bulletin to law enforcement agencies, warned: “Attacks against corporations by animal rights extremists and eco-terrorists are costly to the targeted company and, over time, can undermine confidence in the economy.”

And in a leaked PowerPoint presentation given by the State Department to corporations, we learn: “Although incidents related to terrorism are most likely to make the front-page news, animal rights extremism is what’s most likely to affect your day-to-day business operations.”

Underground activists like the Animal Liberation Front and Earth Liberation Front directly threaten corporate profits by doing things like burning bulldozers or sabotaging animal research equipment. But they’re not the only ones.

The entire animal rights and environmental movements, perhaps more than any other social movements, directly threaten corporate profits. They do it every day. Every time activists encourage people to go vegan, every time they encourage people to stop driving, every time they encourage people to consume fewer resources and live simply. Those boycotts are permanent, and these industries know it. In many ways, the Green Scare, like the Red Scare, can be seen as a culture war, a war of values.

What Effect Has This Had?

The point of all this, according to the government, is to crack down on underground activists. But underground activists already know what they’re doing is illegal, and it hasn’t stopped them. In fact, it may have added fuel to the fire. For instance, the same day the SHAC 7 were convicted of “animal enterprise terrorism” for running a website that posted news of both legal and illegal actions, underground activists rescued animals from a vivisection lab and named them Jake, Lauren, Kevin, Andy, Josh, and Darius, after the defendants.

This is from the communiqué:

“And while the SHAC-7 will soon go to jail for simply speaking out on behalf of animals, those of us who have done all the nasty stuff talked about in the courts and in the media will still be free. So to those who still work with HLS and to all who abuse animals: we’re coming for you, motherfuckers.”

What Now?

So if outlandish prison sentences and “eco-terrorism” rhetoric aren’t deterring crimes or solving crimes, what’s the point?

Fear. It’s all about fear. The point is to protect corporate profits by instilling fear in the mainstream animal rights and environmental movements—and every other social movement paying attention—and make people think twice about using their First Amendment rights.

Industry groups say “this is just the starting gun” for the Green Scare. But this could be the starting gun for activists as well. I’ve talked with hundreds of activists around the country over the years. There’s a lot of fear. But there’s also a lot of rage. And that’s a very good thing.

Because today’s repression may mimic many of the tactics of the Red Scare, but today’s response cannot. It’s not enough to cowardly distance ourselves from anyone branded a communist, I mean, terrorist. Naming names and making loyalty oaths didn’t protect activists then, and it won’t protect activists now.

The only way activists, and the First Amendment, are going to get through this is by coming out and confronting it head-on. That means reaching out to mainstream Americans and telling them that labeling activists as terrorists wastes valuable anti-terrorism resources and is an insult to everyone who died in the twin towers. That means reaching out to other activists and saying loud and clear that these activists are just the canaries in the mine.

Together, we can stop they cycle of history repeating itself.

In fact, it may have added fuel to the fire. For instance, the same day the SHAC 7 were convicted of “animal enterprise terrorism” for running a website that posted news of both legal and illegal actions, underground activists rescued animals from a vivisection lab and named them Jake, Lauren, Kevin, Andy, Josh, and Darius, after the defendants.
This is from the communiqué:
“And while the SHAC-7 will soon go to jail for simply speaking out on behalf of animals, those of us who have done all the nasty stuff talked about in the courts and in the media will still be free. So to those who still work with HLS and to all who abuse animals: we’re coming for you, motherfuckers.”
What Now? So if outlandish prison sentences and “eco-terrorism” rhetoric aren’t deterring crimes or solving crimes, what’s the point?
Fear. It’s all about fear. The point is to protect corporate profits by instilling fear in the mainstream animal rights and environmental movements—and every other social movement paying attention—and make people think twice about using their First Amendment rights.
Industry groups say “this is just the starting gun” for the Green Scare. But this could be the starting gun for activists as well. I’ve talked with hundreds of activists around the country over the years. There’s a lot of fear. But there’s also a lot of rage. And that’s a very good thing.
Because today’s repression may mimic many of the tactics of the Red Scare, but today’s response cannot. It’s not enough to cowardly distance ourselves from anyone branded a communist, I mean, terrorist. Naming names and making loyalty oaths didn’t protect activists then, and it won’t protect activists now.
The only way activists, and the First Amendment, are going to get through this is by coming out and confronting it head-on. That means reaching out to mainstream Americans and telling them that labeling activists as terrorists wastes valuable anti-terrorism resources and is an insult to everyone who died in the twin towers. That means reaching out to other activists and saying loud and clear that these activists are just the canaries in the mine.
Together, we can stop they cycle of history repeating itself.

story:
*We have reached our starting goal but are still a long way from being able to replace what we have lost - thank you for continuing to donate!  We appreciate your contribution - every dollar will benefit the children immensely.*

Who We Are

We are a small public Montessori elementary school in Prince George, BC.  Yesterday a devastating fire broke out in the school; we were able to get all children and adults out of the school but lost many of our beloved class pets to the fire.  The damages are severe, all our materials, books and supplies are lost.  There is no chance of being back in the school this year.  Our children, families and teachers are heartbroken. 

'It is difficult to express what it feels like to see the bricks and mortar of a school being compromised because it's a symbol of the learning, hardwork and collaboration within and - spirit willing - progress toward a vision for our children.'                                                                                                     - Karin Paterson, prinicipal of Highglen Montessori Elementary School

What We Need

We have lost everything.  We need:
  • Montessori materials (it costs approximately $20K to outfit one classroom, we have 10 classrooms)
  • school supplies (paper, pencils, scissors, etc)
  • books (textbooks, library books)
  • pets & pet supplies (each Montessori classroom typically has 4-5 pets)

The Impact

'By donating to our school you will help build back up what Maria Montessori once built and recreate the beliefs that she had.  I personally am graduating from elementary school and will probably never be able to learn in Highglen again.  It would make me feel better knowing that my sister will get to see it rebuilt and restored.'
- Alexa Pettersen, Highglen Montessori student, age 12
 
By donating to our cause you will help us to ease our grieving and allow us to move forward and build up what we have lost.

Other Ways You Can Help

Just having us in your thoughts means a lot.  Please spread the word so that we can reach our goals.
 
Thank you!
 
The child is both a hope and a promise for mankind. - Maria Montessori

story:
inherQuests believes that in order for there to be more financially empowered women in the world, education should start at an early age. Through our one-of-a-kind financial literacy subscription box, we are revolutionizing how girls learn about money and basic financial concepts.

Through our experiential learning curriculum, which is filled with fun games and engaging activities called "Quests," we enable girls to establish a strong foundation for life-long financial independence and well-being.

 

A year-long curriculum is available for girls at each grade level, Kindergarten through 5th grade.

Through annual subscriptions, we deliver monthly boxes filled with Quests, an easy-to-follow parent guide, complementary products and material, exciting rewards and more!

Why is this an effective way for girls to receive an early financial education? By presenting experiential learning games and activities as exciting and challenging Quests, we capture girls' natural curiosity and get them excited to solve puzzles so they end up having fun while still learning!

The Boxes

Once subscribed, you will begin receiving a monthly box filled with age-appropriate fun Quests!  Each box will contain:

  • Quests: Cool activities and fun games built to introduce girls to various financial concepts, drawing out their natural curiosity to seek out answers to provided questions or clues, leading them to reflect on the learnings and apply concepts in real life. There will be a minimum of four Quests in each box, each presented to by an illustrated character that will take you and your girl through the Quest!
  • Parent Guide: A very easy to follow step-by-step guide for you to walk your girl through the Quests in various ways, such as: engaging her curiosity, posing reflective questions, helping her explore real-life examples and situations, and going through learning checkpoints. The guide will provide suggestions, tips, examples, question guide, answers, and different ways of going through specific Quests.
  • Complementary Products: Everything necessary to complete the Quests, so you don't need to purchase any extra materials (with the exception of some bonus Quests we may add)! These may include items like worksheets, game cards, saving boxes, play money, books, journals, crayons, stickers, puzzles, games, quick questionnaires with pre-paid postage envelopes, fun rewards and more, all depending on what Quests are included in that specific box.

The Curriculum

Did you know that at age 5 or 6, children may simply see a bank as a place to store money, but they simultaneously can understand the importance of saving and can save for short term goals? By age  8 or 9, they can understand that a savings account can help them achieve goals and can save for increasingly longer amounts of time. Understanding children’s development is a key component of our curriculum.

Our program was built using the Financial Literacy Educators Council’s Financial Literacy Framework and Standards, which were developed through a collaboration of a team of experts, built on extensive research, and reflective of feedback received from hundreds of individual educators and financial professionals.

Our experiential education curriculum was developed by an education expert with years of experience in experiential education facilitation and consulting, youth development and curriculum design, and advanced degrees in Psychology and Education.  

Each level of our program has learning goals and skills that are categorized into five broad areas: 

  1. Financial Psychology
  2. Accounts, Savings & Budgets
  3. Income, Careers, Business & Entrepreneurship
  4. Credit, Debit & Loans
  5. Risk Management & Insurance

Beyond financial skills, we also focus on financial attitudes, knowing the need for girls to develop value for financial literacy, which when begun at an early age leads to positive financial behaviors and identity in adult life.

 

Financially empowered women are savvy about their money and smart about their financial choices, opening up more options for them to create the lives they want.

Most of us aren’t achieving this. Girls and women are disproportionately at a disadvantage when it comes to financial literacy. We earn less than men and spend fewer years working so we can raise our kids. We have to work even harder to save money! To add to the mix, chances are we learned little to no basic financial concepts growing up, since financial literacy programs directed at children are rare.

This is why we believe in teaching girls about money at an early age and through continuous programming. Few existing programs only start around 4th grade, with the majority not before high school. At an early age, children have already become active consumers and are in control of some money, whether their own or their parent’s! From an educational perspective, starting in early elementary school allows for a blank slate rather than having to work to correct bad habits and misconceptions.

Every girl deserves to get what she needs to become a financially empowered woman.

 

My name is Dina Shoman, and I founded inherQuests because I have experienced firsthand how empowering it can be to know about and value money from an early age and how it has affected my financial decisions as an adult. Being a fourth generation member of a banking family, I grew up surrounded by the subject, which I often found so boring! As an adult, I realized how valuable it was to have absorbed some of it, and I wanted to find a way to make it fun and easier for girls to learn! So I created inherQuests because I want to enable every young girl to become a financially empowered woman who will have more choices to create whatever life she wants.

Studies have shown that early financial literacy can give our girls the tools and understanding they need to earn, save, borrow, spend, and invest years before they have to be financially responsible for themselves. With an early financial education, we can help girls become ready and prepared for the multitude of financial challenges they will face as women.

 


We are raising $30,000 to produce our first series of boxes. The funds will go towards:

  1. Designing the physical curriculum
  2. Sourcing external complementary products
  3. Printing & producing prototypes.

Additionally, by having as many pre-subscriptions as possible (check our $200 reward level), we will be able to:

  1. Achieve economies of scale in terms of printing and ordering products, therefore keeping the price of future subscriptions as low as possible.
  2. Prove interest in our product and begin finding partners to help us provide an early financial education to the underprivileged.

Exceeding our goal will help us design the physical curriculums for levels beyond Kindergarten faster, setup the best fulfillment solution to handle higher demand volume and hire more hands on deck. All funds will be used towards building the product and optimizing on efficiencies.

We have many exciting rewards for our supporters, including an Indiegogo exclusive annual subscription rate for any of the program levels you desire (K-5), an illustration of your girl in our Quests, lots of fun swag, and the chance to spend the day with us in New York City!

 

Curriculum development takes time, and there is always a chance for delay; however, we do not anticipate delaying the release of programs for grades 3-5 by more than 6 months at a maximum after the release of K-2. 

Production, fulfillment and shipping costs are all things we want to achieve the best efficiencies for; pre-subscriptions through our campaign and beyond will help tremendously with that, so please spread the word!

We want every girl to have the opportunity of an early financial education so we can have a world with more financially empowered women doing amazing things! We will be looking at different models on how to make our boxes available to under privileged areas of the country.

 

We understand that not everyone can contribute financially, but you can still help us by spreading the word! You can use the share tools on this page to share with other champions of girl empowerment and financial freedom. That is just as valuable to us as your financial contribution, and we thank you for helping us in any way you can.

One of the easiest places to share is via social media! Consider using the suggested language below or craft your own:

Twitter & Facebook

Join me in supporting financial literacy for girls igg.me/at/inherquests  #girlpower #finlit4her #girlscan

#yesallwomen should be financially literate—let’s start girls off strong! igg.me/at/inherquests #finlit4her #girlscan #girlpower

Join the revolution. Help us teach girls they hold the key to their financial future: igg.me/at/inherquests #finlit4her #girlscan #girlpower

Have suggestions or ideas? Feel free to contact us, we would love to hear from you!

 

What is inherQuests?

inherQuests is financial education company that creates products to help young girls grow up to become financially empowered women. We currently offer a financial education product that is a cross between a subscription box and an educational program. The levels we are offering are for grades K-5, which encompass year-long curriculums built on the experiential education model (doing, reflecting, applying), which makes learning fun! Through an annual subscription, girls will receive a different box every month, for 12 months, filled with Quests (activities and games), parent guidelines, supporting materials, rewards and other fun items!

Why experiential learning?

Like many education experts, we believe that the best way to learn a subject is by doing, reflecting on, and applying what’s been learned. That’s particularly important when the subject matter is considered by many to be complex or boring. Young girls, in particular, tend to do better when they are given real world context for different scenarios and problems. Their natural curiosity is well suited to experiential learning programs. We’ve worked hard to create programs girls will find interactive, engaging, and fun!

Why not boys?

We decided to focus on girls because of the many challenges they automatically face due to their gender, starting from childhood. We believe that for a woman to have options in life and to make the choices she wants, she needs to be financially empowered, and that starts early.

When they do enter the workforce, they are faced with distinct challenges like the gender-based wage gap, having to work less years due to child-rearing, needing to save more for retirement because they outlive men by an average of 7 years, and much more.

Can boys use the boxes?

Of course!

Which education standards do you use and why?

Our curriculum is based on standards presented by the National Financial Educators Council, which were established through a collaborative effort by a team of experts using research and feedback from hundreds of individual educators and financial professionals. 

Who are your education experts?

We have counted on the expertise behind the National Coalition for Financial Educators who have developed the standards we used. We have also contracted experts with undergraduate and graduate degrees in psychology and education and numerous years of experience in the field, specifically in experiential learning.

How do you measure the effectiveness of the curriculum?

We have integrated assessment tools that will be administered at the beginning and the end of each curriculum level which will provide us with information about each girl’s learning and progress.

Why don’t you digitize the program and have it all online?

Kids get so much screen time already. We are currently looking into which components to incorporate online in the near future, however our hope is that we’re giving girls opportunities to learn and apply concepts in real life. Experiential learning means a focus on interacting with the world and the people around us. Another aspect is that by having the program as physical boxes, we will be able to make them available for girls everywhere from all income spectrums, and regardless of whether or not they have access to the internet.

How much does an annual membership cost?

Through our special annual subscription reward, you will be getting the annual subscription at a bargain of $200, or just over $16 per box. We are still figuring out the appropriate cost for the annual subscription once our campaign is over, and we will be basing it on volume cost efficiencies while not sacrificing quality.

What is your timeline for launching different age groups?

We are planning to have Kindergarten through 2nd grade launched by April 2017, and grades 3-5 within a few short months after.

Why not other age groups?

Although our program currently only covers K-5, we are looking into what our product would look like for pre-teens and teens in the future, which will potentially entail a product update or a completely new product that goes beyond a subscription box. This is just our first product!

Will you have them in different languages?

Yes. We plan to offer our programs in other languages, beginning with Spanish as soon as we can. We would love to hear from you if you are interested in having it in other languages beyond English and Spanish in the future!

Is inherQuests a non-profit?

No, it is a for-profit business. We do not want to rely on donors to fund early financial education for girls, and so we elected to be a for-profit company with a social cause.

Where are you located?

inherQuests is headquartered in New York, NY. In terms of stores, we are only available online at the moment.

How big is your team?

inherQuests is the brainchild of Dina Shoman, with dedicated support from a cast of reputable agencies and advisors. Plans to grow the internal team are in the works!

Will inherQuests be available outside of the US?

For right now, we can only ship with the US; however, as we grow, we are looking to expand into other markets and to see how to localize the content based on local requirements, languages, culture and norms as needed. Sign up for our newsletter to stay updated!

 

 

Our girls have BIG dreams, and we want them to grow up to become capable and confident of making smart financial choices. Join our Quest!

story:
SWISS Trilingual School is a total language immersion small private elementary school in Atlanta, Georgia  Classes are taught within the Chinese (Mandarin), Spanish, Japanese or French languages. Every student receives English as a third language, and in our American schools receive 5 hours or less of English per week. Our school originated in New York in 2004, for the purpose of teaching true cultural / linguistic appreciation to children. Since then, our school has grown into a place where children are safe to learn many more important things about life. 

 

Our goal of $150,000.00 will allow us to continue comfortably at our Atlanta school, and allow us to bring this gift to other commuities. We would have the honor to educate and affect the happy futures of children of various backgrounds who actually deserve and appreciate it! We also need to provide more materials to the classroom, and garner media attention to our school, which could attract more independent and caring families, to increase our student body, and stabilize our school and mission! Donors who are interested can receive free video language learning tools starring our students, or 20% discounts to our Saturday School classes. If we are unable to reach our goal, the money donated will be used to pay teachers, for advertising, and marketing tools.


What We Do & WHY

 

PEACE PROFOUND, including life appreciation, self love, compassion for others, respect for the earth, personal balance, love for everyone, personal responsibility, a choice for happiness, and laughter have become main subjects at our school! Our students are peaceful, wise, thinking, courteous, compassionate, funny, happy, creative little people who each adore math and speak three languages fluently. These are the results of our environment, rather than a cold direct goal.


Many parents have become attracted to our school because of our expert ability to teach additional languages to fluency, like no other school. However, we have been misunderstood, and too many families are looking for their children to become elite, instead of peaceful, charitable members of society. This is not our purpose, and these types of relationships do not last when it becomes obvious that the school and the parent have very different goals for the student. We are passionate about what we know to be the natural evolution in education, but it is a struggle financially each day to continue this mission, as educational pioneers.


We hope to continue to create this type of passionate experience for kids in many more places, so that the world can grow up together. We have recently opened a small program in Paris, France, and are incorporated to open a school in Honduras in 2013. We will also be opening a small home school program in New Orleans this year, with hopes to open a full-time school by the end of the year. Our goal is to eventually have at least one school on 6 continents, so that our students may travel the globe, helping, teaching, and learning what the world would like to teach them! 

 

Although we are a private school, most of our families are on very partial scholarships, as it is more important for us to provide an education to families who understand the impact of acquiring a real life education, not just high standardized test scores. Even on a budget, it takes a lot of money to educate an elementary age child naturally, and within 3 languages. As well, our school concept has never been done before, and not many families fully get the scope of what we do! Our dedicated families work hard to keep our school a success, but in a tough economy, we worry we may have to close the doors on our Atlanta campus. 


If there is enough support out there for us to continue, we know that we must happily do that. However, if there is not enough support and understanding for what we do, then we may have to enrich kids later in life when the understanding and appreciation for what we have to offer the world is finally here. Our ears and hearts are open.


Our school is actually located in the previous Obama camp of Atlanta, and we happen to think that this is not a coincidence. We see our campaign for education in a similar light, and we operate in many similar ways, as well. If it worked for Obama, it can work for us, right? If you are unable to donate big, please send anything you have! Also, PLEASE spread this to everyone that you know! The future of education continues to look like, "Waiting For Superman", so every penny counts towards changing that outcome!

 

Our YouTube page:

 

http://www.youtube.com/user/SWISSTrilingual?feature=mhee

 

Follow us on twitter! @SWISSTrilingual

 

Read our blog on Huffington Post!

 

http://www.huffingtonpost.com/mo-thurman/the-sensitive-subject-of-_b_1209140.html
story_txt:
SWISS Trilingual School is a total language immersion small private elementary school in Atlanta, Georgia  Classes are taught within the Chinese (Mandarin), Spanish, Japanese or French languages. Every student receives English as a third language, and in our American schools receive 5 hours or less of English per week. Our school originated in New York in 2004, for the purpose of teaching true cultural / linguistic appreciation to children. Since then, our school has grown into a place where children are safe to learn many more important things about life. 
 
Our goal of $150,000.00 will allow us to continue comfortably at our Atlanta school, and allow us to bring this gift to other commuities. We would have the honor to educate and affect the happy futures of children of various backgrounds who actually deserve and appreciate it! We also need to provide more materials to the classroom, and garner media attention to our school, which could attract more independent and caring families, to increase our student body, and stabilize our school and mission! Donors who are interested can receive free video language learning tools starring our students, or 20% discounts to our Saturday School classes. If we are unable to reach our goal, the money donated will be used to pay teachers, for advertising, and marketing tools.
What We Do & WHY
 
PEACE PROFOUND, including life appreciation, self love, compassion for others, respect for the earth, personal balance, love for everyone, personal responsibility, a choice for happiness, and laughter have become main subjects at our school! Our students are peaceful, wise, thinking, courteous, compassionate, funny, happy, creative little people who each adore math and speak three languages fluently. These are the results of our environment, rather than a cold direct goal.
Many parents have become attracted to our school because of our expert ability to teach additional languages to fluency, like no other school. However, we have been misunderstood, and too many families are looking for their children to become elite, instead of peaceful, charitable members of society. As well, our school concept has never been done before, and not many families fully get the scope of what we do! However, if there is not enough support and understanding for what we do, then we may have to enrich kids later in life when the understanding and appreciation for what we have to offer the world is finally here. The future of education continues to look like, "Waiting For Superman", so every penny counts towards changing that outcome! 

 
Our YouTube page: 
 
http://www.youtube.com/user/SWISSTrilingual?feature=mhee
 
Follow us on twitter! @SWISSTrilingual
 
Read our blog on Huffington Post!
 
http://www.huffingtonpost.com/mo-thurman/the-sensitive-subject-of-_b_1209140.html

story:
Dear Logical side,
You hate performing. Do something you actually want to do, like open up an awesome faerie academy where kids and adults, goblins and trolls, faeries and mermaid can learn aerial silks, trapeze, juggling, stilt walking, and other forms of expressive circus arts. 
Love, Dreamer side

Dear Dreamer side,                                                                                   Sounds good but unfortunately it's not that easy. I need materials to make poi, balls and scarves to juggle, stilts to walk on... and that's the easy part. I need the perfect tree with the perfect branch to follow me around so I can hang my silks anywhere. Oh, and I need it to be strong and immortal so that it doesn't fall and squish poor jimmy. 

Dear Logical side, Um hello? Indiegogo?

Dear Dreamer side, Oh yea. 

 

Last year I had the idea to let kids join me in the air and try out what it feels like to be an aerial faerie... I thought I'd get 2 or 3 takers. I had over 40 in an hour! What does this tell me? That there are a lot of aerial faeries out their dying to spread their wings!

I want to create a safe and fun place for all faerie, goblins and trolls, and humans too, to be able to try things they never thought of trying before. 

Pixi Thistlily's Aerial Circus School will let them do just that. Scarves, poi, juggling balls, stilts- these are just a few things to play and explore with at the many festivals that the school will be a part of. I want to teach more structured classes (with maybe a little less than 40 kids so that everyone gets a turn) and be able to hold workshops and invite guest artists to teach us all something new! 

But I need your help! Circus Schools don't just fall from the sky!
I need materials to do this; a freestanding portable rig to hang my silks and trapeze on, scarves and balls to juggle, materials for stilts and other fun fantastical creations to play with!

With all this cool new stuff, I can bring Pixi Thistlily's Circus School to life! I can offer places like festivals and big backyard bashes a great new experience. 

And I have some pretty cool experiences to give in return. I have something to fit everyone's wishlist, and every penny helps. If want to help but just can't afford it right now, no worries! You can still help emensly by helping to spread the word! Thank you so so so much in advanced!

story:
UPDATE-- 12/28/2013

Thank you all for your contributions! We are past the halfway mark, and incredibly grateful and overwhelmed by your support!

If you know anyone who might be interested in making an end-of-year donation, please SHARE our campaign! We have only 34 days left to reach our $20,000 goal, and are relying on the support of our community.

Thank you again, and have a wonderful new year!

LeAp OnStage Gives the Writers of Tomorrow a Voice

LeAp OnStage is a life-changing theater-education program for 600 inner-city high school students in New York City public schools.

  • Our students learn to write, direct, and produce their own plays
  • They meet actors, directors, and producers from the Broadway world
  • They have their plays workshopped by professionals and develop their own ideas and voices as the year progresses
  • At the end of the year, the ten best student plays are professionally produced in an Off-Brodway theater and performed by a student cast
  • These plays are published by Samuel French, the leading publisher of plays
Our students come from some of the poorest neighborhoods in the city, and their schools do not always have strong arts programs. LeAp OnStage allows these talented, articulate teens to express themselves on a professional stage, in front of their friends and families.

In schools where students struggle to pass state tests and graduate,

95% of LeAp OnStage students graduate high school, and 97% attend college.

Many of our students go on to attend institutes of higher education, often majoring in theater. Some of them have written plays of their own once the program has ended, and others have performed professionally. LeAp OnStage allows students to express their thoughts on issues and concerns that affect them personally.

We Have Lost Our Funding

As a result of severe budget cuts to schools and the loss of a major sustaining grant,  the program is struggling to stay afloat. We have funds from a few foundations, but currently, we are faced with a $20,000 deficit. We need to raise the remainder of the funds in order for the program to continue.

Here is how we will use the money:

  • STAFF: We will use your funds to pay the salaries of our dedicated artists and creative teaching professionals. We need these funds to sustain the 30-weeks of the program and bring high-quality instruction to our students.
  • THEATER VISITS: Your contribution will help us take the students to see a play on a Broadway stage and participate in talk-backs with the cast and crew, an opportunity they might never have had without the program.
  • FINAL PERFORMANCES: A portion of your donation will go toward the cost of producing the winning student plays at The Pearl Theatre (an established Off-Broadway venue).

The Impact

Our program really works. By the end of the year, these students (most of whom have had no prior experience in playwriting) write and produce their own plays, perform for their families and friends, and become the next generation of playwrights.

  • Your funds will help over 600 students become playwrights, directors, and actors
  • They will have access to theater professionals, get the opportunity to develop and workshop their plays, and produce them on an Off-Broadway Stage
  • Every year, our students produce incredible, articulate, moving plays that express their innermost hopes and fears
  • They develop confidence, pride, and teamwork skills that will last a lifetime

This program transforms students' lives. Your funds will allow us to make these voices heard.

"I learned how to create a scene out of darkness, a person out of words, and a lifetime of success." -Student

"There is no program like this. It surpasses any other artist program I've been a part of. Incredibly professional every step of the way." -Teacher

"We have to have programs like this that encourage kids to talk about what they know and what they're going through. It's crucial." -Marsha Norman, Playwright

Please Help the Program Continue

Share our campaign with your friends and acquaintances!

Get out there and spread the word so that we can continue to provide underserved students with unparalleled opportunities in theater and playwriting. Thank you for your support, and we will keep you updated as the program progresses!

If desired, every donor will have his or her name listed in the acknowledgements section of our final program.
