story:
The Campaign Continues for
#EcoCenterBodhgaya


WE STILL NEED YOUR HELP! > Click to Contribute

  • Contribute to our Campaign. Make a Donation.

  • Watch & Share the video with friends: http://igg.me/at/eco-center-bodhgaya

  • Like & Share our Facebook posts: https://www.facebook.com/ecotrainingcenterbodhgaya

  • Tweet:  Turn Plastic Waste into an Eco-Training Center in Bodhgaya #ecocenterbodgaya http://igg.me/p/550613/twtr/656637

  • Join Our Social Media Team!  https://www.facebook.com/groups/ecobodhgayacampaignparty/

  • Email THIS message to your contacts


The Project

The treasured UNESCO world heritage site of Bodh Gaya - the place of the Buddha’s Enlightenment - is plagued by enormous amounts of plastic pollution, among other challenges that threaten the local ecology, economy, & community.

Visited by thousands of Buddhists, Hindus, and tourists who come on spiritual pilgrimages from all over the world, Bodh Gaya is also home to a local village population of around 40,000 Hindus, Muslims, Buddhists, and Christians. 

Bodh Gaya based NGO, Sacred Earth Trust, in collaboration with global Partners in Empowerment: Empowerment Works and Living Mandala, have teamed up with diverse members of the local community to transform Bodh Gaya's plastic pollution problem into a sustainable building solution for the region. 

Through implementing low-cost, leading-edge recycling and building technologies (Ubuntu-Blox), this project will create a Recycling and Eco-Training Center out of compressed plastic blocks and become a catalyst in the region for transforming problematic waste into vital building resources and job opportunities.  

This ground breaking project, beginning at one of the most treasured yet impoverished cities in the world, addresses a truly global issue, is highly scalable, and is being developed and evaluated for rippling global impact. 

With your support, this initiative will not only clean up, create jobs and make a greener Bodh Gaya, but will also be a model to inspire and educate other communities in need of appropriate waste solutions around the world. 

THANK YOU FOR YOUR VITAL PARTICIPATION!!

The Problem

The large number of tourists that come through Bodh Gaya each year and the lack of any recycling system results in endemic plastic pollution that plagues local economy, health, and environment of Bodh Gaya, villagers and tourists alike. Local children of the Dalit (lower caste) villages work through the night and lack educational opportunities or options for sustainable livelihoods. The health of the local ecology is also suffering greatly, and only continues to deteriorate.  Let's get plastic out of our water ways!

The Solution

We have discovered a brilliant, low-cost way to turn this problem into a leading-edge solution by utilizing the plastic waste and compressing it into blocks that can be used as a medium for sustainable building construction!

Plastic waste is collected, cleaned, recycled, and then compressed into blocks to be used as building blocks. This proven appropriate technology solution pioneered in Haiti transforms this waste into a valuable resource. 

Past Research Proves:

  • The method of construction with the plastic blocks is earthquake resistance to scale of 8.3
  • Can withstand winds of up to 70mph
  • Has high insulation properties


Recycling and Training Center 

The technology opportunity driving this project is a leading-edge, low cost building method, known as Ubuntu-Blox, developed in Texas and tested in Haiti. Centered in the heart of Bodh Gaya to provide ongoing vocational and sustainability education, the Recycling and Training Center will become a focal point for resolving the detrimental plastic pollution problem locally in Bodh Gaya, and be a demonstration model for local, regional, and international communities.

Once initial seed funding is in place, the Recycling and Training Center will be established as a hub to collects and recycles plastic from the city and turns it into blocks that will be distributed and sold to support ongoing education programs.  The plastic building blocks can be used for construction of public toilets, roads, walls, benches, and other community needs. This reduces the need for other higher cost and less sustainable building materials such as bricks, cement, and lumber, while creating more sustainable livelihoods for local villagers.

Vocational Training

The Recycling and Eco-Training Center will also offer vocational trainings, job opportunities, and community service programs. Educational programs will include training locals on the recycled plastic block construction technologies; sustainability and permaculture design trainings; water, waste, energy, and other appropriate technologies; Seven Stages to Sustainability Community Development, and other vocational trainings such as sowing, arts, crafts, and more. The Center will also host community programs like the Village Woman's Program, the Recycling Program, the Tree Planting Program, and more. These programs will be offered for local people including local men, women, children, and youths, and for international visitors alike. The Center will also sell locally produced goods created by the local artisans and villagers.

Impact & Outcomes

  • Building a Recycling Center to address the on-going plastic issues
  • Cleaning the plastic pollution in Bod Ghaya and beautifying the city
  • Developing cutting-edge sustainable building technologies
  • Providing educational and vocational trainings
  • Creating and supporting local sustainable livelihoods
  • Engaging local, national and international partners

As the project grows, we will be inviting community stakeholders and NGO's from all around the Himalayan region, India, other countries to learn these leading-edge recycling and building technologies, as well as other sustainability techniques and practices, which they can take back to implement in their respective regions.

Phases

Phase 1 - Materials Construction & Design: $25k

In order to get this project off the ground, we need $25k of seed money. These funds will allow us to complete the foundational steps of gathering the raw plastic materials, purchasing the compression machine, constructing the plastic blocks, and completing the design to be ready for the building construction. Throughout this process we will enroll and coordinate local villagers in a large scale gathering of plastic pollution from all over Bodh Gaya. A team of local community villagers will also be trained in the process of constructing the plastic blocks for the construction of the Recycling & Eco-Training Center Building.

Phase 2 - Construction of the Building: $50k

Any additional funds we receive beyond the minimum $25k will go towards the construction of the Eco-Center Building. In Phase 2 of the project, trained local villagers proficient in the plastic block building method will utilize the plastic blocks to build the Recycling and Eco-Training Center building. This building will house the Sacred Earth Trust office, a Solar powered I.T. Centre, and a Training Room.

Phase 3 - Solar Powered IT Center, Greenhouse, Greenhouse, & Compost Toilets: $75k

Any funds we receive beyond $50k will go towards Phase 3 of the project, which is transforming the Eco-Center into a model sustainability demonstration site including:

  • Solar Powered Energy
  • Furnished IT Center 
  • Year Round Community Garden
  • Compost toilets
  • Medicinal Plant & Tea Production Green House
  • Rooftop Food Garden

Perk Details

1. Donate $15 - New 7SS/PDC eBook!

7 Stages to Sustainability + Permaculture ebook & Resource Guide

Chip in just $15 and we'll send you this 50 page plus ebook overview of the Seven Stages to Sustainability & Permaculture Design in digital form - produced by Empowerment Works and Living Mandala! This ebook has a thorough overview of both of these powerful frameworks and regenerative design processes, as well as resources, tools and techniques for sustainability - from natural building to gardening, and how they can be be applied some of the most pressing problems facing the world and communities today. 

2. Shawni Music Album: "Only Here"

"It is such a joy to be able to share with you my first album", debuted at Lightning in a Bottle : http://shawnimusic.com/  GET FULL DOWNLOAD 


3. Donate $25 - Tree Planting

A Tree planted in your name in local Bodh Gaya Villages!


4. Donate $50 - Locally, Hand-Crafted Bag

1 Tree Planted + Beautiful, locally made hand-crafted bag from the Bodh Gaya Village Woman's Project. (Only 50 available!)

For just $50 you can support the local villagers, artisans and economy of Bodh Gaya and we'll send you this beautiful hand-made bag! This option is only available for the first 50 takers!

5. Donate $75 - Medicine Buddha Puja

2 Trees Planted +  we will arrange to have a Medicine Buddha Puja performed for you or a designated person of your choice by one of the local partnering Buddhist monasteries. The Medicine Buddha Puja purifies and heals on all levels — physical, mental, spiritual and environmental.

6. Donate $100 - 7SS / PC On-Line Training + Videos

3 Trees Planted + On-Line Course + Video Recordings: 7 Stages to Sustainability + Permaculture: Building Sustainable Futures From the Ground Up 

In 2014 we will be offering an 8-part on-line course giving a virtual overview of the 7 Stages to Sustainability + Permaculture Design. This class will be over 16 hours of live virtual instruction, recorded videos of the classes, and over 75 pages of course materials. As the course will be made available via video digitally, if you cannot attend the sessions live, you will still be able to access the course video recordings and materials  into the indefinite future.

7. Donate $175 - Credit for On-Line Training

4 Trees Planted + Credit to attend a Sustainability Training On-Line With Living Mandala

For $150 we'll give you credit towards a full 6 - 8 part sustainability course on-line with Living Mandala! (www.LivingMandala.com) This includes around 12 hours of live, virtual instruction, recordings of the sessions, and class materials. Classes may vary from “Re-Designing the Commons” with Mark Lakeman, “Aquaponics With Applied Permaculture” with Max Meyers, “Permaculture Business Innovation”, “Empowerment Through Collaboration” with Starhawk,and more. This credit will be good towards any of Living Mandala' 6-part virtual courses, or as credit towards the cost of another course of your choice.

8. Donate $295 - Local Training Scholarship

5 Trees Planted + Sponsor training for a local community or NGO leaders to attend a 7SS PDC Training at the project site. Info: www.livingmandala.com/7SS

One key purpose of this campaign is to catalyze and support the on-going efforts of sustainable development in Bodh Gaya, India by the local villagers, students, leaders, youth, activists, government officials, NGO's, & Buddhists monks & nuns in the local community.   Sponsoring a local community leader in Bodh Gaya or other parts of India to attend a 7SS PDC Training in Bodh Gaya India will have a real impact for those committed and passionate about this work, and who will be a catalyst for resilience in their own community. We will let you know who you are sponsoring and you will receive a thank you letter, as well as a follow-up summary report of their design project, and how they intend to use the knowledge to impact their local community.   

9. Donate $495 - Case of California or Oregon Wine!

Choice of Red or White.  Whatever it is, it will be good...

10. Donate $1000 - Custom Consultation

8 Trees Planted + Custom 7 Stages to Sustainability + Permaculture Organization or Project Design Consultation, Analysis, & Write-Up

For $1000 contribution, a qualified 7SS or Permaculture Design consultant from Empowerment Works, Living Mandala, or Sacred Earth Trust will give you a custom 7SS and/or Permaculture Design consultation of your organization, homestead, or project. This will include online interviews, review of material, community and site analysis, and detailed write-up with design improvement and implementation suggestions.


11. Donate $1500 - Guided Tour

15 Trees Planted + Guided Tour of Sacred Earth Trust sites in Bodh Gaya 

For a $1500 contribution, Sacred Earth Trust will give you a personalized, guided tour of Sacred Earth Trust programs and sites in Bodh Gaya, India, and sacred sites in the surrounding Biha Area. Come see the projects and the impact you are making fist-hand, visit sacred sites in Bodh Gaya, meet local villagers involved, learn about exciting new sustainability technologies, and have the journey of a life-time!

12. Donate $2500 - Recycled Plastic Bench

25 Trees Planted + Recycled Plastic Brick Cob Bench Made in Your Name

For a $2500 Contribution, along with the other perks above you can sponsor the building of Recycled Plastic Brick Cob Bench, which will be used for training and educational purposes, as well as be a beautiful asset to the community. The bench will be made from recycled plastic bricks covered in cob - a natural building method that is a mixture of sand, clay, and straw.

PLUS...

  • Your name on Gratitude Wall of Eco-Training Center
  • Sponsor Training for 5 local community or NGO leaders 
  • A Thank You letter and a custom piece of hand-drawn art work from local Dalit Children

12. Donate $5000 - Art Wall Champion

50 Trees planted in your name AND the above gratitude perks, the center will dedicate a recycled art project mural co-created by local youth, naming you (or any dedication of your choice) as its Global Community Champion!

13. Donate $10,000 - Presenting Partner

In addition to 100 Trees planted in your name, you, your company, foundation or Family, will hold Global Stewardship title dedication of the Bodh Gaya Eco-Education Center serving the local Dalit villages and Buddhist community for many years to come.  Additional Perks of a Bag, Puja, Children's Art and dedicated Recycled Bench Included!

7 Stages to Sustainability (7SS) Permaculture Design Course (PDC)

In concert with the launch of this center, we’re hosting a 7 Stages to Sustainability (7SS) Permaculture Design Course in Bodh Gaya from November 10 - 24, 2013.  The course provides capacity building in social enterprise development for leaders in non-governmental organizations (NGOs) and business alike, enabling students to apply the 7 Stages to Sustainability and permaculture techniques in their own organizations, communities, and projects, in Bodh Gaya, across India, and around the world. Registration/ Details: http://www.livingmandala.com/7SS

7SS PDC San Francisco Bay Area 2014

A 7SS Permaculture Design Course will also be happening in the San Francisco Bay Area at MA Center / GreenFriends Farm from Dec 2013 - April 2014. livingmandala.com/7SS/BayArea

Who Are We?


Sacred Earth Trust - NGO to support the sustainable development and environmental protection of Sacred sites and UNESCO world heritage sites around the world, through working in co-operation with the local, indigenous people and international groups. www.sacredearthtrust.org


 

Empowerment Works - 501c3 global sustainability think-tank in action dedicated to the advancement of whole-system, locally-led solutions for a thriving world.www.empowermentworks.org

Living Mandala - an educational organization and collective of educators working to train local leaders and catalyze project initiatives to implement personal, ecological and socially regenerative technologies. www.livingmandala.com

 

This ground breaking project will not only have a powerfully transforming impact on the treasured city of Bodh Gaya, India, but also on other parts of India and the world at large.

We hope you will join us in supporting it.

 

HEARTFELT CALL TO ACTION

  • Watch & Share the video with friends: http://igg.me/at/eco-center-bodhgaya

  • Like & Share our Facebook posts: https://www.facebook.com/ecotrainingcenterbodhgaya

The Campaign Continues for#EcoCenterBodhgaya


WE STILL NEED YOUR HELP! > Click to Contribute 



Contribute to our  Campaign. Make a Donation.


Watch & Share the video with friends: http://igg.me/at/eco-center-bodhgaya 


Like & Share our Facebook posts: https://www.facebook.com/ecotrainingcenterbodhgaya


Tweet:  Turn Plastic Waste into an Eco-Training Center in Bodhgaya #ecocenterbodgaya http://igg.me/p/550613/twtr/656637


Join Our Social Media Team!  https://www.facebook.com/groups/ecobodhgayacampaignparty/

Email THIS message to your contacts




  The ProjectThe treasured UNESCO world heritage site of Bodh Gaya - the place of the Buddha’s Enlightenment - is plagued by enormous amounts of plastic pollution, among other challenges that threaten the local ecology, economy, & community.
Visited by thousands of Buddhists, Hindus, and tourists who come on spiritual pilgrimages from all over the world, Bodh Gaya is also home to a local village population of around 40,000 Hindus, Muslims, Buddhists, and Christians. 
Bodh Gaya based NGO, Sacred Earth Trust, in collaboration with global Partners in Empowerment: Empowerment Works and Living Mandala, have teamed up with diverse members of the local community to transform Bodh Gaya's plastic pollution problem into a sustainable building solution for the region. 
Through implementing low-cost, leading-edge recycling and building technologies (Ubuntu-Blox), this project will create a Recycling and Eco-Training Center out of compressed plastic blocks and become a catalyst in the region for transforming problematic waste into vital building resources and job opportunities.  
This ground breaking project, beginning at one of the most treasured yet impoverished cities in the world, addresses a truly global issue, is highly scalable, and is being developed and evaluated for rippling global impact. 
With your support, this initiative will not only clean up, create jobs and make a greener Bodh Gaya, but will also be a model to inspire and educate other communities in need of appropriate waste solutions around the world. 
THANK YOU FOR YOUR VITAL PARTICIPATION!!




The Problem
The large number of tourists that come through Bodh Gaya each year and the lack of any recycling system results in endemic plastic pollution that plagues local economy, health, and environment of Bodh Gaya, villagers and tourists alike. Local children of the Dalit (lower caste) villages work through the night and lack educational opportunities or options for sustainable livelihoods. The health of the local ecology is also suffering greatly, and only continues to deteriorate.  Let's get plastic out of our water ways!




The Solution
We have discovered a brilliant, low-cost way to turn this problem into a leading-edge solution by utilizing the plastic waste and compressing it into blocks that can be used as a medium for sustainable building construction!
Plastic waste is collected, cleaned, recycled, and then compressed into blocks to be used as building blocks. This proven appropriate technology solution pioneered in Haiti transforms this waste into a valuable resource. 
Past Research Proves:

The method of construction with the plastic blocks is earthquake resistance to scale of 8.3
Can withstand winds of up to 70mph
Has high insulation properties



Recycling and Training Center 
The technology opportunity driving this project is a leading-edge, low cost building method, known as Ubuntu-Blox, developed in Texas and tested in Haiti. Centered in the heart of Bodh Gaya to provide ongoing vocational and sustainability education, the Recycling and Training Center will become a focal point for resolving the detrimental plastic pollution problem locally in Bodh Gaya, and be a demonstration model for local, regional, and international communities.
Once initial seed funding is in place, the Recycling and Training Center will be established as a hub to collects and recycles plastic from the city and turns it into blocks that will be distributed and sold to support ongoing education programs.  The plastic building blocks can be used for construction of public toilets, roads, walls, benches, and other community needs. This reduces the need for other higher cost and less sustainable building materials such as bricks, cement, and lumber, while creating more sustainable livelihoods for local villagers.



Vocational Training
The Recycling and Eco-Training Center will also offer vocational trainings, job opportunities, and community service programs. Educational programs will include training locals on the recycled plastic block construction technologies; sustainability and permaculture design trainings; water, waste, energy, and other appropriate technologies; Seven Stages to Sustainability Community Development, and other vocational trainings such as sowing, arts, crafts, and more. The Center will also host community programs like the Village Woman's Program, the Recycling Program, the Tree Planting Program, and more. These programs will be offered for local people including local men, women, children, and youths, and for international visitors alike. The Center will also sell locally produced goods created by the local artisans and villagers.
Impact & Outcomes


Building a Recycling Center to address the on-going plastic issues
Cleaning the plastic pollution in Bod Ghaya and beautifying the city
Developing cutting-edge sustainable building technologies
Providing educational and vocational trainings
Creating and supporting local sustainable livelihoods
Engaging local, national and international partners
As the project grows, we will be inviting community stakeholders and NGO's from all around the Himalayan region, India, other countries to learn these leading-edge recycling and building technologies, as well as other sustainability techniques and practices, which they can take back to implement in their respective regions.
Phases
Phase 1 - Materials Construction & Design: $25k
In order to get this project off the ground, we need $25k of seed money. These funds will allow us to complete the foundational steps of gathering the raw plastic materials, purchasing the compression machine, constructing the plastic blocks, and completing the design to be ready for the building construction. Throughout this process we will enroll and coordinate local villagers in a large scale gathering of plastic pollution from all over Bodh Gaya. A team of local community villagers will also be trained in the process of constructing the plastic blocks for the construction of the Recycling & Eco-Training Center Building.



Phase 2 - Construction of the Building: $50k
Any additional funds we receive beyond the minimum $25k will go towards the construction of the Eco-Center Building. In Phase 2 of the project, trained local villagers proficient in the plastic block building method will utilize the plastic blocks to build the Recycling and Eco-Training Center building. This building will house the Sacred Earth Trust office, a Solar powered I.T. Centre, and a Training Room.



Phase 3 - Solar Powered IT Center, Greenhouse, Greenhouse, & Compost Toilets: $75k
Any funds we receive beyond $50k will go towards Phase 3 of the project, which is transforming the Eco-Center into a model sustainability demonstration site including:

Solar Powered Energy
Furnished IT Center 
Year Round Community Garden
Compost toilets
Medicinal Plant & Tea Production Green House
Rooftop Food Garden


Perk Details
1. Donate $15 - New 7SS/PDC eBook!
7 Stages to Sustainability + Permaculture ebook & Resource Guide
Chip in just $15 and we'll send you this 50 page plus ebook overview of the Seven Stages to Sustainability & Permaculture Design in digital form - produced by Empowerment Works and Living Mandala! This ebook has a thorough overview of both of these powerful frameworks and regenerative design processes, as well as resources, tools and techniques for sustainability - from natural building to gardening, and how they can be be applied some of the most pressing problems facing the world and communities today. 
2. Shawni Music Album: "Only Here"
"It is such a joy to be able to share with you my first album", debuted at Lightning in a Bottle : http://shawnimusic.com/  GET FULL DOWNLOAD 


3. Donate $25 - Tree Planting
A Tree planted in your name in local Bodh Gaya Villages!


4. Donate $50 - Locally, Hand-Crafted Bag
1 Tree Planted + Beautiful, locally made hand-crafted bag from the Bodh Gaya Village Woman's Project. (Only 50 available!)
For just $50 you can support the local villagers, artisans and economy of Bodh Gaya and we'll send you this beautiful hand-made bag! This option is only available for the first 50 takers!



5. Donate $75 - Medicine Buddha Puja
2 Trees Planted +  we will arrange to have a Medicine Buddha Puja performed for you or a designated person of your choice by one of the local partnering Buddhist monasteries. The Medicine Buddha Puja purifies and heals on all levels — physical, mental, spiritual and environmental.




6. Donate $100 - 7SS / PC On-Line Training + Videos

3 Trees Planted + On-Line Course + Video Recordings: 7 Stages to Sustainability + Permaculture: Building Sustainable Futures From the Ground Up 
In 2014 we will be offering an 8-part on-line course giving a virtual overview of the 7 Stages to Sustainability + Permaculture Design. This class will be over 16 hours of live virtual instruction, recorded videos of the classes, and over 75 pages of course materials. As the course will be made available via video digitally, if you cannot attend the sessions live, you will still be able to access the course video recordings and materials  into the indefinite future.

7. Donate $175 - Credit for On-Line Training


4 Trees Planted + Credit to attend a Sustainability Training On-Line With Living Mandala
For $150 we'll give you credit towards a full 6 - 8 part sustainability course on-line with Living Mandala! (www.LivingMandala.com) This includes around 12 hours of live, virtual instruction, recordings of the sessions, and class materials. Classes may vary from “Re-Designing the Commons” with Mark Lakeman, “Aquaponics With Applied Permaculture” with Max Meyers, “Permaculture Business Innovation”, “Empowerment Through Collaboration” with Starhawk,and more. This credit will be good towards any of Living Mandala' 6-part virtual courses, or as credit towards the cost of another course of your choice.





8. Donate $295 - Local Training Scholarship

5 Trees Planted + Sponsor training for a local community or NGO leaders to attend a 7SS PDC Training at the project site. Info: www.livingmandala.com/7SS
One key purpose of this campaign is to catalyze and support the on-going efforts of sustainable development in Bodh Gaya, India by the local villagers, students, leaders, youth, activists, government officials, NGO's, & Buddhists monks & nuns in the local community.   Sponsoring a local community leader in Bodh Gaya or other parts of India to attend a 7SS PDC Training in Bodh Gaya India will have a real impact for those committed and passionate about this work, and who will be a catalyst for resilience in their own community. We will let you know who you are sponsoring and you will receive a thank you letter, as well as a follow-up summary report of their design project, and how they intend to use the knowledge to impact their local community.   

9. Donate $495 - Case of California or Oregon Wine!


Choice of Red or White.  Whatever it is, it will be good...
10. Donate $1000 - Custom Consultation
8 Trees Planted + Custom 7 Stages to Sustainability + Permaculture Organization or Project Design Consultation, Analysis, & Write-Up
For $1000 contribution, a qualified 7SS or Permaculture Design consultant from Empowerment Works, Living Mandala, or Sacred Earth Trust will give you a custom 7SS and/or Permaculture Design consultation of your organization, homestead, or project. This will include online interviews, review of material, community and site analysis, and detailed write-up with design improvement and implementation suggestions.


11. Donate $1500 - Guided Tour
15 Trees Planted + Guided Tour of Sacred Earth Trust sites in Bodh Gaya 
For a $1500 contribution, Sacred Earth Trust will give you a personalized, guided tour of Sacred Earth Trust programs and sites in Bodh Gaya, India, and sacred sites in the surrounding Biha Area. Come see the projects and the impact you are making fist-hand, visit sacred sites in Bodh Gaya, meet local villagers involved, learn about exciting new sustainability technologies, and have the journey of a life-time!



12. Donate $2500 - Recycled Plastic Bench

25 Trees Planted + Recycled Plastic Brick Cob Bench Made in Your Name
For a $2500 Contribution, along with the other perks above you can sponsor the building of Recycled Plastic Brick Cob Bench, which will be used for training and educational purposes, as well as be a beautiful asset to the community. The bench will be made from recycled plastic bricks covered in cob - a natural building method that is a mixture of sand, clay, and straw.



PLUS...

Your name on Gratitude Wall of Eco-Training Center

Sponsor Training for 5 local community or NGO leaders 

A Thank You letter and a custom piece of hand-drawn art work from local Dalit Children



12. Donate $5000 - Art Wall Champion

50 Trees planted in your name AND the above gratitude perks, the center will dedicate a recycled art project mural co-created by local youth, naming you (or any dedication of your choice) as its Global Community Champion!
13. Donate $10,000 - Presenting Partner
In addition to 100 Trees planted in your name, you, your company, foundation or Family, will hold Global Stewardship title dedication of the Bodh Gaya Eco-Education Center serving the local Dalit villages and Buddhist community for many years to come.  Additional Perks of a Bag, Puja, Children's Art and dedicated Recycled Bench Included!

In concert with the launch of this center, we’re hosting a 7 Stages to Sustainability (7SS) Permaculture Design Course in Bodh Gaya from November 10 - 24, 2013.  The course provides capacity building in social enterprise development for leaders in non-governmental organizations (NGOs) and business alike, enabling students to apply the 7 Stages to Sustainability and permaculture techniques in their own organizations, communities, and projects, in Bodh Gaya, across India, and around the world. Registration/ Details: http://www.livingmandala.com/7SS
7SS PDC San Francisco Bay Area 2014


A 7SS Permaculture Design Course will also be happening in the San Francisco Bay Area at MA Center / GreenFriends Farm from Dec 2013 - April 2014. livingmandala.com/7SS/BayArea

Who Are We?

Sacred Earth Trust - NGO to support the sustainable development and environmental protection of Sacred sites and UNESCO world heritage sites around the world, through working in co-operation with the local, indigenous people and international groups. www.sacredearthtrust.org


 
 
Empowerment Works - 501c3 global sustainability think-tank in action dedicated to the advancement of whole-system, locally-led solutions for a thriving world.www.empowermentworks.org

Living Mandala - an educational organization and collective of educators working to train local leaders and catalyze project initiatives to implement personal, ecological and socially regenerative technologies. www.livingmandala.com
 
This ground breaking project will not only have a powerfully transforming impact on the treasured city of Bodh Gaya, India, but also on other parts of India and the world at large.
We hope you will join us in supporting it.

story:
The b-Shack is a highly innovative observational beehive and educational center.

PROJECT INFO:

The b-Shack is designed, fabricated and assembled by a diverse team of students in the Facility for Architectural Research in Media and Mediation (FARMM) at the McGill University School of Architecture. The project provides support to urban beekeeping communities in Montreal in collaboration with The McGill Apiary Association, Santropol Roulant and the McGill University Macdonald Campus. The b-Shack creates a venue for volunteers, educators and amateur beekeepers to share their knowledge and interest in apiculture with the public, and it provides a centralized forum for research initiatives focused on possible solutions for Colony Collapse Disorder (CCD).

CCD is the name associated with the mysterious death of large numbers of honeybee colonies. Honeybees play a critical role in our planet’s ecosystem, responsible for the pollination of many crops in food production worldwide. A decrease of 35% of bees in the past 3 years has had major effects on pollination, crops and the economy. There is currently no solution for preventing CCD.

The b-Shack project builds upon the growing interest in urban beekeeping by providing an educational and research tool to the apiculture community. It encourages outreach on sustainable methods of creating and living within our world, and it engages a diverse set of stakeholders in critical applied research focused on urban beekeeping.

For more details copy-paste the link bellow in your browser:

http://farmmhouse.farmmresearch.com/bshack


*All t-shirts are American Apparel (poly-cotton fabric) and will be hand screen-printed by HalfLife. HalfLife is working to raise awareness about the growing homeless population in the United States while breaking down the stigmas associated with these individuals. 10% of each t-shirt will be donated to one of HalfLife’s partnering shelters. A portion of HalfLife’s manufacturing takes place within its mobile unit, offering the individuals at the shelters a first step toward full time employment. Residents who take part in the six month program acquire a working track record, references, job training, trade skill acquisition, insurance, etc. For more information please follow the link Halflifeusa.com


Q: What will we do with the money raised?

A: The goal we are asking for is enough to cover the estimated cost of materials, fabrication, assembly, and necessary expertise.

Q: When will construction begin?

A: We are currently working on a prototype model. As soon as we get financing to order the materials we will start fabricating the structural elements.

Q: When will construction end?

A: It should take a semester to complete the base and frame of the structure. We estimate that the shack will be finished by the end of April 2014. The summer of 2014 will be dedicated to the fabrication of the individual elements, such as planters, solar panels and sensors, which will be inserted into specific alcoves.

Q: Do you ship internationally?

A: Yes we will ship to anywhere, but obviously shipping charges will differ from country to country. Please keep this in mind when pledging.

Q: When should I expect my perk?

A: We will start shipping your gifts as soon as the campaign is over. Most items offered are hand made and each will be one-of-a-kind. Bear with us - we will work hard to get the perks to you as soon as possible!

Q: Is there a way we can follow the B-Shack progress?

A: We have a website where you can keep up to date with advancements in the project, as well as a Facebook page with more information on the day-to-day progress.

If you would like to have other questions answered please send us an email at:

b-Shack@farmmresearch.com

story:
Short Summary

My name is Felecia Pullen, and I am a substance abuse counselor at a prestigious university in New York City. After selling advertising space for magazines for 25 years, I decided to pursue my passion and get my masters in social work as well as my CASAC-t from Fordham University.  Pursuant to these facts, I have started a 501(c)(3) called Let's Talk S.A.F.E.T.Y. in order to deliver substance abuse prevention programming to inner city youth where drugs and alcohol have ravaged many communities. Having been born in Harlem and raised in the Bronx, I have witnessed, first-hand, the effects of substance abuse. My mission is to eradicate it from the lives of youth in the New York City School system.

Contributors to this fund will help to bring substance Abuse-Free educational programming, as well as small group and one-on-one counseling, to high risk students in the public schools within impoverished neighborhoods of the five Boroughs of New York City
.

What We Need & What You Get

We are seeking $10,000 in order to deliver programming in 8 high schools in the New York City Metro Area

We are the only substance abuse prevention programming, targeted to at-risk youth, which has a curriculum designed specifically for African-American and Latino teens.

If we do not reach out entire goal, we will use donations to provide programming to as many schools as we can afford.  (each program costs between $1,000 -$1,500). If we exceed our goal we roll out programming into other districts

The Impact

Positively impacting the lives of nearly 4,500 students, when they are most at-risk of alcohol and substance abuse, is an opportunity to help stop more than just addiction. You are also positively impacting social structures such as familial ties, decreasing the propensity for violence, increasing educational and workforce productivity and increasing the health of teens who choose a life of sobriety over a life of substance abuse.

This program was successfully launched at the Hudson School in Hoboken New Jersey and has had a positive impact on the lives of the class of 2013 (all of whom graduated and most of whom went on to college).

I believe in the power of today's youth to say no to drugs, as long as they're given the tools to do so. Help me deliver the tools necessary for them to build a strong foundation upon which to stand.

Other Ways You Can Help

Thank you for taking the time out to consider Let's Talk S.A.F.E.T.Y. if you can contribute we appreciate your sponsorship; if not please spread the word about our amazing program via Facebook, Twitter or other forms of social media by using the Indiegogo share tools!

Respectfully.

Felecia Pullen

story:
Hey you! yes YOU! If you are reading this message it's because you are about to contribute to the most exciting and youth-driven initiative to help university students and young professionals from the Middle East and North Africa make a difference in their lives, their communities, and the larger society! What an ambitious and life-changing experience this is going to be!

We are the young women and men behind the Arab Development Initiative (ADI) - and we want you to make our dream come true!

ADI is a youth-driven initiative that focuses on development in the Arab world. Our mission is to encourage highly-skilled and educated Arab youth direct their efforts towards personal and societal development in our region. We act as intermediary between youth and organizations working for the greater development - at all levels - in the Arab world. 

The ADI is a non-profit organization that is not affiliated with any political group, ideology, or religion. In our past activities, we hosted two Envision Arabia Summits (EAS), respectively in Montreal (2011) and New York City (2012), and we brought together over 800 participants from all parts of the world and all walks of life in a physical and intellectual space that generated concrete and impactful action in the MENA region.

This year, on May 16-18,  ADI will be hosting its third - dubbed EAS14 -  in Montreal. The Summit will bring together hundreds of youth for a weekend of inspirational talks, engaging discussions, and meaningful action. We are very thrilled to see each one of you!

The Summit focuses on producing a vision for the future of the Arab world. Over 400 youth delegates will bring their knowledge, experience, and ideas to the table as they envision the future in six sectors:Economic Development, Science and Technology, Health and Well-being, Society and Culture, Law and Human Rights, and Education - and what an ambition plan this is! 

With the growing demand for energetic and change-making platforms, EAS14 is the ultimate forum for youth to tackle the issues at the core of development in the Arab world. Join us and play a part in this journey - you contributions will be a generous support and encouragement to help ADI grow!

 What are you waiting for? Join the movement and be a change-maker!
story_txt:
Hey you! yes YOU! If you are reading this message it's because you are about to contribute to the most exciting and youth-driven initiative to help university students and young professionals from the Middle East and North Africa make a difference in their lives, their communities, and the larger society! What an ambitious and life-changing experience this is going to be!We are the young women and men behind the Arab Development Initiative (ADI) - and we want you to make our dream come true!
ADI is a youth-driven initiative that focuses on development in the Arab world. Our mission is to encourage highly-skilled and educated Arab youth direct their efforts towards personal and societal development in our region. We act as intermediary between youth and organizations working for the greater development - at all levels - in the Arab world. The ADI is a non-profit organization that is not affiliated with any political group, ideology, or religion. In our past activities, we hosted two Envision Arabia Summits (EAS), respectively in Montreal (2011) and New York City (2012), and we brought together over 800 participants from all parts of the world and all walks of life in a physical and intellectual space that generated concrete and impactful action in the MENA region.
This year, on May 16-18,  ADI will be hosting its third - dubbed EAS14 -  in Montreal. The Summit will bring together hundreds of youth for a weekend of inspirational talks, engaging discussions, and meaningful action. We are very thrilled to see each one of you!
The Summit focuses on producing a vision for the future of the Arab world. Over 400 youth delegates will bring their knowledge, experience, and ideas to the table as they envision the future in six sectors:Economic Development, Science and Technology, Health and Well-being, Society and Culture, Law and Human Rights, and Education - and what an ambition plan this is! 
With the growing demand for energetic and change-making platforms, EAS14 is the ultimate forum for youth to tackle the issues at the core of development in the Arab world. Join us and play a part in this journey - you contributions will be a generous support and encouragement to help ADI grow!
 What are you waiting for? Join the movement and be a change-maker!

story:
Hola!

Mi nombre es Carlos Gomez, soy Pastor de jovenes aquí en Lima, Perú.  Comence trabajando en mi iglesia local "Ministerio Dios es Fiel" el año pasado cuando fue inagurada y siempre sentí una carga grande por los niños de esta comunidad y por los jovenes también.  Esta Navidad, queremos brindarles una sonrisa a los niños de nuestra comunidad; estos niños ya desde los 7 años estan trabajando en el mercado local ayudando a sus padres, muchos de ellos viven con padres solteros.  Queremos cambiar su realidad, como iglesia, queremos brindarles una sonrisa con TU ayuda.  Por favor ayudanos a cumplir nuestro sueño de darle a estos niños una verdadera Navidad. 


NECESITO TU AYUDA!

Este 21 de Diciembre del 2013, planeamos hacer una fiesta para todos los niños ( entrega de regalos + cena navideña + show infantil )  esperamos una asistencia de más de 100 niños de nuestra comunidad y con TU ayuda esto se hará realidad!


LA REALIDAD

Muchos de estos niños no celebran Navidad asi como tú y yo la celebramos.  Es una bendición tener alimento y estar con los seres queridos, ayudanos a brindar familias juntas en esta Navidad y darle esa sonrisa a los niños. 


Anteriormente hicimos una campaña de Utiles Escolares y fue todo un éxito!  Niños se fueron felices y las madres nos agredecieron mucho porque se llevaron cuadernos, mochilas, y muchos útiles escolares.


Otra forma de ayudarnos

Si es que no pudieras ayudarnos economicamente, te pido por favor que compartas esta campaña con tus amigos, hasta con tu jefe y podamos juntos hacer algo diferente en esta Navidad, dar un poco de lo mucho que Dios nos ha regalado este año. 

Muchas gracias por tu tiempo, que Dios te bendiga y a tu familia siempre.

story:
Change the way people create business!

I hear about people coming up with new ideas for making money all of the time.  Some people tell me they have a great way of making video production easier.  Some people tell me they have a green data centre idea and some have even attempted to create a new cell phone that looks like a women’s cosmetic case.  These ideas have been developed within big business and small business.  It does not really matter how much money or talent you think you have.  If the idea does not address the needs of customers the idea will not be a good one.

My name is Chris Pinter, I am an Engineering Consultant and I have worked with companies such as Microsoft, Veriteq Instruments, BCIT, several small manufacturers and non-profit organizations throughout Western Canada and the United States.  I help people develop technology and business strategies.

I have found a lot of people with unrealistic dreams and little understanding about their customers.  I want innovators to stop dreaming so much and start talking to customers at an earlier stage before they spend a lot of money.

My consulting company, Pinter Electronics Consultants, has been working on the Thornybeast since 2010 when we identified a need for a tool to help organize internal projects but found that too many clients were getting stuck in their concept and focused on their technology.  Building new technology is hard and developers need to create something innovative.  Because of this engineers, software programs and inventors tend to focus on what is within their vision and what can be fixed.  The goal is often to complete development before talking to anyone.  As a result, customer needs have far too often become secondary to the needs of completing development.  I saw that too many clients appeared to be working in a cave far too often.   So we expanded the tools we were developing to focus on these market issues.




Complete software development and marketing material

With your contribution we can complete a number of software issues and add a couple of needed features identified during beta testing.  We will also be able to complete the marketing, branding and online promotional strategies. 

We developed the website using Drupal 7.  However, we had to create a number of custom modules because of the unique tool requirements of the system.  These modules need to be tested and additional modules created. 


Tasks we need to do.

Your contribution will help with the following:

·  Complete software development of critical features,

·  Finish the branding and marketing strategies,

·  Help pay for outside developers to finish software, SEO, and scalability testing.




What We Need & What You Get

We need $15,000 to complete the development and testing of the website.  How we will spend your contribution is as follows.

·  35% is for software, bug fixes and new features ($5,250)

·  35% is for marketing material, branding and images ($5,250)

·  26% goes to your perks ($3,900)

·  4% goes to Indiegogo  ($600)

The budget is tight and we will be using off-shore talent to complete the tasks.  If we do not raise the entire goal we will need to cut back on what we can accomplish.  So please help reach our goal of $15,000!










The Impact

The Thornybeast is a platform to help entrepreneurs, small business owners and corporations develop better products focused on real world needs; NOT guesses as to what people will buy or what consumers can be forced to buy.

This is a platform where people can make a difference in how products are created and also provides a safe environment for doing market research…… Just in case you were afraid of market research.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you are strapped for cash but would still like to contribute here are some ideas….

Please give $15  - If everyone gave $15 that would help show participation and will encourage others to give.  If all of my friends and colleagues give $15, we would be half way there.

Developers and Software Gurus -  Drupal 7 is a breed apart from other software packages.  If you know and love it I could use your help.

Marketers needed! - Digital marketing, SEO, ad-words and social media are king.  I need many online marketers to help.

SPREAD THE WORD!  The more people who are aware of this funding project the better.  Use the Indiegogo share tools to tell others!

                                                               ---- #  #  #  ------
                                                                   PERKS
                                                         DATE OF DELIVERY
NOTE:  We want to make sure you get the best value for your contribution so we will finish software development before we release the perks.  That is why we estimate a delivery date sometime in April.

story:
In a Nutshell

Hey there! I'm Naomi Figueroa, a wife, photographer, traveler, lifelong learner, and lover of Latin America. I grew up in Maine, live in Pennsylvania, and love traveling to Latin America whenever I can. 

Almost exactly 10 years after I first traveled to the island of Cuba, I’m so eager to be returning. I have been accepted to travel with a Witness for Peace delegation (basically, an educational trip--I’m such a nerd!) from September 14-24, 2014.

In addition to building bridges of solidarity between the Cuban and American people, this trip will be a great opportunity for me to further my education in a hands-on way and provide experience for me that will contribute to my long-term vocational goals. And as a photographer for the team, I’ll be documenting the entire trip as our group travels and learns together.

I'm inviting all of you to come along for the ride! Whether you know all about Cuba's history, or whether you just know about Fidel Castro, get an inside look at the island and people of Cuba as I share my reflections and photographs along the way. 


Some donations have been received in person. Final Update 8/8/14


More Details

I traveled to Latin America for the first time when I was just barely in high school (16 years ago--but that’s just between you and me!). Although I was barely able to communicate with the little Spanish that I knew, there was something deeper that drew my heart and connected me to the Latin American people that I met.


Since then, I’ve had some amazing opportunities to work, study, share the love of God, photograph, and travel throughout Latin America. I’ve learned much more Spanish, met a lot of wonderful people, and contemplated the difficulties and complex problems that my friends in those countries face. One thing has remained and only grown deeper over that time: my love and passion for the people of Latin America.

I'm very excited to be joining with others on this Witness for Peace delegation as we explore and seek to learn more about Cuba.

Witness for Peace is a politically independent grassroots organization committed to nonviolence.  Since 1983 they have worked to support peace, justice, and sustainable economies in Latin America and the Caribbean by changing U.S. policies and corporate practices that contribute to poverty and oppression.


What Will I Be Doing?

One of the most important things that Witness for Peace does to educate people in the US about Latin America is to organize travel delegations. During the delegation to Cuba, our group will visit schools at all levels to meet with Cuban citizens, scholars, musicians, and members of organizations to understand how Cuba’s history has shaped modern life for Cubans. We will also meet people in the countryside to learn about what they are experiencing, to document the impact of current US policies there, and to report our perspectives to the U.S. Interests Sections Office in Havana. 


The Impact

Since the Cuban Revolution more than 50 years ago, Cubans and US citizens have been separated by various policies enacted by our governments. 

Cuba is only 90 miles away from Florida, and yet there is so much distance between our countries and our citizens. I believe that the more we can connect at a grassroots level, the more we can learn about each other and understand how we can move forward into more peaceful relations.


What I Need & How You Can Help

In order for me to be able to go, I'm asking for the help of my friends, family, and community (or benevolent strangers!). If you are someone who likes this project and has the means to contribute, it would mean so much to me to be to have your support. Every gift helps--even if it's only $1! 

Can you help me reach my goal? 

  • In order to participate in this trip, I need to raise about $2,200 by August 10, 2014.  
  • These funds will cover travel to and from Cuba, as well as all in-country costs.  Trip costs = $1755  Flight from Miami to Cuba = $450 Flight from my hometown to Miami will be covered by my frequent flier miles. I've already paid $150 toward the deposit with excess funds raised from my humanitarian photography trip to Guatemala in 2012, but I have left the funding goal at $2200 to cover fees and perks for this site. 
  • If I raise more than enough funds, they will be set aside to fund future humanitarian photography trips and service opportunities.


    Other Ways You Can Help

    I know that not everyone can give, but I sincerely, from the bottom of my heart, genuinely, appreciate your support in other ways:

    • I would love, love, love it if you would share this campaign with your friends, family, and social network. You can easily share this page on facebook, twitter, or email by clicking one of the share buttons below the video or just copying and pasting the link.
    • Keep me in your prayers! I want to sharpen my Spanish, be able to connect and build relationships, learn, and stay safe!

    Thank you so much for taking the time to read all this info! Your support and encouragement means so much, and I'm so excited to have the blessing and honor of being able to go and serve using my unique gifts!


    Check out more about the photography here !


    Check out all the Facts and FAQ's here !

story:
My name is Angela, I am an Aussie currently living in Mexico for a year. I want to raise money for two very sweet Mexican children I know to go to school (well child and teenager to be politically correct).

Teresa is 14 and has been out of school for two years. Her parents were simply unable to pay the school fees, uniform, materials, transport etc and all the costs that come with school. Teresa wants to be a teacher one day.

Juan Pablo, 6 received a scholarship last year to go to school, he loves school, but was unable to get a scholarship this year and their parents have been unable to pay school fees and all the extra school costs.

Because Teresa has missed two years of school she can't go to her local secondary school, but we have found a remedial open secondary school in the city, run the the local government, which is free (yay). The school is called CROC Secondary. I went with her Mother to get her enrolled and the school looks awesome and Teresa is super excited.
 
Juan Pablo will be going to his local public school, Patria Nueva Primaria. 

Inspired by the world of Mother Teresa, “If you can't feed a hundred people, then just feed one.” I am going to try to help this beautiful family to send heir children to school. While I would love to get every single child in Mexico (let alone a 100) off the streets and into school and I focusing and helping these two children very close to my heart. 

I meet their Mother sweet Lupita or Lupita Princessita as I call her, in 2008 on my first visit to Mexico. Lupita works as a maid and gets paid anywhere from $150 - $200pesos ($10.35 - $13.80) for a 10 hour day. Obviously when she is sick or the kids there is no sick pay, no holiday pay, no medical insurance etc. You get the picture. 
 
Teresa's school Croc Secondary has free dress there is no uniform and thus I wanted to make sure she had some new clothes to start school feeling confidant. As clothes here in Mexico are very expensive and cost the same as they do in the US, Teresa and Juan get new clothes once in a blue moon and almost all of her clothes and her shoes are all second hand. We now how self-esteems effects how well you do at school, so let's give her a self esteem a big boost. 

Education makes the difference of a lifetime, especially here in Mexico. 

 
Here are a few lines from a Unicef article and an article I read from Reuters re children out of school.
http://in.reuters.com/article/2010/02/18/us-mexico-dropouts-idINTRE61H4YL20100218
 
 "We know that a lot of children drop out of school because of poverty... because they have to work," says UNICEF Mexico child protection officer Theresa Kilbane. 

Mexico has historically had high drop-out rates as poor families pull kids out of school to help put food on the table, and children often sell candy and crafts in the streets or work in restaurants.

While more than 90 percent of Mexico is literate because almost all kids go to primary school, about 17 million Mexicans who should be in middle school are not.

 

*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*

 

 
The money raised for this cause will be used as follows:
 
500 pesos   - US $35 - Juan Pablo's annual school fee
2000 pesos - US $138 - Juan Pablo's new uniform, shoes, school bag&lunch box
3000 pesos - US $206 - Two new outfits for Teresa for school and two pairs of shoes so she starts school feeling like a gem and not dressed in rags (second hand everything)
4550 pesos - US $313 Bus money for the year for Teresa (Juan Pablo walks to his local school)
2000 pesos - US $138 School materials and books for Juan and Teresa 
 
Grand whopping total towards school essentials =  38050pesos - US $830

+ $300 to pay for all the awesome perks to say thanks to you guys for sending them to school (and for postage which is ridiculously expensive here in Mexico)

+ $80 to cover indiegogo fees 

Campaign Total of US $1210
 

We can do it. "Yes we can!"

 

Perks of Total Awesomeness will include:

$5 - because giving US $5 is like 72.5 pesos which is like totally spanking awesome. Thank you! Cosmic hug coming your way!
 
$15 - because giving US $15 is like 217.50 pesos. BOOM. That is a lot of money. That is like money magic. Cosmic high five!
 
$20 Spectacular fridge magnet saying 'Thank you for sending Juan Pablo and Teresa to school' with their sweet photo on it.
 
$30 A sweet spanish poem written by Juan Pablo especially for you with an english translation and a Spectacular Thank You fridge magnet
 
$50 A sweet spanish poem from Teresa written for you specifically with an english translation and a Spectacular Thank You fridge magnet

$100 A small hand knitted bag (could be used to carry your cell phone), knitted by Juan and Teresa's grandmother. Talk about authentic Mexicano man AND a hand written poem AND Spectacular Thank You fridge magnet. What a deal!

$200 A painting by Juan Pablo, a small hand knitted bag (could be used to carry your cell phone), knitted by Juan and Teresa's grandmother. Talk about authentic Mexicano man AND a hand written poem AND Spectacular Thank You fridge magnet. Holy Guacamole!

$300 A painting by Teresa, a small hand knitted bag (could be used to carry your cell phone), knitted by Juan and Teresa's grandmother. Talk about authentic Mexicano man AND a hand written poem AND Spectacular Thank You fridge magnet. Out of this world amazing!

$500 A portrait of your beautiful face, painted with the very hands of Juan Pablo (6) AND the beautiful hands of Teresa (14), two small hand knitted bag (could be used to carry your cell phone), knitted by Juan and Teresa's grandmother. Talk about authentic Mexicano man AND a hand written poem written by Teresa AND a hand written poem by Juan Pablo especially for you AND 2 Spectacular Thank You fridge magnets. Magnific!

$1000 A children's book written about you. Yeap, that's right. Totally spanking awesome. A book. About you and your awesomeness and all of thee above.

 

Note extra dollars :) :D 

With lunch meals here averaging US$4 a day for 45 school weeks of the year (it would be around 26000 pesos - US $1800 to cover school lunch money for the year for Juan and Teresa). I really wanted to add this in to help out the family, but being realistic I didn't want to double the campaign budget. However I know this is hard for them and they struggle in this area too (it is hard for our family and my husband is an engineer!) so any money raised above the campaign total will go towards helping the family with lunch money and food in general. Bring it on! Teresa also wants a laptop which would be really cool. 
 

Remember you are not just helping Juan and Teresa, you are their future success, their future children, grandchildren and all their friends and family inspired by their achievements, accomplishments and seeing them go far in life. 

And if Teresa one day becomes a teacher as she dreams to do, you will have been apart of making that dream come true. I passionately believe she will be able to reach out and inspire those children struggling to get through school.. through the very same experience she has had.  

 

 Other Ways You Can Help and Be Totally Awesome

If you can't give any ch-ching please send this cause far and wide. FB, tweet, email, whatever tickles your fancy. Send it onwards and outwards and upwards into the virtual world so that it may reach every set of hands and eyes that it is meant to. :)

Thank you! Thank you! Thank you and Gracias muchisimo!

 

Helping one child at a time :)
story_txt:
My name is Angela, I am an Aussie currently living in Mexico for a year. I want to raise money for two very sweet Mexican children I know to go to school (well child and teenager to be politically correct).



Teresa is 14 and has been out of school for two years. Her parents were simply unable to pay the school fees, uniform, materials, transport etc and all the costs that come with school. Teresa wants to be a teacher one day. 
Juan Pablo, 6 received a scholarship last year to go to school, he loves school, but was unable to get a scholarship this year and their parents have been unable to pay school fees and all the extra school costs.

Because Teresa has missed two years of school she can't go to her local secondary school, but we have found a remedial open secondary school in the city, run the the local government, which is free (yay). The school is called CROC Secondary. I went with her Mother to get her enrolled and the school looks awesome and Teresa is super excited.
 
Juan Pablo will be going to his local public school, Patria Nueva Primaria. 


Inspired by the world of Mother Teresa, “If you can't feed a hundred people, then just feed one.” I am going to try to help this beautiful family to send heir children to school. While I would love to get every single child in Mexico (let alone a 100) off the streets and into school and I focusing and helping these two children very close to my heart. 

I meet their Mother sweet Lupita or Lupita Princessita as I call her, in 2008 on my first visit to Mexico. Lupita works as a maid and gets paid anywhere from $150 - $200pesos ($10.35 - $13.80) for a 10 hour day. Obviously when she is sick or the kids there is no sick pay, no holiday pay, no medical insurance etc. You get the picture. 

 
Teresa's school Croc Secondary has free dress there is no uniform and thus I wanted to make sure she had some new clothes to start school feeling confidant. As clothes here in Mexico are very expensive and cost the same as they do in the US, Teresa and Juan get new clothes once in a blue moon and almost all of her clothes and her shoes are all second hand. We now how self-esteems effects how well you do at school, so let's give her a self esteem a big boost. 


Education makes the difference of a lifetime, especially here in Mexico. 

 
Here are a few lines from a Unicef article and an article I read from Reuters re children out of school.
http://in.reuters.com/article/2010/02/18/us-mexico-dropouts-idINTRE61H4YL20100218
 
 "We know that a lot of children drop out of school because of poverty... because they have to work," says UNICEF Mexico child protection officer Theresa Kilbane. 

Mexico has historically had high drop-out rates as poor families pull kids out of school to help put food on the table, and children often sell candy and crafts in the streets or work in restaurants.
While more than 90 percent of Mexico is literate because almost all kids go to primary school, about 17 million Mexicans who should be in middle school are not.
 





*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*-*
 

 
The money raised for this cause will be used as follows:
 
500 pesos   - US $35 - Juan Pablo's annual school fee
2000 pesos - US $138 - Juan Pablo's new uniform, shoes, school bag&lunch box
3000 pesos - US $206 - Two new outfits for Teresa for school and two pairs of shoes so she starts school feeling like a gem and not dressed in rags (second hand everything)
4550 pesos - US $313 Bus money for the year for Teresa (Juan Pablo walks to his local school)
2000 pesos - US $138 School materials and books for Juan and Teresa 
 
Grand whopping total towards school essentials =  38050pesos - US $830

+ $300 to pay for all the awesome perks to say thanks to you guys for sending them to school (and for postage which is ridiculously expensive here in Mexico)
+ $80 to cover indiegogo fees 

Campaign Total of US $1210
 

We can do it. "Yes we can!"

 

Perks of Total Awesomeness will include:

$5 - because giving US $5 is like 72.5 pesos which is like totally spanking awesome. Thank you! Cosmic hug coming your way!
 
$15 - because giving US $15 is like 217.50 pesos. BOOM. That is a lot of money. That is like money magic. Cosmic high five!
 
$20 Spectacular fridge magnet saying 'Thank you for sending Juan Pablo and Teresa to school' with their sweet photo on it.
 
$30 A sweet spanish poem written by Juan Pablo especially for you with an english translation and a Spectacular Thank You fridge magnet
 
$50 A sweet spanish poem from Teresa written for you specifically with an english translation and a Spectacular Thank You fridge magnet

$100 A small hand knitted bag (could be used to carry your cell phone), knitted by Juan and Teresa's grandmother. Talk about authentic Mexicano man AND a hand written poem AND Spectacular Thank You fridge magnet. What a deal!


$200 A painting by Juan Pablo, a small hand knitted bag (could be used to carry your cell phone), knitted by Juan and Teresa's grandmother. Talk about authentic Mexicano man AND a hand written poem AND Spectacular Thank You fridge magnet. Holy Guacamole!
$300 A painting by Teresa, a small hand knitted bag (could be used to carry your cell phone), knitted by Juan and Teresa's grandmother. Talk about authentic Mexicano man AND a hand written poem AND Spectacular Thank You fridge magnet. Out of this world amazing!
$500 A portrait of your beautiful face, painted with the very hands of Juan Pablo (6) AND the beautiful hands of Teresa (14), two small hand knitted bag (could be used to carry your cell phone), knitted by Juan and Teresa's grandmother. Talk about authentic Mexicano man AND a hand written poem written by Teresa AND a hand written poem by Juan Pablo especially for you AND 2 Spectacular Thank You fridge magnets. Magnific!
$1000 A children's book written about you. Yeap, that's right. Totally spanking awesome. A book. About you and your awesomeness and all of thee above.
 
Note extra dollars :) :D 


With lunch meals here averaging US$4 a day for 45 school weeks of the year (it would be around 26000 pesos - US $1800 to cover school lunch money for the year for Juan and Teresa). I really wanted to add this in to help out the family, but being realistic I didn't want to double the campaign budget. However I know this is hard for them and they struggle in this area too (it is hard for our family and my husband is an engineer!) so any money raised above the campaign total will go towards helping the family with lunch money and food in general. Bring it on! Teresa also wants a laptop which would be really cool. 
 
Remember you are not just helping Juan and Teresa, you are their future success, their future children, grandchildren and all their friends and family inspired by their achievements, accomplishments and seeing them go far in life. 
And if Teresa one day becomes a teacher as she dreams to do, you will have been apart of making that dream come true. I passionately believe she will be able to reach out and inspire those children struggling to get through school.. through the very same experience she has had.  
 
 Other Ways You Can Help and Be Totally Awesome


If you can't give any ch-ching please send this cause far and wide. FB, tweet, email, whatever tickles your fancy. Send it onwards and outwards and upwards into the virtual world so that it may reach every set of hands and eyes that it is meant to. :)
Thank you! Thank you! Thank you and Gracias muchisimo!
 
Helping one child at a time :)

story:
About Me

My name is Sam and I am a 28-year-old cancer survivor. I was diagnosed with thyroid cancer at the age of 18. As a young adult survivor, I found cancer & nutrition resources hard to come by and support groups hard to relate to.  Those resources I did find I still look to and utilize today, ten years later.  

What Do I Want To Accomplish?

I want to participate in a culinary nutrition certification.  My big end goal is to use what I learn to help cancer survivors and their families introduce more whole foods into their diets to help heal their bodies (and prevent future disease).  I want to break things down as simply as I can and give these individual easy and meaningful ways they can make changes when it comes to nutrition.

Why?

Cancer survivors are often named as one of the most motivated groups when it comes to taking charge of their health and being their own healthcare advocates - during and after treatment.  We are likely to seek out more alternative treatments (whole food nutrition, acupuncture, herbal medicine, etc.) to add to our treatment plans. Over the last 10 years, I've thrown myself into research and done my best to find my way through the maze that is cancer diagnosis and treatment. Not to mention the big question marks surrounding life AFTER cancer. Finding resources and support from people you can connect with and relate to can be overwhelming. I want to help make that process easier.  This month I am celebrating 6 years cancer-free. What better way to celebrate than to pay it forward to other cancer survivors? 

The Impact

A cancer diagnosis, treatment plans and our healthcare system are difficult enough to navigate.  By the time a survivor makes it to the grocery or health food store they may feel completely overwhelmed.  I want donate my time and knowledge to help these individuals make whole food choices that will work with lifestyles and help them heal their bodies.  I hope to work with local cancer support organizations to help reach survivors and their families.  I would LOVE to donate some of my time to work locally with individuals, in workshop settings, and maybe even take things to Skype to reach those outside of the Baltimore area. No cost to them.

About The Certification

The program is offered by Meghan Telpner, a Toronto-based nutritionist and author.  She has been an invaluable resource and teacher in my cancer journey and I want to continue my education under her leadership and guidance. The certification involves over 200 hours of training over 12 weeks, starting in September 2013. It includes:

  • Lecture & real-time instructional workshops focused on creating meal plans & recipes, foods for healing, eating for energy, blending & juicing, elixirs & herbal medicines, gluten-free diets, fermentation, knife skills, living/raw food, cooking for kids, and natural beauty care (among other topics).
  • Home study/practice focusing on developing meal plans in accordance with certain dietary restrictions, recipe development & testing, client simulations, and hosting cooking classes/workshops.
  • Independent research & required reading.
  • Community & practical skills development: attending and volunteering at community food related events/lectures, 20 co-op hours working with food-related organizations.

What I Need To Reach My Goal

  • $2,200 Tuition
  • $400 Books & kitchen supplies
  • $300 Ingredients for recipe testing & creation

TOTAL: $2,900

If I Am Lucky Enough To Surpass My Goal

The $2,900 is the bare minimum I will need to participate in this program. If we happen to go above and beyond the goal (EEEEEEE!), any additional funds will be spent in the following ways:

  • Indiegogo and Paypal campaign fees (est. $200).
  • Printing & Shipping of all perks (est. $400).
  • The purchase of ingredients and supplies to be used in group workshops and one-on-one culinary nutrition sessions with cancer survivors. No cost to them.

What You Get (THE PERKS)!

  • 4"x6" Personalized thank you postcard.  Full color & printed on 15pt card stock. Personalized with a message from moi!  Illustration by Bryan Prindiville.
  • PDF of my favorite juice & smoothie recipes. 15 recipes total, delivered via e-mail.  To view the PDF file, make sure you have Adobe Reader.
  • 4"x6" Recipe card packs featuring the blueberry and brussel sprout illustrations. Full color & professionally printed on 15pt card stock.  Fruit & veggie illustrations by Michael Bracco, illustration of me by Bryan Prindiville, graphic design by Hannah-Love Shibley. See Media Gallery tab for more detailed images.

  • Exclusive 5"x7" prints of fruit, veggie and knife illustrations by Michael Bracco. Choose from blueberries, brussel sprouts, knife, asparagus or strawberry. Full color illustrations, printed on Epson Ultra Premium Presentation Paper (matte & smooth) using archival inks tested to last 100+ years.  I will contact you after the campaign ends to determine which print you've chosen.

 

  • Original artwork by Michael Bracco. Black ink on paper - image size 5"x7"; paper size 6"x9". *Note: These are the original ink drawings, before digital color. Black ink on white paper.*
  • Combo packs of the above - see the right side of the page for more details.

Credits (THANK YOU)!

  • Fruit, veggie & utensil illustrations: Michael Bracco
  • Red-headed chef illustrations: Bryan Prindiville
  • Recipe card graphic design:  Hannah-Love Shibley
  • Camera work & video editing: Marty Day
  • Font used in campaign materials: KB So Thinteresting & KB So Thinteresting Bold by Khrys Bosland
  • Campaign video song: Clip from Sentiment d'amour (Feeling Love) by Syenta

Exclusive 5"x7" prints of fruit, veggie and knife illustrations by Michael Bracco. Original artwork by Michael Bracco. Black ink on paper - image size 5"x7"; paper size 6"x9". *Note: These are the original ink drawings, before digital color. Black ink on white paper.*
Combo packs of the above - see the right side of the page for more details.

story:
UPDATE February 1, 2013:  Thank you to everyone who contributed to our campaign--whether you made a donation or liked it or shared it with your friends and families.  We are so appreciative.  Along with other donations that came in offline, we are almost ready to start our second cohort!

 
 
 
Help us launch an urban training farm in Addis Ababa, Ethiopia for disconnected youth!

Ethiopia is home to one of the largest youth populations in Africa, yet more than 75% of Ethiopian youth have never been to school. As young people grow older and enter the workforce, they lack the skills to ensure secure and promising work—making them vulnerable to poverty and other hardships.
 
Our team, most of whom are originally from Ethiopia, is building a novel stepping stone to self-sufficiency and financial independence for young people with few opportunities.
 
We chose urban agriculture as a career track in close consultation with local officials; the training program will also empower youth to contribute to their communities by increasing local food security. 
 
We are happy to report that this fall our first cohort of young people, all of whom were neither in school nor working, completed the training program. There are photos in the gallery above. See more photos and updates on Facebook ("Progress Educational") or www.progresseducation.org.
 
Eventually we plan to adapt the idea to new occupations and new locations after we refine and improve the program in Addis Ababa. With your help, through this campaign we will be able to run a second program early next year, hiring instructors and further building out our training farm.
 
Our target for this campaign is to raise $4,325. Your contribution will go directly to the following expenses:
•    Instructors for second program in spring 2013: $1,150
•    Manuals and other materials for classroom lessons: $300
•    Materials for practical training including new chicken coop: $1,300
•    Training farm rent and maintenance for 6 months: $1,575

If we are fortunate to raise above our target, we will be able to offer small start-up grants as "seed capital" to help participants launch new enterprises.
 
Thank you in advance for your support and generosity!
 
Sisay Zemedkun, Adolf Berhane, Sandy Blanchette, Gizelle Gopez, Noel Jowk, Aklilu Shewangizaw, Tigabu Kassa & Tim Glynn-Burke
(PESI Board of Directors and Advisors)


 
Help us get the word out about our campaign. Indiegogo's share tools make it easy!

story:
Campaign Summary

I am 17 years old and it has long been my dream to travel to Paris as my mother did at my age. This June I will graduate from high school. From that point on, I will need to work during the summers to pay for college, and will have no time to travel.

My hope is to spend one week to 10 days in Paris over spring break. This may be my only chance to visit an elderly family friend who is a cultural icon in Paris and has offered me a place to stay, free of charge. Also, through alumni contacts, I will be able to start building connections within the French film industry to further my intended career in cinematography. And what better place than Paris to hone my photography skills!

I have been raised to value all cultures and have classmates from around the world. Traveling independently to other countries is the most effective way to forge bonds between people of different nationalities and appreciate the world we live in.

Your help in making this journey to Paris possible would give me the finest ending to high school I could wish for.

Other Ways You Can Help

I would also greatly appreciate any connections you could help me make with people in the Paris region.

Perks For Your Contribution

For a $25 donation, I will send you a post card from Paris telling you a bit about what I have done. Yes, post cards do still exist.

For a donation of $50 or more, you will receive an original photograph of the breathtaking Parisian skyline.
