story:
Introduction 

Crawford Adventist Academy (CAA) boasts a rich, long standing history dating back to the 1950’s when it was first established as Toronto Junior Academy. Created by the faithful members of the Willowdale Seventh-day Adventist Church as an elementary school (Grades 1-6) in 1953, it was expanded into a larger facility a year later, thanks, in part to the generous donation of philanthropist, Dr. Erwin Crawford.

Operated by the Toronto Adventist District School Board, the corporate body formed in 1978, Crawford remains “Committed to Excellence in Christian Education”. 

As enrolment at Toronto Junior Academy (TJA) grew, the school was expanded to include Junior High School (Grades 7-8) and a High School Division in 1981. The new and improved school was renamed Crawford Adventist Academy in honour of Dr. Erwin Crawford.

With a 98% university acceptance rate, Crawford Adventist Academy (CAA) continues to produce exceptional graduates who go on to pursue post-secondary courses of study and become accomplished professionals.

Our Need

A study commissioned by Crawford in 2007 highlights many of the deficiencies that continue to make teaching and learning more challenging for students and staff. The study, conducted by engineering firm, Kleinfeldt Consultants Limited, noted that “the building is generally at or over-capacity in terms of storage space, class size and parking”.

Structural Problems

  • Supply and return air ventilation system needs to be upgraded
  • Plumbing system is aged and needs a complete overhaul
  • Roof is constantly leaking
  • Heating system is deficient, constantly breaking down and continuously being serviced

Our Goal 

Our goal is to build a state of the art facility to service our students, faculty, parents and community.  

The Impact

A new facility would bring added value to our school and the community at large:

  • Our new facility will be wheel-chair accessible
  • A state-of-the-art learning centre for learning-disabled children
  • Larger gyms to accommodate the separation of student age groups and wider community usage
  • Dedicated weight room which will be accessible to the community
  • Larger classrooms for greater comfort and to accommodate a wider range of engaging activities
  • Dedicated auditorium which will be open to the community for concerts and live theatre
  • Multipurpose break-out rooms for use by community groups and before/after school programs
  • Onsite cafeteria to serve nutritious, hot meals
  • Larger hallways for efficient student traffic flow and to allow for safe access to student lockers
  • Complete separation of Elementary/ Junior High and High School
  • Increased parking with improved lighting for the safety of the community
  • Eliminate our deficiencies and increase enrolment

Job Creation

Creation of over 200 jobs in all areas of general construction, skilled-trades such as plumbing, electrical and landscaping trades and building maintenance; creation of additional positions for faculty and support staff, technology personnel and building maintenance.

Other Ways You Can Help

There are many ways you can support the 'Catch the Vision' initiative.  In addition to giving through our Indiegogo platform, you can also gift towards the new school project via cash/cheque, saleable goods, in-kind services, professional services, land & real estate, life insurance or Planned Giving through Estate/Will.  

Please share our New Crawford Adventist Academy Building Project initiative with your family and friends.  You can utilize the Indiegogo share tools to link our campaign to Facebook and Twitter.  

We are always looking for volunteers to help us with events and initiatives!  If you are interested in sharing your time, please contact Derrick Hall, VP of Advancement, TADSB at (416) 633-0090 or toll-free 1.866.960.2125 ext. 234; dhall@tadsb.com.  

Visit our official website www.tadsb.com  Follow us on Twitter:  @TADSBVision Like us on Facebook www.facebook.com/TADSB

Thank you for your continued support and prayers for the TADSB.

There are many ways you can support the 'Catch the Vision' initiative.  In addition to giving through our Indiegogo platform, you can also gift towards the new school project via cash/cheque, saleable goods, in-kind services, professional services, land & real estate, life insurance or Planned Giving through Estate/Will.  
Please share our New Crawford Adventist Academy Building Project initiative with your family and friends.  You can utilize the Indiegogo share tools to link our campaign to Facebook and Twitter.  
We are always looking for volunteers to help us with events and initiatives!  If you are interested in sharing your time, please contact Derrick Hall, VP of Advancement, TADSB at (416) 633-0090 or toll-free 1.866.960.2125 ext. 234; dhall@tadsb.com.  
Visit our official website www.tadsb.com  Follow us on Twitter:  @TADSBVision Like us on Facebook www.facebook.com/TADSB
Thank you for your continued support and prayers for the TADSB.

story:
Art Powers Arusha Empowerment through the Performing Arts

Art Powers Arusha (formerly the Arusha Arts Initiative) is a group of performing artists who are training or who have trained at the Juilliard School in New York City. Founded in 2009, the project has traveled to Arusha, Tanzania four times to conduct workshops in music, dance, and drama with disadvantaged youth at several schools and NGOs in the community. Our arts camps have become an essential part of these schools' curricula as the major arts project of the school year.

This year, we are planning to return to Tanzania to run our sixth series of workshops with our partner organizations. The schools we plan to visit this year include the Umoja Youth Empowerment Center (an NGO helping teens and young adults develop the skills to get back in school or to find employment), Meru View (a primary school for children ages 4-7), St. Dymphna's (a special needs school) and International School Moshi (a culturally-diverse K-12 boarding school).

We believe in the power of change through the arts. Arts education encourages creative thinking while developing skills necessary for independent and collaborative work. Our workshops offer the opportunity for our students to conceptualize the learning process in a new way that stretches the limits of their personal risk-taking. Our program strives to develop communication, problem solving and teamwork skills needed in everyday vocational life that will remain with our students long after our departure.

Our mission is to empower our students through teaching the performing arts. We believe our students are the future of Tanzania, and we strive to use the arts as a vehicle to help them understand their individuality, their power and their full potential. This empowerment will enable our students to initiate creative and positive change within their community. We aim to engage in a cultural exchange as we share what we know about dance, drama and music.

2013 Team

Hannah Ross, viola (co-director) her@juilliard.edu

Chelsea Feltman, voice (co-director) chelsea.feltman@gmail.com

Kyle Weiler (Dance) Francesca Carpanini (Drama), Kate Eastman (Drama), John Bambery (Drama)

Support

Your donation to this IndieGoGo campain will pay for 6 visas and vaccinations for the 2014 team. 

Help us illustrate the power of change through the arts! Art Powers Arusha needs your help:

1) Help us spread awareness about our project! Tell a friend about Art Powers Arusha and start a conversation about the importance of the arts as a way to foster creativity and compassion in today's youth!

2) Provide us with guidance and connect us with people who can help us! If you have a great idea- we want to hear it! Please e-mail us at one of the addresses listed above. We look forward to hearing from you!

3) Donate today! Any amount is appreciated! 

The Field is a not-for-profit, tax-exempt, 501(c)(3) organization serving the New York City performing arts community. Contributions made to The Field and earmarked for “Art Powers Arusha” are tax deductible to the extent allowed by law. For more information about The Field contact: The Field, 161 Sixth Avenue, 14th Floor, New York NY 10013, (212) 691-6969, fax: (212) 255-2053,www.thefield.org. A copy of The Field’s latest annual report may be obtained, upon request, from The Field or from the Office of the Attorney General, Charities Bureau, 120 Broadway, New York, NY 10271.

story:
The above video describes the site and the Finger Lakes Permaculture Institute's teaching methods that our students at New Roots will benefit from in their high school permaculture course.


Summary

If your school offered a permaculture education class would you sign up?

Would you help a great high school offer one? 

There are very few opportunities for high school students to learn permaculture and ecological design. New Roots is a unique charter school in Ithaca, NY committed to social justice and sustainability education. Offering permaculture design education is written into the schools charter!

Students take regular New York State mandated classes plus a variety of electives to learn about their community, and how others are struggling to meet the challenges and problems of our times.

Every semester the entire student body takes a week away from their regular schedule and students select from a variety of "intensives." These four day elective classes allow students to learn and explore subjects that build their ability to advocate for themselves and others.

Last year New Roots Charter School offered its first permaculture course with Michael Burns, a social studies teacher at New Roots and a founder and instructor for the Finger Lakes Permaculture Institute. Twenty students came out to Cayuta Sun Farm,  Michael's permaculture-designed site and location of the Finger Lakes Permaculture Institute's annual design certification course. It was a huge success. Many of last year's seniors said it was one of the most significant classes of their entire time at in high school! 

However, demand for the course outstripped the budget for transportation costs needed to bring students to Cayuta Sun Farm. The school was able to cover lunch and staffing, but had to ask students to come up with a fee to pay for the bus. Many students and their families could not afford the sliding fee. Knowing that there is a large community of permaculture supporters out there, teacher Michael Burns is reaching out for help. 

The critical part of this year's plan is to meet our budget for transportation. We are asking the permaculture community to make many small donations to launch another amazing success story for permaculture education.

What We Need & What You Get

  • We need to raise $500 to pay for four days of school bus transportation to a permaculture farm almost 20 miles away from the school. Without the buses, the course may not run or only a small number of students with the means to pay could attend.
  • Supporters will receive personal thank you notes from students who attended. Large donations from supporters will yield an inoculated mushroom log made by students. 
  • 100% of the funds raised will be given to New Roots High School to cover the transportation costs. Should we exceed our goal, the extra funds will go to the school's Farm-to-School program and may be reserved for future permaculture classes at New Roots.

The Impact

The course has produced incredible results at such a low cost that most permaculture course organizers would be envious! Many of the students enrolled in this course have spent at least two years of studying sustainability in their electives and through their normal courses that follow an additional set of standards based on the Cloud Institute's "Education for Sustainability" curriculum. The impact of last year's course was remarkable because their teachers have been leading them to foundational knowledge that supports the permaculture curriculum in their science, math, social studies and literature classes. Many have taken electives on gardening, energy systems, watershed and foodshed analysis and others offered by the school's Farm-to-School program. When presented with permaculture principles and methods they were ready.  "Ah-hah" moments, sudden epiphanies, and a resulting enthusiasm for continued permaculture study and practice came easily to these students in just four short days. 

Sending these young adults out in to the workforce and colleges with a solid introduction to permaculture will have an incredible impact on their lives (and others.) In fact it already is and some of last year's graduates are coming back to volunteer for the class.

Your small donation is leveraging the combined experiences and qualities of New Roots Charter School and the Finger Lakes Permaculture Institute to create the next generation of permaculture practitioners and leaders!

You Can Help

Just ten or twenty dollars can make a difference. 

A fifty dollar donation covers the cost of two to three students. This is truly an affordable way to provide scholarship funds to teach permaculture.

After you make your donation (or even if you cannot contribute) share this campaign through email, Facebook, Twitter or other means. We are relying on the vast network of dedicated permaculture supporters to pull this off. Our fundraising goal is modest, yet we need you to spread the word! The more people you broadcast this appeal to (use the share tools found on this page), the greater our chances to bring the promise and potential of permaculture to young people.

As an alternative to our gift registry, we have set up this scholarship fund to raise money for a cause close to our hearts. Please feel free to provide any amount you are comfortable donating to this cause.

Aaron and I have been given several opportunities and support over the years from various friends and family. We are hoping to pay it forward to others who deserve the same consideration. 

We would love for you to help us make education a possibility for youth who deserve it. 

Thank you,

Delna and Aaron

story:
Our Story

Doosha Friends and Family. Most of you know my daughter Selena Finley, she is 13 years old and in seventh grade at Valley Middle School. She is an enrolled member of the Mandan, Hidatsa, Arikara Nation and a descendant of the Spirit Lake Dakota and Standing Rock Lakota through her maternal great-grandmother.She has been accepted to the People to People Ambassador Program! So what does this mean? She is one of only 3 students from Grand Forks that will be traveling to Europe for 20 days this summer. She will be representing her family, her country, and her people on this momentous journey. As some of you may know, Selena and I have opened our home to my sister's 5 children, who have been staying with us for just under a year. As you can imagine this has been a huge undertaking for our family and leaves us with little to spare at the end of each month. We are asking for your help on this endeavor, as many of you have impacted Selena's life in some way and have helpedto shape her into the wonderful young woman she has become and will continue to grow into.


The Impact

The People to People Ambassador Program has been sending students from America all over the world for almost 50 years. The delegation that Selena will be traveling to Europe for 20 days. While most of us may think "woo hoo, Euro Trip!" Selena's delegation will be participating in a very ambitious and vigorous schedule. Some of the things they will be doing include: Meeting a member of the Brittish Parliament in London, England; Visiting the Normandy American Cemetary and Memorial in Caen, France; taking in The Louvre art museum in Paris, France; taking in the city of Bruge, Belgium; biking through Amsterdam, Netherlands; cruising the Rhine River in Cologne, Germany; exploring castle ruins in Heidelberg, Germany; conducting a civil service project in the famous Black Forest of Freiburg, Germany; and riding the rapids of Inn River of Scuol, Switzerland. While Selena will be gaining a wealth of knowledge from this experience, she will also be sharing her knowledge with the many students she will be meeting on this trip. She has much to offer, especially her rich Native American heritage as she represents the Mandan, Hidatsa, and Lakota of North Dakota. This trip is truly a once in a lifetime opportunity for Selena and I feel that it will have a major impact on her world view, and her future life goals. This opportunity is one that I cannot offer to her alone and this is why it is important that we gain your support on this unique endeavor.

What We Need & What You Get

So here it is, in order for Selena to travel with the People to People Ambassador Program we need to raise a total of $6,899 minimum, that covers her flights, room and board, and insurance (just in case she gets sick or injured). This does not include: the passport fee, the luggage, supplies, or spending money, not to mention the trips to Fargo to attend the mandatory meetings with her delegation. Once we add those expenses in, we are looking at around $7,500. We have already put down a deposit and we are soliciting our tribe and local businesses for funding, but they are not guaranteed and we have not heard back yet from some of those sources. We anticipate being able to raise about $5,000 through those sources, but to be honest that has not been secured yet. This would leave us with at lest $2,500 to raise and that is our first goal through Indie GoGo. If this campaign is a sucess we will continue to raise money until she has to leave on the trip. I am also confident that we will be able to pull off at least two other fundraising events here in Grand Forks, so we will keep you posted.  


Other Ways You Can Help

We really want to get the word out, so please help us! We have created a facebook event page that we will keep updating as we progress and get ready to send Selena off. We would also like to have you email the link to this page to everyone you know, the more people the better! As we get any other media, we will make them available to you.

story:
About Us

The Senior Seminar is the new forefront of education. A way of making sure that education is no longer simply "fed" to students, but instead the students are allowed to learn on their own terms. 

"Everything about this course interest me. I'm really interested in that fact that it's very different from everything we've been doing in Hudson High School. Amazing experience that is expanding my mind. I'm interested in the connections of every subject, because everything is tied, right? The Seminar is be very fun and cool but challenging as well, and I want to be challenged. I want to start answering questions that need to be asked. I'm very interested in the projects that will take place and all those trips, especially the week long hiking trip!"

-Osvaldo Castillo

"I remember the first time I saw Steven Hawking, I wanted to learn everything about the universe and the meaning of life. I think this is a good start."

-Erik Rosas

"An open mind is an intelligent mind."

-Kevin Torres

"The Senior Seminar is a place where I can learn about the things that are not only necessary and important to learn, but the things are interesting to me, and allows me to learn more about myself."

-Magdaliza Santos


About our Campaign: 

We have spent our school year dealing with philosophical and practical issues: Who am I? What is friendship? College applications. What is randomness? Scholarship applications. What is the meaning of life? How do we make meaning? Grief sessions. How can we be in the world and challenge the systems at hand? Nutrition classes. How are ethics and food connected?

Now we are preparing to move on to the next stage of our lives. We have been purposeful about our plans after high school. We have been selective about the colleges we are going to attend, for we value being seen as a whole person and not just a number. We have sought out vocations and callings, not simply jobs and salaries.

This trip will be our final juncture in our year-long passage of self-knowledge. We wish to get out of our urban environment and purposefully make ourselves uncomfortable in the deserts of New Mexico.

In New Mexico, we will continue our explorations of self through yoga, psychology and art workshops, and daily conversations on topics that affect and matter to us - meaning, identity, work, friendship, humanity. We wish to prepare and serve meals side by side. We are not afraid of hard work and we wish to claim our right for true education -- Who are we? What do we have to offer to the world? How can we offer our gifts? What is the right way to offer our gifts?

Help us take our education in to our own hands. 

Where your funds go: 

  • $15000 Towards train tickets
  • $3000 Towards Camping and Rental
  • $2000 Towards home cooked meals
  • $1000 Towards Buses and Transportation
  • $1000 Towards Classes (Teachers, Supplies, etc.)

Risks and Challenges:

Our biggest risk is not being able to reach our goal. If this is the case, we have two options.

  1. To postpone our Trip to New Mexico for Early July.
  2. To go camping in Upstate New York Instead

Either way, your donations are going towards creating new life experiences, and building community for under-privileged students!

story:
The Fight of a Lifetime

On January 26th, ten fighters from Bas Rutten's Elite MMA Gym will put on an epic mixed martial arts show in Thousand Oaks: The Art of MMA! Before the fights though, we want to help a few members in our community who are fighting a completely different battle.

  • Alex Magdaleno, a personal trainer and avid marathon enthusiast, just recently started a new round of radiation therapy for paranasal sinus cancer, as well as continually battling chronic lymphoblastic leukemia. Members and staff at Elite worked and worked out with Alex, who gets out of bed and runs an "easy seven miles" when most of us would have thrown in the towel.
  • Tracey Baumann-Lilley is the mother of one of our very own fighters, Ryan Lilley. While many moms would worry about their son getting into a cage, she is Ryan's biggest fan. She was recently diagnosed with breast cancer, but has Ryan's fighting spirit, and will not be discouraged. She's faced her own fair share of struggles before, and since starting treatment in October, she has been facing chemotherapy like a true champion.

We want to show these two incredible individuals that no one ever fights cancer alone.

What We Need & What You Get

Even with the best health insurance, medical bills for cancer are insane! Our goal is to help Alex and Tracey lessen the financial burden they face:

  • We've set a modest goal of $3,000, since we don't have much time before the show.
  • Whatever money is raised will be split evenly between Alex and Tracey.
  • By helping us meet our goal, you will receive some one of a kind items and experiences from Bas Rutten's Elite MMA Gym, from a reusable water bottle, to a month of training with Bas and our fighters, to signed posters from Bas himself!

Our Impact

Cancer organizations are easy to find and easy to donate to, but this is a special case. We want YOU to know that your donation directly affects someone who is battling cancer. Help us give back to our friends and let them know that we are all in their corner!

Other Ways You Can Help

Can't contribute financially? You can still help us out!!

  • Share this campaign with all your friends, on Facebook, Twitter, Instagram.. more traffic gets us more attention, and will help us meet our goal faster!
  • Get in touch with cancer organizations in your area and see how you can help: clothing donation drives, fun runs, etc.

Thank you so much for taking the time to check out our page, and thank you in advance for your donation!
story_txt:
The Fight of a LifetimeOn January 26th, ten fighters from Bas Rutten's Elite MMA Gym will put on an epic mixed martial arts show in Thousand Oaks: The Art of MMA! Before the fights though, we want to help a few members in our community who are fighting a completely different battle.
Alex Magdaleno, a personal trainer and avid marathon enthusiast, just recently started a new round of radiation therapy for paranasal sinus cancer, as well as continually battling chronic lymphoblastic leukemia. Members and staff at Elite worked and worked out with Alex, who gets out of bed and runs an "easy seven miles" when most of us would have thrown in the towel.
Tracey Baumann-Lilley is the mother of one of our very own fighters, Ryan Lilley. While many moms would worry about their son getting into a cage, she is Ryan's biggest fan. She was recently diagnosed with breast cancer, but has Ryan's fighting spirit, and will not be discouraged. She's faced her own fair share of struggles before, and since starting treatment in October, she has been facing chemotherapy like a true champion.
We want to show these two incredible individuals that no one ever fights cancer alone.What We Need & What You GetEven with the best health insurance, medical bills for cancer are insane! Our goal is to help Alex and Tracey lessen the financial burden they face:
We've set a modest goal of $3,000, since we don't have much time before the show.
Whatever money is raised will be split evenly between Alex and Tracey.
By helping us meet our goal, you will receive some one of a kind items and experiences from Bas Rutten's Elite MMA Gym, from a reusable water bottle, to a month of training with Bas and our fighters, to signed posters from Bas himself!
Our ImpactCancer organizations are easy to find and easy to donate to, but this is a special case. We want YOU to know that your donation directly affects someone who is battling cancer. Help us give back to our friends and let them know that we are all in their corner!Other Ways You Can HelpCan't contribute financially? You can still help us out!!
Share this campaign with all your friends, on Facebook, Twitter, Instagram.. more traffic gets us more attention, and will help us meet our goal faster!
Get in touch with cancer organizations in your area and see how you can help: clothing donation drives, fun runs, etc.
Thank you so much for taking the time to check out our page, and thank you in advance for your donation!

story:
UPSWING

What is Upswing?

Upswing in an online marketplace that allows all people (high school students, college students, interview candidates, and more) to connect with others in order to teach, guide, and mentor.  Here at Upswing we refer to experts, teachers, guiders, and mentors (the people giving knowledge) as “Coaches” because they coach others with regard to a specific subject matter.  The people who receive the information here at Upswing are called “Learners.”  

Upswing can be used to share information about all sorts of subjects:

  • Academic tutoring
  • Standardized test preparation
  • Language lessons
  • Interview preparation
  • Legal consulting
  • Image consulting and basically any other type of teaching, guiding, or mentoring a Coach and Learner would like to exchange.  

What happens on Upswing?

When a Learner comes onto our system, we initially ask a series of questions to understand how that person learns best (e.g., visually or through audio? Hour-long discussions or short 15-minute spurts?).

Based upon how the user answers, we match that Learner to a Coach who teaches that same way through our Learner-Coach Matching System (“LCMS”).  This increases the chance that Learners will actually learn what they seek to learn and find their sessions productive.  

Our LCMS also keeps track of what Learners have learned and done in their sessions.  This feature allows Coaches to get a sense of each Learners’ level and progress and thereby pick up exactly where the Learner left off in previous sessions whether it was with the same or a new Coach.  This will help maximize the efficiency of each session. 

Upswing gives anyone struggling with a task or subject the ability to come onto our site and find the perfect coach right away, and then get the information they're looking for through our site. We also provide experts the ability to become coaches on our site, build their own knowledge-sharing business and provide their expertise online.  

Does Upswing ONLY match Learners and Coaches?

We do so much more than that. We have a virtual, real time, interactive white board that Coaches and Learners can both see and write on.  We also allow Coaches and Learners to instant message each other, speak to each other and even video chat with each other in a safe environment without having to meet in person or disclose their personal contact information. Finally, Learners can schedule future sessions with Coaches right there on our system.

Why a marketplace?  Why online? 

One of the best things about Upswing is that it is a marketplace. This means that Learners can come to one central online location to find Coaches marketing their services and interact with the Coaches that meet their needs.  Upswing does not specify what a Coach will charge or who a Learner must work with.  Instead, Upswing allows Learners to choose based upon their own preferences.  This also means that Coaches can set their own rates and hours and decide how much or how little knowledge sharing they want to provide.  They can make a full time job out of it, or do it in their spare time.  Coaches also get to build a name and reputation for themselves through Upswing’s recommendation and rating systems.  This gives Learners the ability to select the Coach that will be a best fit for them based on ratings, price, and other criteria they may prioritize.

By being online, Upswing enables knowledge-sharing to happen between Coaches and Learners all over the world.  If you need to write a term paper on Galapagos ecology, why not get a lesson on Galapagos ecology from a scientist studying in the Galapagos right now?! This is what we want to achieve with Upswing.

Can Upswing help students and education?

Yes!  Upswing brings on-demand tutoring to students online.  In addition, our Learner-Coach Matching System is particularly helpful with academic coaching for educational tutoring type users.  Traditional school students that receive academic tutoring on Upswing, for instance, will be able to easily present information about themselves, their history, progress, learning styles and preferences to their academic Coaches.  This will give these students increased efficiency and personalization in their tutoring sessions because their Coaches will have valuable insight as to how to best help these academic Learners achieve their goals and make sessions as productive as possible.

 

Where did you get this idea?

Well, for starters we love learning and we love sharing what we learn.  We want others to be able to have access to the knowledge and coaching that they need to meet their own personal, professtional, and educational goals.  On top of that, we’re all passionate about education and have personal goals to contribute toward closing the education gap and increasing access to education around the world.  Upswing can do just that – bring education and knowledge to people around the world who want to learn. It’s what drives us.

 

What have you done so far?

Well……we’re glad you asked!  We’ve done a lot.  We created our first platform and used it in nearby public schools. We got great feedback from students and administrators and are happy to report that they love our concept.  We were one of only seven teams chosen out of 40 to present at Google last month.  We presented to almost 400 people.  We were also accepted into Groundwork Labs, a program for high potential, high growth tech-oriented start-ups. We are trying to get our platform into more schools, and, we’ve been hard at work on the next generation of our platform! It’s basically been a whirlwind here at Upswing and we wouldn’t have it any other way.

  

Why Do You Need My Help?

As you can see, we are trying to complete a monumental task, but it's a task we believe will transform education for hundreds of students.

With the money raised here, we will be able to continue working on our Learner-Coach Matching System. We will also be able to offer free tutoring to many students looking for that extra help!

You can help us get there!

 

How can you help?

There are many ways you can help!

  • Contribute!

You can help Upswing move forward by contributing right now!  Any amount will bring us that much closer to our goal and allow us to build out and develop important features and components of our platform.  To show our appreciation and gratitude we can offer the perks at right in exchange for your monetary contributions.

  • Share our Message!

Additionally, you can help by getting the word out about Upswing.  This can be done by telling your friends and colleagues about Upswing, liking Upswing on Facebook and following Upswing on Twitter. 

  • Stay Connected!

Please check out our website and feel free to reach out to us with any comments, questions or suggestions you have.  We want to hear from you.  We want to know how you personally (yes, you!) can get the most out of Upswing, so drop us a line.

 

 

 

 * Top Reasons for Dropping Out: http://www.voxxi.com/academic-performance-stude...

story:
Short Summary

Kaylee is a beautiful, fun, loving, and SUPER SMART 12 year old girl in the 7th grade (and she also happens to be my little sister!) She has been selected by Duke University's Talent Identification Program to attend summer courses for gifted and talented youth! She is an outstanding student and is currently in the National Junior Honor Society.  She also scored a 19 on the ACT at age 12! She is very excited about being chosen to participate in the program and has been awarded a partial scholarship to attend, however, a balance of just over $1,000 remains.  Please donate so that she can go and experience college life!! This experience will be life changing for her and I know it will keep her excited about learning and keep her on the path to college!! 

What We Need & What You Get

$1,000 will pay Kaylee's remaining tuition balance and she'll be able to attend the Duke University TIP summer program.  With your donation, she will be able to spend 3 weeks in an Intensive Mathematics Program, experience a taste of college life, and meet new likeminded friends! 

You will get a warm and fuzzy feeling inside knowing you helped a young, black, and talented female student gain new experiences and stay strong on the path to college! You may also receive one of the perks listed, if you choose! 

All funds donated will go directly towards Kaylee's tuition and directly related expenses.

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you can't donate, please share this with your network!! Thank you so much!!

Kristen (Kaylee's big sister) and Margaret (Kaylee and Kristen's mom)
